description:
Squat n gobble is my go to breakfast spot every time I go to SF. They have multiple locations. They never let me down. Great service and a clean and simply delicious breakfast.

The classic eggs Benedict never fails. I ordered the fried chicken Benedict this time. Ummm freaking delicious! If you don't like it, you must be dead inside. In fact, zombies would think it was delicious too.

You throw in fresh squeezed orange juice and you're set. Walk down the street after and do some shopping or just walk it off. Either way, enjoy.
author: Danny H.

description:
The name should have given me a clue...

Over-priced, sub-par food, poor service, should have gone to IHop or Denny's
author: Darryl D.

description:
This is a great brunch spot. They have a really great menu with lots to choose from. I ordered an eggs Benedict and it was delicious. Their side potatoes have a really good seasoning on them. 

My favorite thing about this place is that patio out the back. It's so cute, feels like a little secret garden.
author: Alex J.

description:
Service: 2
Food: 4
Value: 2

Service was barely there. Food came out super fast, but flagging the attention and actually receiving what you asked for is impossible. My friend was missing sour cream and salsa on her Southwest omelette, which she had to physically walk up to a waiter for because no one came around. She then asked a different waiter for the items after the first waiter didn't come back for 10-15 minutes.

The food was tasty. I got an Alaskan scramble with bite-sized pieces of salmon chunks. It needed a little help from hot sauce, but what egg isn't better with hot sauce? The potatoes are super crispy and well-seasoned. 

My food came out to $18. I thought it was pricey for the quantity and quality of food.
author: Jessica C.

description:
This place is near our house and we will definitely be back despite saying we need to check out all new places and can't go to the same place twice. We will for this spot. 

Be sure to sit out on the back patio if it's a nice day. 

The food is very good and has tons of choices and good portions. There were so many options that I wanted to try but we got one of the scrambles and it was delicious. 

My only knock on this place is the price of alcohol. It seemed high to me compared to other spots. Their carafe of mimosas was $30 whereas I went to another brunch spot the next day and it was $18 there.
author: Matt M.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place out for a while; today we did and it did NOT disappoint. We went on a Saturday around 11am and there were plenty of tables. You order at the front and then take your number to a table and they bring it to you. 

If it's a nice day, SIT outside. If you walk through the main restaurant, go out the door to a somewhat hidden courtyard; this is one of the best parts about this place. It's beautiful, gets tons of sunshine and is absolutely spectacular. 

The food is just as great as everything else. Great portions for a very reasonable price. We got the Santa Fe Scrambler & an omelette and they were both phenomenal.  Portions were huge and all the food was fresh and so so good. We will definitely be back here!!
author: Bethany M.

description:
They say breakfast is the most important meal of the day...well these guys take it seriously. Not only do they serve it all day, they make it amazing. 

The menu has tons of variety and the portions are pretty big. That doesn't mean they take away from the quality but it might mean you will need a nap afterwards!

Eat, sleep, repeat!
author: Gary I.

description: 5 stars for the kind and attentive staff, but the food (especially breakfast) is mediocre for the price. I notice it's carb heavy too. Sides of potatoes and bread - no option for salad - and I recommend getting the omelette instead of the scrambles. More egg and fillings. My Santa Fe scramble today was mainly potatoes and tortilla strips. I felt they skimped on the veggies and I should have ordered a side of chicken apple sausage or bacon. The scramble plus a side of coffee was $20+ before tip. Steep, considering I didn't feel that satisfied after my meal.
author: Elaine W.

description: Stopped in for dinner on a Tuesday night. Only three other parties in the place when we arrived. Ordered the Thai chicken curry and wife ordered the Italian crepe. Took 30 minutes for the food to arrive. Crepe was tasty but barely warm. Waiter delivered my plate at the same time but brought me a pad chicken instead. Took the plate back to the kitchen for exchange and saw probably 3 orders waiting on the counter. My dish was tasty but more potatoes than chicken. Probably won't go back.
author: Ernie R.

description:
Honestly I had gotten kind of bored by standard brunch fare until I came to Squat & Gobble. This place really reminded me why I loved brunch in the first place. 

I sat outside with a dog that I was watching, while my boyfriend went inside to order. I got the Nor Cal omelette with sausage and a wide variety of vegetables, while my boyfriend got the Triple Gobble with pancakes, eggs, and bacon. Both were pretty simple orders, but the dishes were prepared so well that they blew all my expectations out of the water. I would definitely come back and get anything on this menu.
author: Jenny D.

description: Excellent service and the food is exceptional. Steak and Eggs and Breakfast Burrito is a must! ***** Memo Wilson (UK)
author: Temo W.

description: The Thai chicken curry was very good.  Pretty big portions so I was able to split my plate with my wife and we we're both full.  Price is fair for what we got.
author: Joshua B.

description:
I was starving. The roommate wasn't, but he likes feeding me, so we decided to order breakfast on Sunday, July 23rd at 11:53am from Squat & Gobble. Our brunch delivery order arrived via DoorDash at 12:57pm. We live in Outer Richmond.

*Breakfast Burrito: Eggs, chorizo, onions, peppers, avocado, pepper jack cheese, ranchero & green tomatillo sauce, Mexican salsa, served over black bean chili & topped with crispy tortilla strips, no jalapeño sour cream ($12.95)
*Milan Scramble: Italian sausage, spinach, mushrooms, onions, tomatoes & parmesan cheese, topped with pesto sauce, Served over potatoes with your choice of toast ($12.95), Everything Bagel with Cream Cheese (+$1)
*Mini Pancakes: Five silver dollar pancakes, strawberries, powdered sugar & whipped cream ($6.95)
*French Toast Fingers: Strips of French toast, strawberries, powdered sugar & whipped cream ($6.95)

I actually really liked my scramble. All the ingredients melded together really well. I'm not the biggest potato person, so I was a little disappointed when I saw there were so many potatoes. It was hard avoiding them. The most disappointing thing was the bagel I paid extra for. They ended up giving me a plain bagel instead of an everything bagel. I don't really like plain bagels, so I wouldn't have ordered it if I knew that was the case. Not sure who's fault it was, but I told DoorDash and they never really got back to me.

The roommate enjoyed his breakfast burrito. I had a bite of his chorizo and it was tasty. I liked the kid sized french toast and pancakes. It was perfect for sharing between the two of us. The french toast pieces weren't exactly sticks, but you could peel them apart into sticks. The whipped cream in both dishes did suffer from transport as they more or less melted.

Good place to grab breakfast delivery. I was just bummed they gave me the wrong bagel.
author: Elena N.

description:
Glad we chose this spot for breakfast while staying in the Marina District. They have an expansive variety of dishes and flavors (scrambles, omelets, pancakes,crepes, sandwiches, salads, etc.) 
I loved the Zorba the Greek crepe. Served with delicious home fried potatoes. My sister had the chicken eggs Benedict. I had a bite- something was off about the hollandaise. Tasted like salty cheese sauce! I loved that there was a minimal wait for a table on Saturday morning around 11. Its less formal, order at the counter style which is why perhaps the turn around time is a bit faster. Try the fresh squeezed OJ.
author: Liz M.

description: My friend and I came here for Friday lunch and it wasn't too busy. We ordered the croissant sandwich which was solid but nothing memorable. The meal came with a side of potatoes which were a tad too dry for me. Nevertheless, this place has very friendly servers who were all willing to help me out with my wifi  Great outdoor patio! A nice place to relax and enjoy the meal. Will be back some day to try out other items!
author: Sui N.

description:
Me and my friend came for a light bite and this place turns out to be a good pick! It's simple, Low-key, and pretty much diner type food. 

I ordered their Mexican Salad which was grilled chicken with cilantro lime dressing. It was delicious, large in portion, and full of flavor. I loved how they stuffed my bowl and how it got me full fast. If you're on a chestnut and craving a salad, come here because they're huge in portion and priced at $13-$16 which isn't bad because it'll get you full quick. This is probably the best salad I've had in a while too!
author: Allister D.

description: Average food. Our server told us the French fries came very well seasoned but they just had salt and a few stray bits of parsley. The French onion soup was good, it comes with a thick layer of cheese on top that's a little hard to eat around, but worth it if you enjoy cheese. Our service was sweet and the interior has lots of booths you can sit at and work. You have to order before you sit and they bring your food to you.
author: Kulmeher D.

description: My Thai curry was absolutely delicious and I'll definitely stop by again next time I'm in San Fran
author: SheShe S.

description: Well I'm Visiting San Francisco from LA area and I have to say that this place makes some bomb French toast!!! Probably the best French toast Iv ever had!! Me and my boyfriend ordered the Banana,Strawberry and Nutella French toast and it was soo delicious. I also ordered there regular coffee and it was really good also. Kinda on the pricey side but to me it was worth it.
author: Cortney H.

description: Love the breakfast burrito, best bfast burrito in the city for me! Love it- will be back again :D
author: Christine L.

description: Best pesto-type scramble (The Milan) I've ever had. We also really liked the back patio sitting area. We had good service. Only minus for me was the lemonade was just OK. It was right in the middle of sweat and sour and didn't really do much for me.
author: Matt J.

description: I've had hundreds of overpriced fancy salads in San Francisco that were just okay. I keep coming back to the salmon salad here. It has so many flavors that go well together and it's generous. Hands down better than Blue Barn, Mixt, etc.
author: E. N.

description: I've been coming to this location for years. I always get the chicken pesto crepe. It's so good! Just plain coffee is good as well. I love the back patio. It's nice to be outside. There's also two huge tv's... and it's fun to watch sports here. It's much more low key than the bar and the food's always on point. The staff is super nice and attentive as well.
author: Danielle S.

description:
Very disappointed. Today I decided to seat outside. Ordered an onion soup. I ate only half of it. At some point a dirty bird father flew into my soup. 
It goes without saying that with all the deseases and bacteria that could endenger me I decided not to indulge in my soup. 
After about 45 minutes (in the meantime I enjoyed my reading on my PC) a waitress comes. 
She is actually quite nice. I represent to her the bird fether issue and ask her, if possible, if I could get a new half soup since I couldn't finish it due to this circumstance.
She clearly would help me, but she mentions that she would need to get the manager's approval.
After 2 minutes she comes back saying that since I waited 45 minutes I would no longer have the right to my new half soup back.
Basically, I ate half soup and paied for a whole.
I waited for 45 minutes that someone would come to my table to ask: sir, is everything ok? Is there anything we can do for you?
Nobody ever came! Only after 45 minutes, when I was hoping that they would finally help me finish my soup, that I ultimately paid entirely, they presented an argument that me made very disappointed. They made their total lack of customer service, their reason to object my right to eat my soup!
I owned a restaurant for almost 10 years and customer service was my top priority!
A huge disappointment. This is the last time I would ever pay a visit here! Done!
author: Ettore R.

description:
Ambiance: Bustling brunch atmosphere in this medium sized restaurant. Skinny front patio leads into main sitting area. A back patio is just lovely on a nice day (shaded, water fountain, flowers etc). Everything is well decorated, well taken care of, not in the least bit trendy. 

Food: Great selection of breakfast options (including sweet desert crepes and savory lunch crepes). I went with the croissant breakfast sandwich which was delicious as was the everything crepe. Serving size was more than generous.

Price/Service : Great value considering the area. Everyone was very friendly.

Overall: A great middle of the road brunch place when your sick of the Uber expensive and trendy places that dominate this local.
author: Gary K.

description:
Maybe I ordered the wrong thing or maybe my tastebuds were wrong the day I dined here.

Food: My friend and I met up here for dessert out of convenience as she lives in the neighborhood. I ordered the Strawberry Crepe with Nutella. The crepe was thin and sweet, but at room temperature, I wish it had been warmer. The strawberries were fairly unsweet and really bruised. The strawberry sauce was also overly sweet and tasted more like a jam than a sauce. One upside was the side scoop of vanilla ice cream, creamy and rich!

Price: A little pricey, considering the quality of the crepe. 

Ambiance: Spacious, clean and simple. Definitely your old-fashioned diner eatery. 

Service: Staff members were friendly, but unfortunately service was lackluster due mostly to the fact that they were understaffed with a busy house. 

Overall: Crepes at Squat and Gobble are underwhelming and overpriced. I've had better!
author: Astrid Z.

description: Two of the four of us got our food and the other two (soup and a salad) never did. We asked for our money back since we didn't get food and they did refund us but did not explain or apologize.
author: Rosina R.

description:
Found this little gem on Chestnut street in SF while I was wandering my way down to the Golden Gate Bridge and the marina .....I left the hotel around 7am and didn't see many breakfast places open, not even a local coffee shop just Starbucks or Burger King. I was almost swayed by a little donut shop one block back but something told me to keep looking.
Squat and Gobble offers healthy breakfast choices cooked from scratch. There are several vegetarian options, I chose the Eggs Florentine and the famous rosemary garlic potatoes, it was very good.  I also had a cup of coffee, black nothing fancy, and this too was excellent. They have many choices on the menu, prices are fair and you get value for money. Staff is very friendly and attentive. This was an overall A-one experience, I haven't felt the need to eat for the rest of the day, but supper time is approaching......
author: Tony S.

description: I come in all the time for lunch and they never disappoint. I especially love their eggs benedict with a chai latte. The ambiance is so cozy as well.
author: Christian M.

description: Stumbled upon this place as we returned from the marima and it was EVERYTHING.. There was a wide variety of food choices to please any palette. Service was great and the food was delicious. We didnt wait long before hot food came out. The place was clean, neet and had great atmosphere.. We will definitely be returning to try their crepes.
author: Kanoe P.

description: Great hearty food but as an establishment, should be reported to business bureau for advertising different prices than charged. Will not honor prices on menu, even if incorrect in system. Same thing for calling. Try calling in with the order by looking at online menu and your bill will be different. Very bait and switch without letting you know.
author: Ethan M.

description: Rude customer service! Left a camera by accident here and was told it was in the safe. Made a special trip from out of town twice to come get this camera and was treated extremely rude and told the first time there was no access to the safe. Second time I was just told it wasn't there and here was no manager onsite. I called back and was treated HORRIBLE by an employee who yelled at me and hung up on me. When I called again he refused to answer the phone. Called a third time and "manager" who wasn't there two minutes before us suddenly there and camera is no where in sight. RUDE THIEVES! Don't waste your time with this establishment!
author: Kim R.

description: We had just finished the Super Run 5K at the nearby Marina Green so we decided to walk another 1K to S&G.  Good choice too because with 4 grown-ups, an 8-year old and a pair of toddlers in strollers, we did not need to negotiate parking and waiting for food with hungry children.  The food was aight...the French toast was a bit on the dry side and I could only discern one flavor-spicy-on the breakfast burrito.  But we scored patio seating, food came fast and prices were very reasonable.  And for a nice post-meal surprise, the bathroom was clean and piney fresh.
author: Joc V.

description:
This is the first negative review I have ever written, and I was reluctant to do so, but have received no satisfaction to my awful brunch experience.  

I was in San Francisco on business, and met family for brunch at the Squat & Gobble in the Marina.  The restaurant was clean, and the menu was intriguing (although somewhat pricey), but it was the horrific customer service that ruined the entire experience.  I ordered for a party of four, but only three orders were delivered to the table.  When I inquired as to the fourth order, I was told by the cashier that I only ordered three items (this argument pissed me off since I would never have short ordered my lunch party, and surmised the mistake was due to the cashier talking to his co-worker during the entire time I was ordering.  Yet, he still BLAMED ME for the mistake).  

I submitted an order for eggs benedict and our entire party waited until the fourth order arrived (food obviously getting cold).  However, what arrived was eggs Florentine. I complained again, and the cashier's response was "that's what you ordered".  When I emphatically told him it was NOT what I ordered, he responded with "so what do you want me to do about it".  I was stunned at the horrifically rude treatment we all experienced.  I left without any apology, and paid about $75 for the ruined brunch trip.  I later called and emailed the owner, but one week later, have still not received a reply.  If I could leave less than 1 star, it would be well deserved for this restaurant.   If you want to be treated poorly than try this place.
author: David B.

description: We ordered food online through the Grubhub.  I got the Asian Chicken salad and also an order of the classic lasagna.  Both were amazing.  The order was delivered as promised.  Great service, would highly recommend.
author: Mary R.

description:
This place is great if you are looking for a casual breakfast.

Great location, great atmosphere, SUPER cute outdoor patio in the back. I like that you can order at the counter and sit down to eat.

I got the salmon scramble. It was HUGE. Came with potatoes and toast, and probably 3 eggs with smoked salmon. 

Great place to take people who are visiting, as it's super cute.
author: Jenna G.

description: This place is perfect if you want to have a fast and tasty breakfast or brunch. The service was really quick, and the plates were big enough to fullfill our stomach. I particularly liked their pot of tea, I had the green tea tropical  and it was delicious and refreshing, my friends also liked the freshly pressed orange juice . On top of that, the staff were really friendly and helpful, they helped me understood the menu because I'm not a native speaker. All in all, this breakfast place deserve a 5 stars for their good food and service!
author: Liberte F.

description: First experience was great second staff was all over the place and food wasn't made correctly had to send back 3 plates I hope they get it together the next time I go.
author: Mercedes A.

description:
A hidden breakfast/brunch gem in the Marina. The back patio is my favorite thing about Squat & Gobble. I have been multiple times on Saturday's and there is always open seating in the back patio and it feels like you escaped the hectic Marina for a bit. The line always looks long to order at the counter, but it moves very quickly. 

My go-to order is the crab cake eggs benny, extremely filling and can definitely be shared! The staff is very attentive and friendly. 

If you are feeling up for it, they have mimosa's by the champagne bottle and bring it chilled to your table.
author: Morgan W.

description:
Easy, fast, fair priced. 

My favorite meal is the Huevos rancheros. 
Second would be the Greek crepe. 
 
I would not recommend the salmon anything. 

My boyfriend gets the strawberry banana Nutella pancakes with no Nutella and extra whipped cream every time- so soft and fluffy! 

Chai tea is exceptional
Coffee is a bit flat 

I enjoy the water on the table as well as extra napkins and silverware. 

Extra seating in the ally and in the back! So don't fret if it looks crowded.
author: Carly A.

description: This was a Friday brunch and, with the great weather, we had a chance to sit in the courtyard. The service was great and quick and our meal was excellent and filling. I had the Nor'Cal omelet and I would try it again.
author: Brandan W.

description: This place has great potential due to its location.  However, needs a lot of work.  Place wasn't too busy and prices were reasonable.  Service was mediocre at best and food quality wasn't great.  We ordered a simple dish of egg whites w/ onion. They couldn't get it right.  Mistakes happen - I get it.  But, the service recovery wasn't very good.
author: Russ M.

description: Food is good a bit over priced and I'm not a cheapo. I don't recommend the salmon salad.  The salmon was dry and the Gorgonzola was overkill.  The restaurant is clean and the staff is friendly.  I'd order crepes or breakfast food before lunch.
author: Wendy B.

description:
Wish I could rate them higher because their menu looks great. 
Unfortunately it ends up being very expensive for a meal. Two entrees and side of bacon came to $45. I wouldn't have minded too much but my Benedict was not edible. The hollandaise tasted spoiled and within a minute of eating it I felt sick. 

Would not recommend.
author: Alec W.

description:
Very nice staff. But sweet crepes were really not great ... 
I had ordered a simple crepe with nutella strawberries and blueberries. There were way too many blueberries, not enough nutella and very few strawberries. Besides fruits were kind of hot. 
There should be more nutella, less blueberries, more strawberries and not hot. 

I had asked no strawberry sauce, and the crepe had a lot of it ... 
My husband also didn't like his crepe ...
author: Hanna Z.

description:
Yo Yo Yo: Grade A:
 What I like about this place is you line up, order, pay and then sit down and they bring out the food! They were so fast and the food is really good. My buddy had a BM or Bloody Mary.  I had 2 eggs, toast, bacon.  Just what I needed and very good. My wife had oatmeal- she said it was good but not for me. That is why I am a bit (just a wee) overweight. Go Seek and Have fun. Later.
author: Bill M.

description:
This is a good go to place in SF when you are meeting up with friends and want to have plenty of menu variety. It's great for groups because everyone can order their own thing and menu varies from crepes and breakfast food to sandwiches, salads and pastas. 

I tend to end up here for breakfasts, but everything I've had is pretty satisfying and doesn't usually disappoint. Scrambles are usually crowd pleaders. Portion sizes are also pretty generous. I can easily split a meal with a friend.
author: Tiffany W.

description: One of my favorite places in the city every meal is a delight! Having my favorite breakfast burrito today! Love the black beans, Caesar salads and all breakfast items! One of the best !
author: Paul D.

description:
Absolutely recommend. They have everything from crepes to Asian fusion, eggs Benedict to Italian dishes. If you're an orange juice connoisseur like me, this is THE BEST orange juice I've ever tasted (and trust me, that is a statement). Could be liquid gold from the gods. And the iced coffee had me bright eyed and bushy tailed for the whole day. A+ all around in food quality and selection. The only part where I was slightly disappointed was the service... on a morning when I was really (and I mean REALLY) hungry, I ordered the pancakes with fruit and Nutella. Not once, not twice, but three times I clarified what I wanted to order for my waiter and he repeated it back to me, so naturally I thought I would get what I expected. Unfortunately, I received nuts instead of Nutella so there was a pretty clear language barrier there. I even asked how big the cups were for a small orange juice and he didn't understand I was asking a question instead of ordering one. All of the staff otherwise were very kind and quickly fixed my order, hence why I still give it five stars. That, and I was just a bit hangry that morning when my order got messed up so I'm sure I wasn't the most ~pleasant~. Not to mention, I could have sworn they laced their pancakes with ecstasy because I felt so happy, I almost felt high. I kid you not. Best pancakes ever, and I don't throw the words "best ever" out too often. Meals in the morning, noon or night, it's an A+ in my book.

P.S.
Mimosas.
author: Nikki F.

description:
We walked around Chestnut Street looking around for a place to eat for lunch and came across this one. I wasn't really feeling crepes, but saw they had plenty of other options so I ordered the Reuben sandwich which I really liked. I'm not sure what the others in my party ordered, but they really enjoyed what they got.

They have indoor and outdoor seating. We decided to sit outside since it was a nice day out and were surprised to see how nice the large patio area was. It got a little warm while we were sitting out there, and we moved around to stay in the shade as much as possible. One of the servers came over and asked us if it was too hot and then pushed a button to extend the covering above us. That was a really nice gesture! I'm glad that they had the covering - it really cooled it down for us. I felt like I was in some little European village in the patio. There was a nice little fountain running on the side and they played soothing music in the background. 

For 3 people, the bill came out to about $45 with a lemonade. Pretty average for the area. The Marina is a very nice area of San Francisco and there's free parking on the streets adjacent to Chestnut on the weekends. 

 Glad we came across this place!
author: Andrew P.

description:
After an exceptionally long morning, my cousin and I stopped here for a bite to rejuvenate from a rough cross-country plane ride. We had one goal: brunch.

O. M. G. I never say OMG, so that is saying a lot. This place had me immediately at the word "crepery." Let that sink in: CREPERY. In this bright and open restaurant, you order your food at the counter and they bring it to your table. I doubt I will ever, anywhere find a place with such personable and fast brunch service. From the time we sat down to eat, it had maybe been 10 minutes. The restaurant is bistro style, with plenty of natural sunlight, indoor seating and an outdoor patio.

The crab cake florentine is a dreamy, creamy plate of brunch goodness. The hollandaise is so rich and bold, that when combined with the juicy crab cakes, literally melts in your mouth. The portion sizes were incredibly generous, and while the prices were a bit higher, they are completely justified. We also split a strawberry nutella crepe, which was served with fresh whipped cream. The crepe is as big as the plate, so be prepared to fall in love.

I will be dreaming about this brunch all the way back to Cleveland!
author: Lauren K.

description:
Came here for a 2 o'clock lunch with my friends in San Fransisco with my friends. The counter order style makes for a little bit of time before you sit down but in the end I think it ends up saving your time in the wrong run. The patio outside is SO CUTE. There are two large screen tvs outside and there is a retractable electric roof (idk how else to describe it -it is made of an awning material) but keeps a decent amount of sun inside but not hot.

I ordered the Gobble club and stilla beer with a side mixed green salad. The raspberry condiment on the salad I wasn't entirely sure of but the sandwich was delicious.
My friends sandwich was the salmon club which looked delectable.
author: Annie G.

description:
I like the simplicity and convenience of Squat & Gobble. The menu has some variation, but it is not overwhelming. You place your order with the cashier when you are ready, and then a server brings it out to you. The tables are fairly spacious and there is some outdoor seating. 

We shared the croissant sandwich for breakfast. It was very savory. The sandwich came with a side of home fries. The home fries were crispy and well seasoned. I'd recommend a side of home fries if your dish does not come with one.
author: Joseph T.

description:
A very nice, friendly, comfortable place to get a good breakfast or lunch.

The menu has a good variety of breakfast items, sandwiches and burgers. There are savory and sweet crepes, as well. 

The French Onion Soup was outstanding. The French Toast was very good and had lots of strawberries. The Blueberry Pancakes were fine, although I would have preferred to have fresh blueberries, rather than the overly sweet compote. 

The lemonade and chocolate milk were good and the refillable bottles of water for the table were a nice touch and environmentally friendly, too. I was surprised that the iced cappuccino I ordered was served warm in a traditional cappuccino cup. I asked for a glass of ice and fixed it myself.

Service was friendly and the food was prepared promptly. The inside was clean, nicely furnished, and well kept.
author: William M.

description:
The first time I came here, I was excited to see they have a lot of snacks I'm into. Michael Jackson was also playing on their radio, which always gets me in a good mood. Their salmon scramble is amazing, and comes with so much food. I guarantee you'll be full. The burgers are also good, as is the cake they serve. I usually get the salmon, carrot cake and a cappuccino. 

The staff is always attentive and refreshes your drinks without being asked. Such a cozy feel when you need a good lunch or breakfast.
author: L H.

description:
Exceeded expectations for out of town visitors!!! Since our time here in San Francisco, we've spent on average $50 on a meal whether breakfast, lunch, or dinner. And that's even at the run of the mill eats that we visit in Florida like Waffle House...or down at Fishermans Warf eating local crab sandwhiches and drinking a coke...so I recommend investing the time and experience in a local eatery like Squat and Gobble if you're from out of town. 

PRICE$: Reasonable considering the average cost of eating out at local eateries and run of mil places like Waffle House

AMBIANCE: Quaint, local feel. Simple.We visited on Monday. Avoid weekends if possible because it's too busy with everyone off from work for the weekend. Passing by on the weekend, it was super busy but we knew we had to eat here.

QUALITY: Excellent. We had Eggs Florintine. It was delicious and a local favorite. All the ingredients were fresh right down to the freshly squeezed orange juice. It was also a bigger serving size than anticipated. We left completed satiated. It was worth the price. 

SERVICE: Excellent. It was timely!!! Service was given with a smile too!!! Important! Even the cook who brought out or food smiled and seemed to enjoy her profession which made me feel much like a guest. Thank you!
author: Gabriel K.

description: Disappointed to say the least. It only gets 3 stars ( vs 1) as one of their long time servers was apologetic for both the poor service and the changed menu which has taken all flavor out of what used to be my favorite kale salad. Not returning.
author: debbie w.

description:
Came for brunch on a hot Sunday afternoon with a girlfriend. It's definitely a poppin' spot as all tables were filled and there was a line to order food. The wait wasn't long, and by the time we ordered our food we only waited a few minutes before some kind souls offered their table. Indoor and streetside seating available! The restaurant opened out all its windows so it had an open-air vibe. Only downside was that some of the outdoor seating areas did not have an umbrella or some way to provide shade.

They have a lot of options to choose from, but I ultimately choose the bourban omelette and a lemonade. The lemonade was on the lighter side, which I liked since it didn't feel sickly concentrated.

The omelette now... let me tell you now that they don't skimp on food. I knew they were generous as I saw the size of the steak salad that was brought out for another customer. I am a big eater, and I typically eat until I'm stuffed up to the neck. I couldn't finish my food though, as delicious as it was. I struggled to eat half of the omelette, and the potatoes - as bomb as they were, I barely finished. Maybe it was the grossly hot and humid weather that messed up my appetite. 

The omelette was stuffed, and almost the size of two fists. The potatoes were seasoned really well, to the point where I didn't need my usual ketchup and tapatio. 

I would come here again to challenge the omelette. You may have won the battle but the war has just started..
author: Sherry Y.

description:
Can you believe that kids eat free here Mon-Thu? That's awesome! We had a party of 14 come here for dinner two nights in a week and we're lucky to use the kids eat free menu during one of our visits. This saved a good $30 for 4 young kids. Setting is casual too for kids to play without causing too much disruption to the ambience. 

I ordered the prawns broth & noodle bowl twice. It was so delicious the first time, I had to order it again a second time. The dish turned out a bit different, perhaps consistency is difficult between different chefs - My second order had far fewer shrimps, more veggies and fewer noodles. I was probably better off with more veggies than noodle carbs, but I was disappointed about the missing shrimp. Broth was consistent to the prior order and I still enjoyed the dish. So not deal breaker. I look forward to returning to order this a third time. 

Oh, I should mention that this restaurant does not have a liquor license so we couldn't enjoy margaritas. Wine is $9 a glass. That's ridiculous given the entree price ranges on the menu ($10-15), the style of wine glass (regular tableware) and the casual setting of the restaurant. This means I won't drink here.
author: Jenn J.

description:
Three star rating still sticking. And here's why. 
While the portions are BIG and the patio provides a super good time (on a sunny day), you CANNOT help but notice the price doesn't match the quality nor service. 

My Mediterranean "special" salad was consistent today, but the cup of soup for $5 was sad and I was disgusted to have paid the price for it. but what can you do at that point. When I asked if the lentil and spinach salad was vegetarian, I got an unconfident "of course". uh... OK so that's a "probably". 

I would not frequent here routinely. It's a spot to hit up out of convenience and hunger.
author: Kim D.

description: Such a cute cute brunch patio! Food was good! Loved the ambience so much-the fountains, lights, greenery and stone walls, lovely!
author: Shivani M.

description: Nothing special...we went here for brunch and food wasn't bad but I think there are definitely better places in the area. I got the Florentine benedict and my friend got the thai chicken salad. It was quick and convenient and probably the cheapest option for a sit down brunch...but I would've spent the extra few dollars and gone elsewhere.
author: Hannah S.

description:
It's hard to find a great breakfast place in the marina area, but Squat & Gobble was so much better then I expected! It's got a large menu with everything including omelettes, egg scrambles, crepes, and sandwiches!

I ordered the Santa Fe scramble (which comes with a side of toast, and served over potatoes). The portions are quite large and I could have easily split (and it was only $13). You order at the counter and then the waiter comes to bring your food. I'd definitely come back again!
author: Jennifer C.

description: We love their breakfasts! The breakfast burrito is huge and delicious! Their mimosas use fresh orange juice and are very good as well!! The back courtyard seating area is beautiful, so I recommend sitting there, rather than in the restaurant. The only reason I gave a 4 Star, instead of 5, was that the food was cold this morning and they didn't provide butter with the pancakes. However, upon asking to have the burrito heated up, it was great!
author: Jaime B.

description:
Squat & Gobble is a nice place to eat. 
I always order the Philly Cheesesteak crepes with French Fries and I'm never disapointed. 
The interior has a great atmosphere and service is good.
author: Michael T.

description:
What happened to the brand?   Went to S&G a few years ago in other locations and it was ALWATS great food, good quality and generous portions. 
Not this time.  
I had the most disappointing $18 burger ever. 
The bacon was fatty and cold, the onions on top were cold, they asked how I wanted it cooked and there is only one way it can be cooked because the patty was so thin.  My request for medium cook was a joke. Reminded me of Burger King.The only difference was that the bun was toasted.   
The fries? Edible. Almost sent the whole thing back to just skip the experience, but I was hungry.    
The staff was kind and helpful.  
Go elsewhere if you want good food. Overpriced and they under deliver
author: Angie D.

description: We just received our food and the crepes were disgusting. They tasted like onions, which does not meet the description whatsoever. I have never complained about a delivery order before, but this was ridiculous. It tasted as though the fruit in the crepe was cut with the same knife as an onion. I could only eat two bites, then had to throw the very expensive crepe out.
author: Isabelle G.

description: A little overpriced but a great place to grab an omelette and coffee on a Saturday morning in the Marina. The menu is surprisingly humongous -- pasta, Asian and sandwiches
author: Kevin J.

description:
Really disappointing experience, regardless of the price, (it was very pricey) and my standards are not particularly high. Went to breakfast Friday morning with a friend, paid $13.95 for a Santa Fe scramble and he had an omelette and a coffee, total bill almost $40. The food quality was unacceptable. The breakfast potatoes are made hours earlier, or possibly the day before, and left in a tray until needed. They were cold and dry, and constituted 50% of the food on the plate. The scramble itself was only slightly over room temperature and very sloppily prepared, with what tasted like stale tortilla chips and a strange black bean mixture.

The food was bad enough that I spoke to the manager (something I rarely do) and he willingly replaced the dish, but with the same bad potatoes only thrown into a microwave. They literally do not have and will not make fresh breakfast potatoes, even when asked!

Having lived in San Francisco for several decades I am used to overpriced restaurants and marginal food, however spending $13.95 for a poorly done and pre-made breakfast caused me to snap and put the effort in to write this review. S&G does have a comfortable dining room but management and ownership better wake up and realize that even in San Francisco people want some value for their money.
author: Mike K.

description: This places breakfast was absolutely amazing, would recommend it to anyone I knew. Anytime I'm back in the Bay area I'll be stopping in.
author: Eric P.

description:
Came here for a late lunch. 

Pros:
Super nice and friendly staff
Plenty of seating when I was there
Clean restroom

Cons:
The food, ordered a pasta, pretty much the worse I've had in a while and for $14!
author: Simon C.

description:
Squat and Gobble is such a nice casual cafe in Castro. The food is good. And the space is nice for afternoon brunch, a place you can truly enjoy San Francisco's weather, with a cup of coffee....and pasta and pastries. 

It's right under Lookout which is a bar. so if you sit outside, you'll get to enjoy interesting people coming in and out of the entrance (Ex. Drag queens)

I had the chicken pappardelle, which was delicious. I like thick noodles with cream sauce (which wasn't too heavy)

Staff was very kind, and checked up on me and somehow knew when I needed more coffee. 

I definitely would drop by again.
author: Thomas K.

description:
Stopped here for lunch after hanging out at the Palace of Fine Arts and was pleasantly surprised. The interior of this place is dull-- it reminds me of a Las Vegas casino buffet. It looks cheap and generic but their menu had enough options for the girlfriends and I to all find something we could agree to.

You order and pay at the register and then a waiter delivers your food & drinks. I ordered the Veggie Black Bean Chili since it had a star next to it as a customer favorite and my girlfriends ordered the Chinese Chicken Salad, one with chicken and the other substituted avocado for the chicken.

My soup was surprising for two reasons: 1) it was really really good! It had this amazing homestyle, mom made it like quality to it. I was expecting average but I really really loved this soup 2) There was chicken in it. Now I'm not vegetarian so it wasn't a big deal for me, but the soup is listed on the menu as a 'Veggie Black Bean Chili' so vegetarians beware! The girls both loved their salad and the portions were pretty big for salad so they both left satisfied.

Prices are reasonable especially relative to the portion size and the service is minimal but very polite if that makes sense. Definitely a great lunch spot for this area!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Absolutely wonderful place.

Stumbled upon this place when I was looking for something to eat, and liked the menu options. There's a good array of breakfast options (which is served all day) and also salads, burgers, sandwhiches.. Ect.

I ordered the salmon sandwhich with garlic fries. Also a cappuccino. (Carrot cake was looking pretty good to; I'm a sucker for carrot cake.) everything was brought out quickly. The salmon was definitely not skimpy, and garlic fries were very crisp. A very good lunch, and would repeat whenever I'm in the area.
author: Melissa S.

description: Cute little place with a French feel - love the out door sitting and the food his fantastic!
author: Gary G.

description:
I love this place.  There are so many menu choices -- breakfast, brunch, crepes, sandwiches, salads, pastas.  They serve nice size portions and service is fast and the food served hot

The patio is beautiful, and especially nice if you want to bring your leashed dog, since they allow pets in the patio, which you can get to via a side entrance.

This restaurant is one of the best in the neighborhood. I would guess everything on the menu is  a good choice.
author: Lois L.

description: I went here for breakfast and it was pretty good. They had good portions and fast service. I probably wouldn't come back, but that's just because there are better places to go, not because it was bad.
author: Isabel G.

description: Great spot for breakfast and brunch! The menu on the wall makes it so easy to choose what you want to eat. I had the eggs Benedict with was very good, and my boyfriend had the croissant sandwich, and that was super yummy. Absolutely recommend stopping by here if your in the area!
author: Kaila B.

description: Friendly, relaxed and casual atmosphere with good service. I enjoyed the breakfast burrito. It reminded me more of a wet-style burrito than a traditional chorizo-heavy breakfast burrito, but I enjoyed it. Seems like a good place to take small kids and/or a large group.
author: William W.

description:
We want there about 7 months ago and had a great experience. The ladies at the counter were super friendly. 
This morning we went there. The guy at the counter was rude and the food gave us both stomach problems.  We had to send our orange juice back because it had something nasty floating in it (not pulp). 
We were both very disappointed. Never going back.
author: Don E.

description:
What's up with the Marina's lunch options? Aside from the Sandwich Spot I'm having a tough time finding good food around here... 

Squat & Gobble has a very eclectic menu encompassing salads, fresh squeezed juice, burgers, crepes, and wait for it... chinese food. Whenever I come across these places I ask myself, could they make all of those types of foods well? The answer is typically no. In Squat & Gobble's case, it's a definite no. 

I ordered the Mexican Grilled Chicken Salad. The portion was enormous (no wonder America is struggling with obesity). The ingredients themselves also (avocado, cheese, beans, crunchy things, tomatoes, lettuce, chicken) tasted super bland. Can't say the overpriced menu or the outdated decor added anything either... all very meh.

Overall, I do not want to squat, nor will I gobble.
author: Nicole W.

description:
The atmosphere has a bistro vibe to it. I think the drinks were a bit overpriced ($7.50 for a mimosa) and their bloody Mary's were made with sake which I found odd.... Both are reasons which I passed on the alcoholic beverage. 
I ordered a burger medium with cheddar cheese, a Coke, water and fries with a side of mayo. The burger was cooked perfectly fries tasted fresh and hot. The reason for only 3 stars....the service. 
They forgot the side of mayo (it happens) but my water was empty when I reminded her and she didn't offer to refill or automatically refill or even give me a chance to request a refill. Soda- same thing. If the place was busy, I could understand however, with 4 people standing behind the counter chit chatting, it was less than acceptable.
author: Jamie S.

description: The fruity nutella was sweet, savory and just erupted in my mouth in a cornucopia of utopian sensations!
author: elson l.

description:
Food is average, well-priced and big portions. Staff is friendly, it's a cozy environment and nice for a quick sit-down meal. 

Love the kids eat free Monday's!
author: Sarah G.

description:
Well, we ordered the tropical Nutella crepe but the berry and banana Nutella crepe came out instead.  Minus a star for wrong order.

But we ate it anyway and it was delicious.  We ate it outside with tea and coffee.  Cute little feeling of A European cafe.

Too noisy inside - louder than chestnut at outside!  Go figure.

I'd come again for that darn crepe.  Maybe ill try the tropical one next...
author: Jessy B.

description: Well this was the nastiest crab cake I have ever tasted in my life. I asked for the crab Florentine and I got eggs that were good but the main course of the dinner was horrible. You're not supposed to put sugar  with crab...crab is sweet.. I wanted to walk back and throw it at the chef
author: Christopher W.

description: It's fast, there's street side tables, even a little ally patio area which is all nice. However, the food is meah, mediocre and way to expensive. Two of us had a basic egg breakfast and coffee. For that we paid 42 usd.
author: Mark B.

description: Pretty good breakfast place. I got the croissant sandwich and a chai latte. The chai latte was really good, and you got a good amount for the price. The croissant was good, however it was pretty expensive, and it was quite a large portion, so large that I couldn't finish it. If I had known it would be that large, I would've split it with my sister.
author: Makenzie W.

description: I am devastated!  I have been coming to squat and gobble at either the haight street location or the chestnut location for 20 years and have always gotten and loved the Florentine Crepe.  I came today to discover that 2 weeks ago they changed the menu and removed my old standard.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Sat down outside had to clean/buss my own table. Ordered a side of scrambled eggs and a side of bacon. Fresh squeezed orange juice on the side was great. 
Eggs : came out cold 
Bacon: looked as though it had been cooked a week ago.. warm but seemingly frozen
author: Marella A.

description:
Highchairs and booster seats. Changing table outside of bathroom! No wait!

Roomy enough for a stroller. Kids menu available, all item $6.95.  They serve beer and wine for adults (of course)
author: Lorissa A.

description:
I don't post many reviews, only when I have had a really good/bad experience. Unfortunately this is the latter. 
I have been coming here for over 10 years and I think they just stopped trying. I got French toast with chicken apple sausage, scrambled eggs and a mimosa. Pretty basic. What arrived was what I ordered, minus the mimosa, water and any silverware. The French toast was tough, the sausages were tiny and tough as jerky. The scrambled eggs were the only palatable part of the meal. 
5 minutes into staring at my food, silverware arrived. 15 minutes later, my mimosa and water arrived. Not a happy diner.
author: Chuck N.

description:
I went here with a few friends in town on a Monday early afternoon. We were all really hungry and just needed a place to eat and this place looked cute and had a number of options food wise. We waited in line to order our food and everyone was very friendly but they did seem a bit understaffed. The line was moving very slow (or maybe we were just extremely hungry...)

Once we ordered our food, we sat down at a little table outside. It felt like ages until we were actually served our drinks...water, coffee, orange juice - my friend also ordered an iced coffee but was brought a hot coffee - the service had taken so long though that she just decided to just keep the hot coffee that was brought to her. The server was very nice though and offered to grab the iced coffee that she had originally ordered. That being said, the orange juice was AMAZING. probably one of the best fresh squeezed glasses of orange juice i've ever had.

The food came out awhile after that. One of my friends and I ordered the same thing - the breakfast burrito, while my other friend ordered the Mexican salad. Everyone seemed to enjoy their food. I was not a huge fan to be honest. I personally do not like "wet" burritos....they really gross me out and i had no idea this was going to be a wet one. It was completely covered in salsa, beans, etc. so there was no way to pick it up without making a huge mess. 

I would come back and try a crepe, maybe. Don't know if that will happen anytime in the near future though.
author: Ilana B.

description: Lunch at Squat & Gobble is pretty straightforward with not too much fanfare.  I came here for a group lunch and it was great for our group of 12 where everyone paid for themselves.  The messiness of splitting a check that big gets complicated so having everyone order independently was great.  The menu theme here is confusing since it has a whole slew of options ranging from breakfast to Asian stir fry.  In any case, I got their chicken salad and it was a HUGE plate of vegetables. While there wasn't anything offensive about here, there also wasn't a lot that was memorable.
author: Lisa I.

description: I love this cafe.  The menu varies from different types of crepes to pastas to burgers and they have some awesome salads.  I was in SF for a week and found myself eating here 3 separate times.  I ordered the Mexican salad, spicy Italian pasta, and the Philly Cheese Steak Crepes.  Everything was fantastic.  My favorite was the salad (It is a HUGE salad BTW"  and the pasta came in 3rd.  It lacked a bit of flavor and there wasn't much of a sauce on it, which I expected.  That being said, this place became one of my favorite places to enjoy a meal, for sure!  I would highly recommend this place to anyone that has the opportunity.
author: Brian H.

description:
Place was nicely lit and pleasantly warm inside, which was great, considering it was a little chilly outside early that evening.  You have to order first before getting a table.

Nice menu selection for crepes and breakfast food.  I was surprised to see a menu list devoted to wok-style food.  

We tried their reuben sandwich and crepes.  Both dishes were so-so.  The crepes were like very thin pancakes and simply lacked taste. The side of fruit that came along with it were disappointing.  The melon slices were quite hard to bite into.  It was probably still unripe. On the other hand, the reuben was ok and the side of fries were warm with a nice crisp.

It was worth trying out but definitely not worth returning.
author: Joey Z.

description: Love the outdoor seating and varied menu. Perfect for a large group or extended family.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Rude cachier, subpar service. Sunday 3pm.
We didn't even had a chance to try the food.
Cancelled our order after 30 minute wait. The cachier nor the manager didn't even ask why we cancelling, looks like they didnt care.
author: Tamar P.

description:
We were going to this place for 6 years and usually had decent food. However, after today's visit I think we will stop coming here for a while. 

Here are a few complaints about today's visit:
- I ordered crepe Zorba the Greek (probably 10th time I order it here). Today it was cold inside - they didn't cook it enough time to heat up the ingredients. 
- My wife ordered a Mexican dish with side of fruit however they brought potatoes instead
- we ordered Teriaky chicken for my son. However the rice was stuck together and hard like rock creating a chocking hazard for a toddler.
author: Mikhail T.

description:
Terrible service, cold food. 

My hot chocolate arrived cold. Then my lasagna arrived cold. The took it back to reheat and after 1/2 hr. it never came back. The employees never apologized and seemed indifferent.
author: Dave S.

description: I visited the Marina location in November and was very pleased with the food and service.  I don't even live in California, I was visiting from Arizona which is why this is concerning - when going through my bank statements I saw that I got charged AGAIN on December 7th and December 11th for the same price of my meal in November!  There are no "reimbursements" for either charge at a later date (which I know sometimes happens with some companies for some reason)... I keep trying to submit a comment on their website, but it doesn't even allow the comment to go through, the page crashes every time... Sneaky sneaky.  It's too bad, because the food is awesome. If you go here, pay cash to be safe.  My card numbers are clearly still floating around back there.
author: Hailey M.

description: Wow so sad to see my favorite go to breakfast place go down the tubes. You always hear this from older people about restaurants that used to be great ect. At one time I considered this the best breakfast in sf. The last few times I see them getting cheaper and cheaper and cutting corners more and more. The last time was the last straw. They don't slice green and red peppers anymore their perfectly cubed from a can like dennys. The amazing fresh squeezed orange juice they used to have from hasn't been around in a year they used to have small dark orange Cali oranges now they don't even have the machine running. They have it "already squeezed" when you come in and it's yellow and watered down very acidic obviously cheap Florida oranges!? The aqua Panna Italian water no more now they have the cheapest plastic bottled water from a local wholesaler. The French toast and pancakes come out without butter and if you ask they brink little individual butter packets that are cold so you can't spread it instead of spreadable butter in a suace container from the kitchen like any good restaurant. The English muffins are burnt on one side and raw on the other have had to send them back multiple times. This sucks because like I said this place was amazing hopefully the owner sees what is happening here and puts a stop to it before it's too late because this place now is the same as eating at the hotel or dennys.
author: Mike S.

description:
Let me start by saying I love the back patio on a nice day. You can't beat the atmosphere for a Saturday morning breakfast with friends. But I guess atmosphere has a price. The food is good, but not good enough to warrant the premium that you have to pay. 

Today I ordered the Castro omelette and a coffee. The total was about 20$. Also the playlist this morning consists of a Lifehouse song from the year 2000 and Adele - awful.
author: Sean P.

description: Great place for brunch, very good food, excellent coffee,  reasonable prices and good service. Definitely come back again.
author: Bill S.

description: HEALTH HAZARD!!!! All three of us got sick from eating here. I should've trusted my instinct after seeing the restaurant and glancing at their kitchen but didn't want to be that annoying person in the group. Guess what... we all got food poisoning!
author: City T.

description:
Squat and Gobble... what exactly are we talking about here?! Haha, so my mind tends to go straight to the gutter.  A N Y W A Y ... Bobby L. and I were on the lookout for dessert after a fulfilling meal at Chotto down the street, and were pleased Squat & Gobble was still open.

The **Strawberry (+Banana) Nutella Crepe** is sinful. Nutella oozing all over those sugary fruits is a wonderful and welcome sight. What a comforting dessert. One of these can easily feed 2-3 people. We were stuffed!

In terms of ambiance, the first thing we noticed as we walked in was the strange diner vibe, one we weren't expecting in the Marina district. Maybe this is better during the day, and I'll have to come back and try the brunch. But for a post-dinner experience this gets 3.5 stars. 

DATE TIP: Be aware of your audience -- know your date well before bringing them here. Once they see the name of the place, you'll either get lucky or a huge slap across the face.
author: Denise L.

description: Great little breakfast place!  Large portions. I had oatmeal with apple compote and walnuts. My husband had the NorCal omelette.  Both were huge and tasty. Good service
author: Catherine W.

description: I love the Marina and the variety of restaurants in it. I have never tried Squat and Gobble, so last month as I was passing by, I decided to try it out. The menu immediately grabbed my attention. The "Bourbon Street" omelette was more than I expected. For one, it's bigger than any other omelette that I've ever had and tastier too. The mixture of spicy sausage, vegetables and cheese covered with Cajun aioli was an amazing flavor explosion and it paired well with their diced rosemary potatoes. Their lemonade was a perfect combination of sweet-tart and to end my meal, I had their "mud" brownie. So moist and chocolatey and it was served with a homemade whipped cream. Everything was perfect and their staff was very friendly and provided amazing service!
author: Jonnathan B.

description: Bell pepper ratio was all off. Not horrible but not good. Wouldn't order again.
author: Siofra C.

description: This place is just ok.  We are in from out of town and this place was highly recommended.  Our eggs were cold and bland, the coffee was so thick and strong it was undrinkable.  My daughter got the Hangover Crepe, it was decent but super greasy.  The fruit was from a bucket, not fresh fruit.  The sour dough was hard as a rock.  I was hoping for fresher ingredients, warm food, and a cup of coffee I could drink.  Instead we spent 70$ on a breakfast we just choked down.
author: Casey S.

description:
Service seems like it should be efficient, but the order in which we got our food was ridiculous. 3 of us ordered together and we all ordered the exact same thing. Strike 1: Our dessert came out immediately, instead of at the end of our meal. Strike 2: only one of the meals came out in a normal amount of waiting time, despite the fact that we all ordered the exact same thing. Strike 3: we had to wait 40 minutes for another one of our orders to show up to our table. Strike 4: they completely just forgot about the third order, so they had to ask us 4 separate times what the missing order was. Strike 5: we all ate our meals separately. Nice staff, but they are so unorganized and terribly inconsistent and erratic delivery of the food.

Probably won't come back, even though the food was fine.
author: KC W.

description:
Here at one of my very places in the world to eat; introducing my sister from London and her kids to Squat and Gobble. 

Such a disappointment that Karen who was taking orders forgot to put on a smile but definitely brought her can't do attitude. Such a bummer. #lifelongcustomerdissappointed
author: Jennifer B.

description:
It is pretty good for breakfast and brunch. Casual. Cafeteria style service. I love the freshly squeezed orange juice. It is a big 12 oz glass. 

They serve both savory and sweet crepe. My group had breakfast here before heading out to Golden Gate Bridge and napa valley. The breakfast is heavy enough to sustain us until late afternoon. We won't waste time for lunch in napa. Most tasting and wineries will close at 5.
author: Ann K.

description: I recently came here for brunch with a friend who lives nearby in Cow Hollow. I liked the wide variety on their menu, and ended up getting the Mamma Mia crepe. It's a savory crepe with a few types of cheese, eggplant, spinach, and tomatoes. I'm a sucker for eggplant and tomatoes so couldn't go wrong here. I thought my crepe was pretty enjoyable and loved the potatoes that were served with it. They had a really delicious crisp to them that I loved. My friend got pancakes and was a fan of those as well. I would be happy to come here again to try something else from the menu!
author: Dylan C.

description:
Always passed by here... Never went in... Until last Tuesday... 

It was a quiet afternoon, a hot one at that. The air conditioner was at full blast, a few tvs showing the ongoing sports games. There was a cafe vibe here, with a huge menu including breakfast, crepes, sandwiches even Americanized Chinese food. I decided to go with something that seemed safe... Chicken Pesto Crepe. I didn't want something too heavy.

The servers were nice. Other than that though...

I really do hate giving low reviews. But this crepe was so bad and I genuinely thought I was going to get food poisoning. There was no flavor so it tasted bland, the crepe was undercooked and the whole thing smelt like fish. 

The plus side was that my companion liked his Philly cheese steak crepe. But even then, we weren't very satisfied.
author: Guilliana J.

description: The food is somewhat edible but really just not good, both the Sicilian crepe and Florentine Benedict, as well as the potatoes which look crispy and tasty but sadly are not
author: Jonathan P.

description:
I came here for brunch on Valentine's Day with my boyfriend and a couple other friends. We came on a recommendation and were excited because we were really hungry. We got there, placed out orders, then went out to sit in the seating area in the back. I thought that the seating area was really nice apart from the pigeons that kept flying down to pick at scraps. 

My boyfriends food and my own came out pretty quickly (I had ordered the crab cakes florentine and he had ordered the chicken pesto crepe), but our friends' orders (Asian chicken salad and French onion soup) took quite some time to come out. It was curious to us seeing as their order seemed much more simple than ours. After maybe 15-20mins of waiting, they had gotten up to cancel their order when their food finally came out.

My personal dining experience was really good, but I wish I could say the same for my friends'.
author: Alexandrea E.

description:
It was another trip to the Squat & Gobble for lunch because another co-worker was leaving!  A bittersweet moment but always a great place for food and opportunity to hangout with co workers!

Here's what I ordered this time:

GRILLED RUBEN -  $10.95
"Roberts Corned Beef", Swiss Cheese, Homemade Sauerkraut & Fresh Russian Dressing, Served on Sliced Rye

I chose the FRESH FRUIT option as my side to be good...cuz it's about to get salty and rich!

I'm quite picky when it comes to ruben sandwiches; it's hit or miss.  The reason why I chose this was because on my way to this place I passed by somewhere and smelled something of a grilled cheese!  I thought I give this corned beef sandwich a try!  I was so happy how yummy it was!  I decided to get a serving of fruit instead of fries to make up for the grilled and greasy part of this meal, hehe.

I was SO impressed with this sandwich!  I really enjoyed it!  It had the perfect amount of pastrami that wasn't too salty.  The bread was grilled to perfection; buttery but not too rich or greasy and the sandwich had a wonderful crunch.  I'm sure the roof of my mouth was scraped but it was worth it!

Thank you again Squat & Gobble, you made me happy once again! I can't wait for another co worker to leave to leave just so I can come back to try your other dishes! :P
author: Tu-Anh N.

description: I go here when I have me time before work. I love the vibe, food and prices. The prices is very reasonable for brunch. The eggs Benedict is the bomb! You have to try it! They have indoor and outdoor seating. When it's nice in San Francisco the outdoor seating is so beautiful with a little birdbath in the middle and it's cold they do have outdoor heating system.
author: Francine S.

description: Came here for lunch today with my daughter. You order at the counter then they give you a number to stick on your table. Before ordering I asked the gentleman helping us what the star meant next to some of the items. The guy had no idea. Not a good sign. We went to sit down but most of the empty tables were full of dirty dishes. Again not a good sign. Luckily they have a courtyard in back. Food quickly delivered. Asked for water, never came and no one to be found.  I had the French onion soup. Terrible. Essentially a bowl stuffed with croutons with a little bit of a one dimensional broth poured over then covered in a cheese lid.. My daughter had the speghetti bolognese. Over cooked pasta. Sauce just ok. Never got the water. No one ever checked on us. Terrible service, borderline food. Will not go back.
author: Teresa D.

description:
Wait a second...I thought it was impossible to have brunch in SF without standing in line for an hour?! I mean, that's why people love the East Bay so much...right?

Apparently, the Marina crowd doesn't want brunch before 11am, because when we waltzed into Squat & Gobble on Sunday morning at prime brunchin' time, we were greeted with the shocking proposition to simply order at the counter, grab a seat on the back patio, and wait for our food to come out. No obnoxious wait list, no stalking people for a table, no overpriced food even! Just friendly folks chowing down on crepes and omelets and sipping on fresh-squeezed OJ enhanced mimosas. I could get used to this routine! 

The menu is just my style: just enough variety to get me stressed about choosing: crab cakes eggs bennie, veggies-stuffed crepes, challah french toast, croissant breakfast sammie. Of course, I can never turn down a crepe so I went for Zorba the Greek, luscious and savory with a big side salad. My hunky date had the crab eggs bennie with breakfast potatoes - totally worth stealing more than a bite of. Nicely done with the hollandaise, folks. 

Oh, and the service! Whoever that charming gentleman was, buzzing around the restaurant making sure everyone was happy, full, and comfy...give that guy a promotion. 

The back patio is peaceful and green, and there's a few cafe tables out front if you prefer the Marina runway show. We'll be back!
author: Nique F.

description: Great little lunch spot...loved the Thai curry chicken.  A nice walk down to the Palace of Fine Arts makes the location even more appealing.  (Also raspberry sugar cookies are A-MAZING!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Just got off work wanting to try something new. I came across squat and gobble and gotten one of their seafood pastas before, which was so good. So I decided to come back and try another one. I got the chicken pappardelle because it sounds really interesting. It came with chunks of chicken, broccoli and a nice creamy sauce. 

I don't recommend taking it to go. I laid it down on my car seat, and when I got home, the sauce went through the brown bag and leaked on my car seat. Wow... They must of put a lot of sauce. I was some what disappointed, but not really. I tried it and it was everything I expected out of it. Lots of flavor and kind of thick noodles. Ate it with a glass of wine and finished it right away.
author: Lisa K.

description: Not in the mood for breakfast? No problem, check out the "Wok Kitchen" part of the menu. I had the Fragrant Chicken Stir Fry and it was surprisingly good. Tender chicken, crisp vegetables, and a healthy serving of rice. Considering I was just coming from the gym, it filled me up for the entire afternoon. I think many of their drinks are overpriced, but the food is priced fairly and is always flavorful.
author: Josh F.

description:
Came here for brunch with the bf the other day and can't say I was too thrilled with the food we ordered.  It was just kinda mediocre to me,  but maybe it was just the items we ordered? I was also a little irritated that they didn't honor the 10% off  $10 or more coupon that yelp offered to people who check in. The clerk told us the manager is supposed to be taking it down (but it's still up....-_-) Hmmm....I know 10% off isn't much, but honor the coupon until you take the time to remove it.

I got the French onion soup, which looked amazing with all the melty, gooey, lightly charred cheese crust! Baked and bubbly cheese creeping down the sides of the ceramic bowl,  yum!  Unfortunately, that ended up being the highlight of my meal. The broth itself was too tangy for me and tasted like Italian dressing.  It wasn't what I was expecting so I didn't eat much of it.  We also ordered the chicken pesto savory crepe, which I took a couple bites of before I lost interest. It seemed a little bland to me but my bf seemed to like it.  

I'll prob give this place another try and order something different next time just to make sure I wasn't eating on a bad day.
author: Jess K.

description:
This was hands down the worst experience and service that I have ever witnessed in a restaurant. The one star is giving too much credit. 

My two friends and I order our food at the front register and make our way to the outside patio in the back. The patio was pretty crowded so we waited to the side for a table. 

Once we are seated we receive our drinks that we ordered and we ask for some ice water. Eventually the water comes only after we watch our server pour a used glass of water into the pitcher to serve to other people (unsanitary). Adding to dirty dishes laying everywhere around the eating area. 

Our food finally comes out COLD. My friend had ordered pancakes which usually are served with butter but there was none and it was impossible to get the ONE servers attention that was handling the entire patio.

Since we didn't really feel like indulging in the water we were served my friend flagged down another employee and asks for a soda. She responds with that we need to order in the front and we tell her that we were informed we could order at our table. Not to mention their soda fountain machine is right in the patio. The woman employee says to us: "well I'm really busy right now, you need to ask him, I'm running food" sorry we just thought you worked here ???? RUDE. We never got the soda. 

We were in shock after being talked to so poorly and it was never an option to ask our "server" for anything we may need. We asked for the manager who I believe was just another employee and he said sorry and walked away.

Bottom line: poor service, terrible low quality food, unsanitary, waste of money and time. Literally we will NEVER BE RETURNING. 

So many better options in the marina and we regret stopping by.
author: Rachel D.

description:
Sorry to say Squat and Gobble was a disappointment, which has been really rare in my SF food eating experience. Have been there twice hoping the second time that the first time was just an off day.....it wasn't .
The food is average and overpriced. Both times we had breakfast that was cold and tasteless. 
Equally cold was the staff who was very unresponsive to our concerns.

There are quite of few alternatives in the Marina, I'd suggest any of them!
author: Drew F.

description:
Great outdoor ambiance! Perfect for groups and family. Reasonable price and good food! 

We live around the area so Squat & Gobble has been our place to go especially when we are lazy to cook breakfast/brunch. They have plenty of food options from breakfast food to pasta to Asian cuisine. 

They have a hidden outdoor seating at the back so make sure to check that out.
author: Mia O.

description:
I love the fact that they have gluten free options for the crepes. 
Even though I wasnt super impressed I would go back! Plus the location is perfect, busy but such a great area in SF.
author: Natasha I.

description: It has been quite some time that i havent ate something from this place. I was debating if i should get a pasta or pad thai for my lunch before i came here. As i was looking at menu i decided to get seafood linguini since it sounded good and i havent had pasta for a long time. Seafood linguini for 15.15(tax include). Even though most pasta are in the $13/15 price range, but to me its a little pricy since the plate size is more like between small to medium size here. But they do give okay amount of seafood inside this pasta. But i think the clams in this pasta kinda looks like from the can. Not sure what they put in the pasta, it got me thirty all day long that i had to keep drinking water. Other then that, the pasta was not bad and enjoy my food
author: Julie N.

description: My crabs florentine were everything. The potatoes were just a tad dry. I called my order in like maybe 20 minutes before picking it up, so maybe that's why my potatoes were a little dry. Over all I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. Delicious.
author: Walter P.

description:
So the main caveat is that I'm from the Washington DC area... and then spent three nights on a company-paid business trip binge in Monterey... so my price point references are all out of whack with San Francisco prices. 3.5 stars rounded down. 

Squat & Gobble is... perfectly adequate. Nothing seemed out of place. The venue was great and thoughtful and busy but never crowded for the morning. Food comes out quick, service is great, and it is an objectively okay place to go get a bite to eat. If I was a local in search of something quick, I would totally come here. 

Food looked and was very fresh, the ingredients worked together just the way you would expect but nothing terribly memorable on paper or in practice. Nothing was objectively wrong. The food was objectively good. But I felt the dishes were about 2-3 dollars too pricey for what you got and I'm not compelled to seek it out. 

I know in today's day, anything less than a 4 star rating is an absolute fail in terms of reviews but that shouldn't be the case. This is a perfectly okay, absolutely fine establishment. But don't expect miracles in terms of the food. It promises above average and it gives slightly above average. It will satisfy your hunger in a pinch but it's going to fade out of your consciousness in about two hours.
author: Hj W.

description: MANAGER ELMER IS SO SO RUDE! refused to let my family sit outside and made it pretty much impossible to eat with a child. I would not come here or give this restaurant my business solely based on how rude this manager was!
author: Amanda H.

description:
Sit in the back patio you will not regret it! Is beautiful as far as the food I'm giving it a 3/5 it's not the most best I've ever had. 

I got the eggs Benedict and potatoes, and I've have way better do not get the potatoes they are the worst. My friend got the waffles and they taste like some thing you make at home.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
We came here on a Sunday for brunch after walking along Chrissy Field. The line looked long but it moves quickly and the food also comes out fast so don't let the line deter you.

I ordered a strawberry banana crepe and a chicken pesto crepe. Both were delicious! You really can't go wrong when you put strawberries, bananas and Nutella together. 

There is indoor and outdoor seating. If you want to sit outdoors there is seating in front and also along the side of the building.
author: Ashley M.

description: Like a new uplifting decor. Food ate good and efficient service. Nothing fancy but great service.
author: Linda L.

description: Very nice for what it is. Food is fresh and fairly priced. Had the homemade veggie burger w grilled mushrooms and it was excellent. Service was fast and friendly and great location.
author: K A.

description:
I loved this place, the best brunch ever, friendly staff, vibrant atmosphere, laud (in a good way).
Poached eggs, perfecto in Eggs Valentino. Prompt service. My new favorite place
author: Ashwin J.

description:
Best food in town!!! Great place to hang out. You got fans from Austria
The food is delicious. The service is perfect.
If you are at Chestnut or close to it, you have to join in.
author: Gin T.

description:
Since we were in the neighborhood, our hosts recommended a lunch spot on Chestnut St. Our first choice wasn't serving food that afternoon, so we stopped in here. It's a casual joint with a giant menu plastered on one side of the restaurant, you order at the register, and your food is brought to you. They also have televisions, so I imagine it's a good place to hang out with your buds and watch sports (they were showing the World Cup game that day).

I ordered one of their newer menu items, The Hangover Crepe ($10.95): All Natural Ground Angus Chuck, American Cheese, Caramelized Red Onions, and Bacon Bits. It comes with a side of their "Famous" Garlic Roasted Potatoes, French Fries, Mixed Greens Salad, Fresh Fruit, or Soup of the Day. You can also add an egg, any style for $1.
