I meant to do this, but I completely forgot when I placed my order. A sunny-side up egg would have been perfect on this crepe! Anyway, it was delicious and they were very generous with the beef! The roasted potatoes were decent.

Ruben had the Angus Cheese Steak Sandwich ($10.50): Grilled Angus Beef, Melted American Cheese, Caramelized Mushrooms, Onions, and Peppers, Served on a Warm Hoagie Roll. I thought it was good and Ruben really enjoyed it. He opted for the side of French Fries and they were also delicious.

Water was served in very small glasses and was a bit hard to come by. Otherwise, everyone was friendly. The weather was gorgeous that day and we sat next to the large open windows, so it was pleasant. Overall, it was a good meal and I like their selection of savory crepes.
author: Amelinda L.

description:
let me start off with the good. 

good food good price good location. they have out door seating and indoor and its pretty quiet. now for the bad the customer service is going downhill. the lady working the counter today 10/18/2016 around 2:00 pm was horrible. i come in to eat was just ignored but the woman. then while trying to place a order she still didn't pay any attention to me even though i was 2 feet in front of her. as a person who works in the neighborhood i don't think ill go back for lunch at least when shes there
author: Alonzo T.

description:
We came here early on a weekend to meet friends for breakfast. When we arrived at 9ish, there were just a few people inside. But with every passing minute, there were more patrons coming in. We ordered a Chicken Pesto crepe, cappuccino and mocha at the counter and got seated in one of the tables. 

Within a few minutes, we were served drinks and crepe. It was delicious. Infact, the mocha is one of the best I've had in quite some time. Highly recommend!
author: Anu M.

description:
I really like this low-key breakfast joint.

The orange juice is fresh-squeezed and very excellent. Maybe because I'm from Seattle and don't get extra good juice like that very often. 

You order at the counter, but they will bring you your food, do refills, and clear for you, so tip appropriately. The indoor seating area is big. The outdoor seating area is just lovely (also pretty big). It has a fountain and is shady when it's hot out and has heaters for when it's not. 

Very relaxing, delicious breakfast experience!
author: Jessica B.

description:
There wasn't much of a wait to order food. Good selections for food choices. 

Got the Italian Crepe, Hangover Crepe (new food item) and the Angus Chuck Burger.

Of course the waiter serving looked at my boyfriend funny for ordering hangover crepe since we were eating with his mom. Smart move yes? lol Even overheard them talking about the my boyfriend ordering the hangover while out eating with his mom. Being asian didn't help his case either since he don't look of age even though he is definitely above the age to drink. 

Water was served right away. The food we waited for awhile before it came out. The place wasn't super crowded either.
author: Corie L.

description: I used to love this place but the menu changed and the food and service did too- all for the worse.  My crepe was dry, thick and tasteless.  My friend (and the people at the table next to us) said the omelets were not good at all.  We ordered hot water and after reminding them 5 times, they finally brought it.  Asked for refill on the table  water, never came.  So sad that the place has been ruined.  Two stars only for the location.
author: Karen B.

description:
My wife just cracked her tooth on a shell that was in the crab cakes florentine. I could actually hear it as it happened. 
Also, check out the classy sign at the counter explaining that a 3.5% anti-affordable care act surcharge will be added to every meal.
Wow. Smh.
author: Sean B.

description:
We love the Squat & Gobble, or as my mother in law calls it, "The Gobble Gobble". We've been going for years and were so sad when the West Portal location shut down for fire repair. 

We've never been to this location before but has family pictures on Baker Beach and were coming back through the Marina so we stopped here. 

Always love their food. This location is definitely not as updated as the West Portal location (even pre fire) but the service is good and the food is yummy.
author: Alexis M.

description:
Yeah yelp is right on again. Squat and Gobble ( who comes up with these names?) was recommended by a friend after a hike.

It is a very chain non-chain restaurant with an interesting mix of breakfast items, sandwiches, burgers, and Asian dishes (yeah talk about disparate mix).

The location itself is pretty good. It is clean inside and the outdoor patio is really nice. The modus operandi is order at the counter get a number and sit down...simple.

Food is pretty good. I had the breakfast burrito which was large and pretty good. Salads looked really good. I must mention the fresh squeezed oj was pretty darn good too.

My only hesitation was that as I was passing by the kitchen it was pretty dirty and the food is provided by sysco ( I have nothing against sysco) but it is a very institutional way to procure food.

I would not run back but if I was in the neighborhood I would def consider.
author: David G.

description:
I came here today after giving a few months since my last subpar experience. I ordered a macchiato, crepe, potatoes and fruit, and after twenty minutes received an alright crepe, alright potatoes, and a stale macchiato. 

Oh well, I didn't want fruit anyway - I was just pretending to eat healthy anyways. 

The back patio is pretty, but unless you're prepared to listen to a bunch of still-drunk Marina folks talk about their narcissistic weekend, you'd be better off eating inside. Or not coming at all.

Finally, I went to the co/ed restroom after an employee left -- the toilet was up, the sink was dry, and the bathroom change log was still the previous month 8 days in. Not exactly something you want to see. I am disgusted with the service and health standards and won't be returning.
author: William M.

description: We came here for dessert because I was really craving a crepe! The crepes were good, a little overpriced. The staff closed down a little early so some other patrons who walked in after us couldn't get food even though it was still a little before their close time. You order and pay at the counter, get a table number, and then your food is brought out to you.
author: Nicole D.

description:
The service was great, staff was friendly, food was delicious (with HUGE portions), and prices were decent. 

I had the South of the Border omelet, with Jack cheese, avocado, vegetarian black bean chili, sour cream, and salsa. It was absolutely delicious.

My husband had a breakfast burrito with chili, cheese, chorizo, not sure what else, but it was enormous! He loved it too.

I believe our meals were $9.95 each. Not bad at all.

The iced tea was different. It was good, but different. It had a fruitiness to it and an orange slice instead of lemon. 

Parking was a pain, but much better than a lot of other areas of San Francisco. 

We will definitely visit again.
author: Jill M.

description: Felt heavily judged by staff when the dude took my food. Food was pretty good tho lol
author: Chris B.

description: our friend took us here. but my husband picked the restaurant . my husband had a ruben sandwich which he said was subpar . I had beef stroganoff , which I thought was weird .is there something wrong with my taste buds ?  because it was hot ! stroganoff shouldn't be spicy ! it was very, very spicy ! I had my husband try it ,he said it was too spicy for him to eat and he likes spicy things . he said he thinks there is a lot of white pepper in it. our friend didn't look thrilled eating his seafood pasta either.
author: Nellie J.

description: I ordered the Croissant Sandwich with a side of fruits and a glass of orange juice. To be honest, the orange juice was good but it was overpriced (about $5.50). The portions were good and the food tasted amazing! Since it was very busy, the few waiters kept forgetting to bring us extra coffee and boxes to go so we had to go up and get them. Even once I got up, the waiter kept mishearing what I was saying (I'm from California so I don't have a hard to understand accent). Other than that, I loved breakfast!
author: Faith-Carmen L.

description: Love it.  Inexpensive great food.  Good wine for $8/glass.  Nothing not to like.
author: Richard C.

description:
I met up with friends for dinner at Squat & Gobble - we were looking for something kid-friendly, and it certainly fits the bill (kid-friendly food, booth/bench seating and other patrons with kids who don't mind the noise). They had an extensive menu of salads, sandwiches, burgers, etc.

I was pleasantly surprised by how tasty the salmon cobb was; the salmon wasn't overcooked and the huge salad was filled with lots of fresh veggies. The staff was really nice and helpful.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Yes please!

I took a group of interview candidates for my company here while we were in the area for a scavenger hunt. This place was definitely "WOW" worthy!

First of all, service is quick and staff is friendly. Perfect for us, as we were in a rush.

Secondly, the options were limitless. Crepes, sandwiches, salads, pasta, stir fries - you name it, they have it.

I got the chicken pesto crepe with salad which was very good and comparable to Crepevine, one of my favorite places for a nice savory crepe. It was a little bit overpacked with sundries tomatoes in my opinion, but nonetheless delicious.

Thank you! Will be back soon!
author: Meaghan H.

description: Truly not our kind of place at all. I found that even though it is packed the food was not on point. As well it is filled with disgusting hung over people who are gobbling and I am sure squatting! Ha! Sorry I do not recommend unless you are in your 20's and hung over!
author: Kirk M.

description: At first glance walking in, it seemed like a pretty nice place to have lunch. However by the end of lunch, I was so ready to get outta there. After ordering, we struggled to find a clean table for three people. We settled on the least dirty table after walking around to several. Food came quickly, about 10-15 minutes after ordering. Tried their NorCal omelette with a side salad. Flavor was mediocre and nothing particularly special, though it looked rather yummy. Throughout the meal, several toddlers were screaming at the top of their lungs, making it difficult to have a conversation or enjoy the meal.
author: Amy W.

description:
First off the name and decor drew me in like a lightbulb to a moth, but it was the marina crepe that had me begging for more.  Just read the ingredients: Salmon, spinach, onions, capers, artichokes, tomatoes, tarragon and Fontina cheese, topped with sun-dried tomato pesto.  Just typing that has me chewing on my tounge and all I can remember hearing as I ate this masterpiece was the singing of angels as the sun spotlit the crepe.  

If you have the chance and it's warm enough, eat in the back patio where it has a more crepe  friendly atmosphere.
author: Alan B.

description: Hearty large sized crepes.  I would say get a savory and a sweet and share since the portions are pretty large.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Boyfriend and I stopped by this place because we were starving and wanted something quick. This place is good I wish it was closer to my city! 

He got the angus char burger with fries and he loved it; says he would give it five stars. 
I got the Mexican chicken salad and that thing was huge! It definitely could feed two people but it was really good! A lot of ingredients and good flavor. The chicken was also perfectly grilled and seasoned very well and wasn't bland. 

The place was a little confusing at first because we didn't know if we sat down or ordered first. You order your food and they give u a table number and then deliver it to you. We didn't get any water refills (-1 star) The people there were friendly. Good atmosphere. If I lived in the city I would come back to try out more of their menu.
author: Liz M.

description:
Came here after drinks with coworkers and it was pretty busy.  I have to say rolling in to any place close to their closing time with a fairly large group doesn't create the best of experiences but Squat & Gobble was not bad and service was pretty quick to boot.  Food came out fast and was about what I expected.  I had the Reuben and while it's not the best I've had, it definitely hit the spot and being able to gracefully accommodate a large group without any major mishaps is always a plus in my book.

Although the Marina kind of has a surplus of excellent sandwich spots, it's nice to see a decent one open a little bit later.  I'll definitely be back to try more!.
author: Chris C.

description:
After the horrible experience at Delarosa the happy smiling faces at Squat & Gobble give this place 3 solid stars.

Food - seafood pasta was ok, the seafood was cooked right, but the sauce was too strong and off balance, bread was hard and inedible

Tea was not bad

Over all, service is what makes a place and even though these hard working guys make less in tips (since it's an order up front and wait with a number type place) than guys at a typical restaurant, these guys were warm, welcoming and make the experience. Would go back maybe to try breakfast and enjoy the service. Thank you happy Squat &n Gobble guys :)
author: Mira T.

description: Good food, but it took a while to get to the table. We went for brunch hoping to sit outside, but it was very crowded which was a good sign. Service was okay, but I would go back another time.
author: Sofia C.

description: The pasta was . Really nice place, friendly staff, good service, and didn't have to wait to sit. Came on a Sunday and sat outside on the courtyard to enjoy a meal with family. Fresh and cool air outside and beautifully decorated. We all really enjoyed it. Also a lot of stores to visit if you want to walk around after eating.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Been coming here off and on for years, but I was really disappointed with how I was treated last time I came here for a late brunch. 

Decided to try the chicken stir fry instead of my usual crab cake florentine, and unfortunately it took them 3 attempts to get my order right. Don't think English is the first language of some of the staff because each time they would deliver a different Asian-style dish that wasn't chicken stir fry (like Kung Pao chicken), each time I would re-explain what I actually ordered, and each time I would get a bad attitude from the person delivering the (wrong) dish. I was even accused of changing my order three times!  Right, I love waiting 3 times as long to get my food after watching my friends completely finish their meals--it brings me such joy to starve myself by changing my order 3 times in a row. Great customer service, guys.

Saddest part was that the manager was the one who originally took my order and he also never bothered to come over to my table when I directly asked to speak with him after this comedy of errors. He was apparently "on break" for 45 minutes despite awkwardly sitting 15 feet from us at a different table, avoiding eye contact. It was very weird. Maybe he was too embarrassed to at least apologize? It's fine, my friends and I won't spend our money here any more. Plenty of other options with much better service and management.
author: Ryan E.

description: Great value and extensive menu. Soups, salads, sandwiches as well as more exotic fare. Staff are polite and efficient - good shout for a quick lunch!
author: Caitríona S.

description: Best breakfast I have ever had! Highly recommend the crab cake florentine! The patio is beautiful. The atmosphere is amazing!
author: Kelsie J.

description: Hmm, I think I just ordered the wrong thing here, but the food was okay. I believe they're known for their crepes, but I was craving pasta at the time. I came here with my friends and ordered the chicken peppardelle and a salad. The portion size is big and was able to share the pasta w/ garlic bread and salad with my friends. The place gets busy and the line gets long, but plenty of seating outside, inside, and upstairs! We ordered our food and took our number and went upstairs to sit. The wait for out food wasn't too long and the service was good. I'll give this place another try and try their crepes whenever I come to SF again :)
author: Sara T.

description:
Really cool place. Portions are on the smaller side. They have an extremely extensive menu and interesting non-alcoholic drink selection. The decor reminds me of a generic hotel, which is actually unique for a restaurant.

I had the eggs Benedict and it was tasty. The portion size was okay. Service was fast and there is no waiter, which is nice.
author: Jonathan A.

description:
My review for this restaurant is all about a little bit of bad luck and how the restaurant's staff worked to make sure I as a customer was happy. 

I went to Squat and Gobble for brunch with three friends of mine. They all ordered similar menu items as each other and I ordered something very different. Their food was served to them the second they sat down and my meal ended up coming out much later. In minutes, they were finished eating and to my understanding, in a hurry to leave town for plans in Marin. So I asked some of their staff members if I could get refunded for my food because I couldn't eat with my friends by the time my food arrived.

The man who I believe was the manager, as well as their cashier Makayla were extremely helpful to me and didn't guilt me out about my cancelled order. They refunded me and I went on my merry way.

My friends enjoyed their food and my food coming out later than there's was just a case of us not having all our food in the same order like a regular sit-down restaurant. I don't blame the kitchen staff. Over all, I was impressed at how they handled such an awkward request and think the service is over all very friendly and efficient.
author: Sydney Y.

description:
Been going there for years. 
Fantastic place.  Food is great.  And I must to admit. I try the breakfast only so far. And it's the best.  Service is great. I love hat place
author: Yali Y.

description: The food here is decent, but the restaurant is a disaster. There are people everywhere and there is definitely not enough space to eat.  We have been here multiple times where our order is messed up and the staff does nothing to correct it.  If they do correct it, it takes them 20 minutes so you are already done with your meal. For two omelettes the price is around $35 and you probably won't even receive the correct order.
author: Jessica C.

description:
We were a bit disappointed with the Squat and Gobble. First let me say it is very kid friendly, we took our toddler and there were several families present already. I ordered the house special crab cake Benedict, and was disappointed - the hollandaise sauce didn't taste right and the potatoes were just Ok; the crab cake was just ok. My wife got a French toast to share with our daughter and it was also ok. All in all being in San Francisco you have other options, but if you are looking for kid friendly it may be your spot. 

One caveat, they have lots of crepes and we didn't try any - maybe that is what we should have tried...
author: Robert H.

description: I give it 4 stars because they are consistently late opening on Sunday's.  It should be three stars however, the staff if really nice & the food is good.  I have only been for breakfast so, I would say you can't go wrong with anything.  The eggs Benedict could use alittle more flavor.  I love the fact that they have a good Belgian Waffle that isn't burnt. Personal favorite is the Fillmore.  Great place just be prepared to wait on Sunday mourning.  I would say still get in early because it will get packed.
author: Aaron S.

description:
This place was pretty awesome. It reminded me of Crepevine but better. 

Between the four of us, we ordered the chicken pesto crepe, waffles, eggs Benedict, croissant sandwich and the Nor-Cal omelet. 

Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their food, but I did have two negatives that I had to deduct half a star for each. The first was no one came to refill our waters until we were clearly done with our food. They bused our plates before refilling our waters. And second the croissant sandwich my boyfriend got was more like a ham and cheese scramble plopped down between the croissant slices. Half of the eggs didn't even make it into the sandwich and he had to eat it separately. Luckily we were all so hungry that we didn't care too much. 

Overall we were happy with S&G and will probably come again.
author: Fiona K.

description: Yikes, dangerously and majorly broke a promise about an allergen :(
author: Jon F.

description:
The overall experience was bad. From the moment of entering. Kind of confusing if your not greeted so you don't really know if you should sit down or order up front. A couple was waiting for table service. When they realized no one was helping they went to the front and asked what to Do. They told the staff they should at least greet and I agree... they weren't from here so how would they know. 

The food was okay.. crepe was rather thick in comparison to most. The thing that kind iritated me was the fact that they missed a few ingredients. If you are going to advertise it, it should be In it. Chefs should not plate and send off until all ingredients are there.. that's what customers pay for... what if the Mona Lisa was missing her lips? Or if the last supper was missing jesus?wouldn't make sense. It has to all compliment each other. From start to finish.

Staff were iritated.. that was obvious, but don't show it.  Customer service is key. Food, service, atmosphere, location, price. Gave it a star for the location. Tucked in the marina its a nice place to take in the hustle and bustle, but still enjoy the nice neighborhood.
author: Nikole D.

description: In town for the night before heading north to Sonoma County and wanted a quick place for a hearty breakfast. This place delivered on both accounts and more!!!  Every single staff member was extremely friendly, chatting with me as well as my kids. They made my 3 year old feel comfortable and welcome, responding to him even if they were busy with a task. The food was delicious with large serving sizes, coffee was spot on and atmosphere was relaxing. We will be back to SF and be here again!!!
author: Candice Z.

description:
When you walk in, don't be overwhelmed. There are a few reasons why I am giving this spot 5 stars.

1. The menu has something for EVERYONE - from breakfast to crepes to pasta to asian food
2. You pay then sit. This makes it easy for big groups who don't need to worry about paying and splitting the check.
3. Fresh squeezed OJ!!! Makes a huge difference for Mimosas :)
4. HUGE and super cute outdoor patio seating!

Everyone liked their food. Across our group, we had a pasta dish, omelet, sandwich and salad.
author: Ivy C.

description: I brought my family here during our vacation to San Francisco. The blue berry pancakes were amazing and it was way more than my mom could eat. I loved the Strawberry & Nutella crepes and couldn't finish my food either. This place was a great way to start the day.
author: Bailey R.

description: Absolutely awesome enviornment! The patio is a peaceful garden area full of fountains and  flowers, the service and  food was perfect!!
author: NormaJean R.

description:
Excellent!!! So..I was with my friend the other day, I needed food to eat before going back to Bart to the East Bay. We decided to go in here and get some grub, this was my first time here. MY FRIENDS CAR IS WITH A LISENCE PLATE FROM THE DUMB AND DUMBER STATE. we order..I'm talking to the gal up front. I decide to order this dish with Jasmine rice, veggies and chicken..
Comes out super, turbo charged fast!!! Wow!! I'm impressed...so..I wash up first..THE RESTROOMS AREN'T JUST SF CLEAN THEY ARE BEYOND SF CLEAN...
The food was great..this is a fun, spacious, CLEAN place to eat, TV's, great  fast, fresh food. So..I had one problem with my meal..so I go get a box for the yummy yum food I just ate, and want to give to someone else.
I go back up to the counter with my box of food. WITH OUT SAYING ANYTHING AT ALL MY FRIEND GRABS ME A BAG TO PUT MY FOOD IN, HE MUST HAVE SPECIAL POWERS I'M SURE HE DOES...
I totally would come here again for sure. I'm not in SF often, but I was hanging with a great friend that day along with having some great food. Enjoy!@!
author: Peter J.

description: Very delish! Bacon was very crunchy n tasty; orange juice, the best!; coffee excellent; very clean, great service; fast! Bottom line, Great experience :)
author: Mel T.

description:
Been coming here for 6 years now because I love there crepes but my experience yesterday was bad from the moment I walked in I was not greeted and stood at the register for about 2 minutes. 

but the customer service was not the worst the pasta dish I ordered was so effing gross I only had a bite.. This "cream sauce" was watered down and the noddles looked old. I can tell there under new ownership bc the quality of the food is so bad. By boyfriends crepe was so gross and greasy looking.. No more sundried tomatoes or sausage in the Italian crepe.. It was replaced by huge chunks of tomatoes and nasty sausage

When I told a staff member about how gross my pasta was they didn't even offer me something else so I decided to order again but had to cancel AGAIN bc I was so disappointed with this place 
It's embarrassing that I have recommended this place to people.. That being said I'll never be back
author: Cathy A.

description: 2nd time here and we enjoyed the experience again.  The food is not 5 star but it is a solid meal.  Lots of options with plenty of healthy foods available.  Lots of seating and good atmosphere.  I'm sure we will eat here again and we definitely recommend it.
author: Matt P.

description:
Classic menu dilemma--there are just too many mouth-watering options and it makes me sad to think that I will probably eat only one meal here.  I usually go for a Mexican-inspired dish when eating out in the morning, but in this case the Italian savory crepe won a very agonizing decision process.  There are probably no poor choices here, but my breakfast was a winner:  sausage, eggs, onions, mushrooms, tomatoes, spinach, mozzarella, and pesto.  In a crepe.  PLUS a large portion of their truly outstanding garlic & rosemary breakfast potatoes.  It's an enormous pile of damn good food.

A fantastic glass of fresh-squeezed orange juice finished off the meal nicely.

While the breakfast was delicious, the service was even better.  The guy who served us behind the counter and brought out our food (and filled our water, and checked up on us, etc) hit that perfect note of being super-friendly without going over the top.

I would squat and gobble for this joint anytime.
author: David R.

description: I ordered online and it was ready when I arrived. Great value for the price I paid, my Caesar salad was really good, fresh products and a lot to eat in your plate. The salmon and fusilli dish was also excellent. Friendlier staff than in the Castro.
author: Frederic P.

description:
Came here for breakfast and the food was alright. I had the fillmore omlet which had way too many bell peppers and tomatoes and barely any ham. While my boyfriend had the breakfast burrito and experienced a similar situation. 

The service was sub par. You order at the counter first then sit down. And since we didn't really look the part for the neighborhood I guess, they never came around to bring us utensils, or the water that we requested. While other tables were getting double service.

Overall: Food wasn't that great and the service was even worse.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Cockroach in my food!!

There was a cockroach in my lox bagel, when I showed it to the cashier/server she was as repulsed as by it as I was. Only after taking back into the kitchen did she emerge to offer me a new one, which I declined, and offered to refund the item. After my coffee coming out after the meal, and having to remind them about the refund as we were about to leave, I asked to have the whole meal refunded, but they refused. From this experience I gather that they are not concerned with customer service/customer satisfaction. Will never be returning. 

would give it zero stars.
author: Jay L.

description:
Came here to eat a couple mornings ago after browsing up and down chestnut. 
The guys were so professional and sweet. Made sure we had everything we needed before even asking for it. So helpful in deciding as well. Asked the register guy if he preferred the chicken curry or the French toast, he said French toast. 
Best French toast I had in San Francisco hands down. 

Fresh squeezed juice too! Check this place out! Definitely worth it
author: Stephanie L.

description: I was there with my two boys yesterday morning. I order at the counter. My boys food arrived and they asked what I ordered I told them and they seemed to leave to go and find it. 5 to 10 minutes later I asked someone else for my order and they went to go try to find it, another 5 to 10 minutes past my boys are done done eating I flagged down yet another person they go to find out but  never returned the table, finally the fourth person I asked found the cashier to come out who told me he never entered my order. But this time my boys were completely finished eating and I was so angry that no one ever actually looked into this until the last person I asked that I wanted to leave. They did give me a free  breakfast but I will never go there again. Terrible service!!!!
author: Emily W.

description: A lot of value for the dollar and the food is good. Not killer  but good. Portions are huge and the staff is friendly. I had the Chicken pesto crepe  and it comes with a huge salad. Totally worth it.
author: David F.

description: I came here on 3/23/15 at 7pm. Everyone in my party except me got served for me and my gf. 45 min pass and still no food. The rest of my part got to enjoy their food and was ready to leave. At this point I did not even want squat and gobble in my life again. When I asked for my money back the male cashier said at first they don't do refunds its a policy. Then upon me being persistent he said he needs a manager and that he is the manager but he can't do it. Then he told me to call in the morning and ask for a refund then. THEY BASICALLY MUGGED ME FOR $30
author: yoo s.

description:
Five stars for the BOMB DIGGITY Grilled Salmon Fusilli!! I'm not a breakfast person, so I went out on a limb and got this pasta dish one day...and what a discovery it was! You get a plentiful portion of fusilli tossed in an aromatic pesto sauce, alongside a charbroiled salmon filet. I'm bummed that my local branch, the West Portal Squat & Gobble, closed down, but thankfully I work semi-near the Marina because I have to get my salmon fusilli fix every couple of weeks!

My parents and bf have also given the Ruben sandwich, and the benedicts two thumbs up. There is something on the menu for everyone here...it's a foolproof place to take your family!
author: Caralisa L.

description:
Met up with my college friends for Sunday brunch. A college reunion always calls for morning drinks and getting a little tipsy while we gossip. The back patio is the perfect spot. It's so private and pretty, you definitely feel like you're away from the busyness right outside.

We ordered eggs benedicts, mimosas, and  because I hate oranges I got the Bloody Mary. Although I wanted to love my meal because this is the perfect place for get togethers, my benedict was incomparable to my usual haunts'. The English muffin was not toasted making it hard to cut through and the Canadian bacon was rubbery! How sad. We did enjoy our drinks though. The Bloody Mary had just the right amount of pepper and a hint of spiciness. My friends' mimosas also looked delicious. They use fresh squeezed OJ and the best part is the majority of the drink is champagne! Unfortunately everything is more on the pricey side and I wish they offered a bottomless drink option. Maybe I'll be back to squat and gobble but just for the drinks!
author: Britney L.

description:
As any true Yelper does, we searched Yelp for the best sushi place in the Haight for dinner.  Once we were done, we saw this place across the street and decided on a beer and dessert.

We were only here for about 25 minutes, but the beer was cheap and the crepes delicious.  I ordered a crepe au sucre and it was made perfectly.  The beer was incredibly cheap so it's a shame this place didn't have more of a bar vibe or maybe we would have stayed.

Go get a crepe... so good.
author: Jenna S.

description: Came in on a very slow night and ordered a gluten-free crepe.  They served me a regular crepe full of gluten. I will not return.
author: Ashley F.

description:
$11 buys you one of the best Breakfast Burritos I've ever had, period.  

FIlled with Eggs, Chorizo, Onions, Peppers, Avocado, Pepper Jack Cheese, Ranchero & Green Tomatillo Sauce, Mexican Salsa, Jalapeño Sour Cream, Served Over Black Bean Chili & Topped with Crispy Tortilla Strips

Also not to miss is their fresh squeezed orange juice and beautiful patio.
author: Ryan P.

description: Delicious breakfast burrito. So perfect, the right amount of chorizo, avocado, eggs and all the other goodness. The sauce on top was elegant and the tortilla was soft thin and perfect.
author: Narf K.

description: Probably the most over priced place in the Marina, which is really saying something.  Coffee is $3.25 plus tax and sf health charges.  Big menu with okay food but just so expensive for what you get get in quality.
author: Bill S.

description:
This place is just not my cup of tea or coffee. It started with the cashiers just yelling at the top of their lungs to the guests, "I could take the next order, I could take the next order, whoever is ready, whoever is ready." This said it all. 

For the money I paid I rather go to Rose's Cafe and have a civilize brunch.
author: Bebe L.

description: The best! We came in for an early dinner with 3 kids. The service was fantastic! The people are supper friendly and nice and FAST! The food is unbelievable! We had the most yummy Greek salad and breakfast food and a fabulous burger... The crepe for dessert and chai is simply amazing!!! Just one draw back... They don't have a location in Houston! Simply delicious;)
author: Olga F.

description: Food is quick/great and the backyard garden patio is awesome. Nice place for a reasonably quick and casual brunch with friends. Puts me in a zen state of mind every time I visit :)
author: Ryan R.

description:
I came here for dinner after touring the Exploratorium at its original location before the big move to the Embarcadero.  So I was super hungry, and I was pleased with the portion size and price.

I ordered the salmon sandwich with a side salad.  Not bad, no wow factor either.  But it obliterated my hunger and that's all I could ask for that night.
author: Vira P.

description:
I wanted french toast and pancakes SOO BAD!
but apparently it was "too much food."

The girl that took my order first asked me "are you really hungry? because thats a lot of food." and I said "hmm.. I really want both though" But I just stuck with a squat and gobble which is 2 buttermilk pancakes with a side of meat (I got apple sausage) and eggs (I got mine scrambled)

The pancakes were topped with powdered sugar, YUM! The sausage was juicy and delicious and the eggs were so fluffy!

My friend got the Fillmore omelet that contained mushrooms, bell peppers, cheese and ham - simple but delicious! It came with cooked, chopped potatoes and toast. YUMMMMM!

I love the environment in this restaurant! But seats are somewhat hard to find on busy days since they dont seat you. Parking is difficult as well and also the food took about 20 minutes to come.. so definitely anticipate a wait!
author: Linda K.

description:
Day 3 of playing tourist in SF: some non-touristy errands needed to be run so I bribed my friend with breakfast at Squat & Gobble to come with me and ensure I didn't purchase anything from Paper Source when I went in for a return.

I ordered the Santa Fe scrambler (no mushrooms) and an iced coffee. We went outside to sit on the patio that I didn't even know existed. It was extremely pleasant since the weather was so gorgeous.

Our food and drinks came out pretty quickly and as usual, portions were enormous. But so tasty. I just love their potatoes. And even though we had both made modifications to our meals, they were accurate.

It definitely wasn't cheap but you could actually share a meal here the plates are so large!

Since I've already been to the one in the Haight, I knew what to expect and this location definitely delivered. YUM
author: Rachel E.

description:
I needed something sweet to eat and I yelped this little gem. I only ordered their apple-crisp crepe dessert with a side of vanilla ice cream. The crepe and apple filling was quite tasty, but the 'crisp' part was a little too crunchy or something - hard to explain - the textures didn't belong together, it was more like granola than 'crisp'. I ended up scraping it off (hence the 4 stars). But the rest was very good.
The place was clean with friendly staff.
author: Shawnta W.

description:
I'm sorry but Squat & Gobble is might just be the most depressing place on Chestnut. My boyfriend and I had been avoiding it for the longest time, just based on the looks of it,  until one night we were desperately craving pancakes and low and behold, S&G was the only place making pancakes at 7pm.

What really got to me was the place's interior. Decorated like an old folk's home and populated with the same demographic, S&G was depressing, underwhelming, and not a place I would ever want to spend 20 minutes in. With a little bit of redecorating (guys, this is a restaurant not a hospital lounge), this place could be a lot better.

We both ordered the blueberry pancakes which were surprisingly blueberry-less. Instead, we received plain pancakes topped with some sort of fake blueberry goo. How hard is it to just put real blueberries inside guys??! For $10 a pop, that was disappointing and just plain lazy on their end.

While the pancakes themselves were actually pretty good (although completely devoid of any real blueberries), the atmosphere was just so depressing we walked out without finishing our meal. If you really don't care about the aesthetics of your surroundings, perhaps you'll have a more enjoyable experience than we did, but even still, the food is on par with the Cheesecake factory..
author: Rachel L.

description:
Line out the door, all tables are empty, food isn't that good, only one person taking orders. When I complained to the manager he literally said "it is what it is, this is how we do it".
Not coming here again.
author: B W.

description:
Huge fan of this place in the Marina! This place gets pretty busy during the morning. I ordered the Nor Cal omelette with egg whites, best I've ever had. The filling contained sun dried tomatoes, avocados, salsa, mushrooms, and cheese....which was then wrapped in egg whites infused with chopped apple sausages. The breakfast also comes with toast and I got the fruit salad instead of the potatoes. Great breakfast!

Tip: You get a 10% off coupon when you check in =)
author: Kevin L.

description: Strolling pass a Friday afternoon decided to give this place a try. First thing that came to mind when you enter is it feels like a Crepevine, but a little smaller which isn't a bad thing. Ordered the Western Burger w/ fries and my girl ordered the Salmon Cobb Salad. Food took a little long but i didn't mind since the World cup match on. Food was good but the bunsize to meat pattysize ratio wasn't to my liking. Other than that the food was good service was nice and the atmosphere was relaxing.
author: Julian T.

description: A San Francisco go-to spot for me. I love the sea food noodle plate they have (I cant remember what they call it, but it has sea food and noodles ;) I think the mimosas are too expensive, but they are tasty too. Salads are also nice here too. At the Haight location, I love the outdoor patio on a nice SF day. Not too many places with a true outside patio area in SF.
author: Paige H.

description: They are insanely good here. My job is now in this area and most restaurants don't open early. This place does and their menu is an all day menu. How freakin awesome is that???? The past two weeks I been enjoying their burgers,crepes and pasta. Their fresh squeeze orange juice is DELISH!! I love orange juice especially when it is fresh squeeze. It's an addiction to have a place like this so easy to access. Early hours with no traffics in and outside of the restaurant. No hassle is the way I need things to be right now. Thanks guys for such a sweet dreams of what dish to get next.
author: S F.

description:
Basically a diner with a different feel. Food could be better prepared and service isnt the best either. If the staff isnt going to be helpful to customers, they should make it more convenient to customers i.e. Napkins, extra silverware or water. It makes this place confusing... Is it sit down or take-out? 

I prefer the squat and gobble in the Lower Haight.
For the Marina, youre better off someplace else!
author: Bea A.

description:
One evening meal and three brunches. Had a different meal each time and the food was excellent.

Clean, tasty, quick, fresh food.

Highly recommend this place - staff are ultra friendly. 5 of us ate here ranging from $70 to $85 all in. You won't be disappointed. 

And unlike some of the other establishments all the food came out together!!

Can't wait to go back!
author: Neil R.

description: We got the Reuben sandwich and a veggie fajita crepe with two side salads. The side salads were wet but from water and couldn't identify the dressing. Ruben came out really soggy and oddly enough, the fajita crepe was super soggy as well.
author: Sylvia P.

description:
I've been here a couple of times for brunch, it's a good go-to spot for weekend brunch where you shouldn't have to wait. Also, easy to split the bill since you pay then sit, so good for groups. 

The food is pretty good, the mimosas were the best though! I definitely recommend the mimosas. I've gotten the huevos rancheros and it was very tasty, fresh, and true to form when it comes to huevos rancheros.
author: Molly S.

description: We had a breakfast the day before this but what we ordered today was better. Previous day we ordered a breakfast burrito, breakfast croissant and eggs Florentine. The burrito was a little too big for me but it was great still. But today! My daughter ordered the Hangover crepes and I tried it. OMG! Incredible! My wife ordered Zorba crepes. Delicious! My bourbon omelette was great too! Service, atmosphere and location are superb. Cafe mocca is great!
author: Milorad S.

description: 3 stars because they gave us white wine in our mimosas. The French toast was okay. The eggs Benedict were pretty good though. Your average joes of breakfast\brunch.
author: Dulce O.

description: This use to be one of my favorite places to eat at in SF but it has gone downhill. I came here for a late lunch with a few of my friends and we were disappointed. I ordered the Asian salad which tasted bland and was pretty watery. Another friend ordered the marina crepe which she thought was mediocre and one someone else ordered the French onion soup. We left half of our plates untouched. After we had finished up we kept walking by all of the other restaurants in the area and definitely felt restaurant envy. If your in the marina skip S&G and head to one of the other joints. You'll be glad you did.
author: Nava N.

description:
The only reason this restaurant gets three stars is because the food was delicious. Other than that, terrible. The initial line, just to order, was short--two people and then my boyfriend and I. Please explain why we were standing in the front of the line for 5 minutes before anyone asked if we'd been helped. Even after we said no, it was a few more minutes until anyone took our order. Then, the waitress didn't know the menu (a fatal flaw, in my opinion). We sat out front (this was a beautiful Friday morning) and waited for our food. And waited. The, proceeded to wait some more. 

Finally, after about 30 minutes, the food came, and it was delicious. Of course, the waiter hadn't been by to refill our water cups, so I asked him to do so. The next time I saw him outside was 5-10 minutes later, so I asked him if I should follow him to get the water, so I could bring it back out myself. He said no, finally brought the water, and the deposited it onto our table with a curt "here". As he walked back inside, I heard him say "too many people!" Now, I've worked in hospitality for several years, and that's a HUGE no-no. 

I understand they restaurant was (somewhat) busy. However, this should never affect a guest or a customer's enjoyment of the experience. Maybe they need to hire more people, maybe they shouldn't employ high-strung people. In any case, the only reason I will be returning is for the French toast, and I will be sure to allow plenty of additional time for the waitstaff's struggles.
author: Chelsea H.

description:
Vile name. Conjures up pictures of snowy Russian steppes with hardy babushkas getting in two primary functions at the same time. Hasn't hurt it, I guess, with a few branches around.

The interior is done in an upmarket diner look, with the menu on a large, easy to read set of boards on the left. Good selection of items including great egg selections, salads, burgers and even a Reuben.

A couple of TV's showing the sport du jour plays in the center. Good, non- obtrusive music playing more than just dancing queen.

The gem here is the back garden area. Yup, an oasis in the center of Chestnut. Absolutely empty on a Monday evening but I have a feeling that Sunday brunch here is big. Heaters for when the SF summer gets really cold.

The Reuben? Good quality on a lightly toasted, light rye. The pickle was flavourful and may not be to everyone's taste but was more original than most. Choice of fries, salad or fruit as a side included.

Nice staff, happy to see someone on a Monday. And there was a yelp check-in 10% discount on the night I went. 

Will come back to sit and eat
author: Pantera W.

description: Delicious food and excellent service. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful. The outdoor seating was nice and relaxing and the waterfall was lovely. I want to try the brownies next!!!
author: Samantha W.

description: COCKROACH IN EGG DISH!    So, so, incredibly gross.  If it hadn't been for the manager, CAS, I would have contacted the Health  Department.  EAT ELSEWHERE in the MARINA!
author: Patricia B.

description: Simple breakfast dishes priced correctly and has outdoor seating. This SF institution location is great for meeting with friends and appeasing all appetites.
author: Regina D.

description:
This is my second time here and today I had the Fillmore omelette out in the patio. The omelette was  a little above average and I really enjoyed the unique homemade jam with my rye toast. 

I don't think the experience for me was good enough for it to make me come back. When a few things you ask for never happen you wouldn't be too excited about it either. Butter on the side with toast never made it on the plate, heater request for outside patio was forgotten (I was having a business meeting and was caught up in convo and realized at the end I was freezing to death) and we got our own utensils from the back area. 

It was decent food, service and ambiance but for me nothing too captivating for me to come back.
author: Sarah K.

description: Came in here for lunch after visiting the Palace of Fine Arts with a party of 10, mostly kids.  Great atmosphere and the fresh squeezed orange juice is phenomenal.  Food was great and the service was insanely fast.  I don't think we were sitting at our table for more than 10 minutes when the food came out which is great when you have 6 young kids - get in get out! I would have liked to try their crepes but I didn't see any breakfast style crepes.  The ones I saw on the menu were all sandwich type crepes (Philly cheesesteak, etc).
author: Chad F.

description: French Toast was bomb the hangover was well seasoned and tasty. Service was also friendly quick and rich coffee which is exactly what I needed.
author: Dana B.

description: The food is amazing, no question. I'm not allowed to have pork and I asked what was inside of one of the crepes and was told it was turkey, so I got it. I came back a few weeks later and found out that there is in fact pork inside of that crepe. I felt so disgusting and cannot stop thinking about being lied to so that I would just buy the food and stop asking questions. Hope the employees receive proper training in the future regarding ingredients and understand the needs of customers with dietary restrictions.
author: Angie S.

description: This place used to be decent back in the day, now the last 3 times I've been there the quality and taste of the food is totally mediocre bordering bad. I had the club sandwich and my friend ordered the crab Benedict. Neither of us finished our food. Price gouged for poor food is unreasonable and it says a lot about the owner. Will not be returning.
author: Jason P.

description:
Right on Chestnut St in the Marina, there's lots of metered parking where it can be hard to find depending on the time of day. Even though you go to the counter, order, and then grab a seat, there are waiters that walk around that would bring you the food and refill on water (or anything else you need). 

Looks small from the outside, but not only do they have quite a few tables inside, they have a few tables out by the sidewalk AND they have a back patio! I only found out about the back patio when they asked  me where I would be seated when I placed my order. I saw the patio's exit after I ate and it looked very nice. Probably would sit in the back next time since my friend had to sit in the front to watch his bike.

So I was here for brunch on Memorial Day since it was the last day of the Mark di Suvero Exhibit in Crissy Fields. We were going to walk over to the exhibit after eating since it was nearby and a gorgeous day for a walk.

Our Order:
Fresh OJ ($3.95)
Fresh OJ Mimosa ($6.95)
Crab Cake Florentine Breakfast Special: ($10.95) Two Crab Cakes, Two Poached Eggs & Sautéed Spinach Served on an English Muffin Topped with Hollandaise Sauce & Served with your choice of side: Rosemary Garlic Potatoes / Fresh Fruit / Salad (I picked the Rosemary Garlic Potatoes)
Marina Savory Crepe: ($10.75) Salmon, Spinach, Onions, Capers, Mozzarella Cheese, Kalamata Olives, Sun Dried Tomatoes & Pesto

I had ordered the Fresh Squeezed OJ when I was waiting for my friend arrive in order to hold a table. They have the orange juice machine right behind the cashier so you could see the oranges beings squeezed of it's yummy juices. They were sweet as well so even though it was $4 for a cup of OJ (a tad pricey but you're in the Marina), it was worth it on a warm sunny day. For the mimosa, since they use the same fresh OJ, you could barely taste the champagne (which is how I like it but also dangerous because you'd keep drinking them!).

I hadn't eaten in about a day, so I didn't feel so guilty eating my Crab Cake Florentine. It was definitely very rich and filling with all the starch but oh so good! The eggs were cooked perfectly and the spinach soft. The Hollandaise wasn't too tart but creamy. The English muffin was toasted just enough and easy to cut apart (generally a pet-peeve of mine when I have difficulties cutting into my English muffins). The Rosemary Garlic Potatoes had crispy skin and soft potatoes on the inside. Lots of rosemary (which I liked) but hardly tasted any garlic (bummer because I'm a huge garlic fan as well!).

My friend had the Marina which he greatly enjoyed after a long morning of biking around the bay. Though he did mention the crepe was a bit on the thick side he was starving so didn't care too much. Oh and if you don't like olives, be forewarned, they put a lot in it (but I love olives so that's a plus for me!). 

Service is barely there as they just drop off the food. We asked for more water but none ever came. Oh wellz. We just decided to leave and continue talking as we walked over to Crissy Field.

Would come back for the Crab Cake Florentine, the fresh OJ and to check out the back patio!
author: Kitty K.

description: Nice staff, large, diverse menu that includes several gems (Onion Soup, Mee Goreng, Salmon Cobb, Greek Salad), best sidewalk patio for people watching in the Marina.  Only disappointment: meat portions have noticeably shrunk on the salmon and chicken sandwiches.
author: Hank L.

description: Bottomless coffee, free wifi and an ENORMOUS omelete with delicately seasoned potatoes and sourdough toast. YES PLEASE!!! Breakfast here was a highlight. We sat inside but there was a lovely outdoor courtyard in the back. This place seems to attract quite a few of the stroller brigade, however.
author: Sharon W.

description:
**FOOD: 4 STARS**
**SERVICE aka Manager: 1 STAR**

Another impromptu family outing and we found ourselves here on a late Sunday afternoon... all starving and all eager to grub.

The manager/host that was taking our order was a bit snooty since he kept telling me and the family to stay in one line... HOWEVER, the people in front of us were all over the place and not a peep about keeping in a line... go figure. 

Anyway, the family ordered a lot of food... I forgot what each person got but I did remember tasting their Chicken Peppardelle and it was good. The alfredo sauce wasn't too creamy - just right.

Their chocolate cake and their mocha were delicious as well. 

I guess my only quirk will be their inconsistent "rule" when ordering to the counter. Didn't help that their own manager was filled with attitude... Yes it's the Holidays... but keep it consistent!
author: Cath M.

description:
Got the Maina Crepe. It was good but the fellow patrons were douche bags. Typical Marina turds drunk at 11 am and super hands on with the waitress. Like seriously? Youre taking that from some waste of air who isnt going to leave you a tip? 
they pretty much killed the good vibes sorry if im too much of a "feminist" or i just dont like to see disrespecting of women in general but they should have been asked to leave. 

Meh. the Marina.
author: Lisa L.

description:
An extensive menu. Seriously though...sandwiches, pastas, salads, crepes...the list goes on and on. 

What we ordered:
-A turkey burger: it was good. It had a cranberry spread inside that made it stand out.
-Fettucine pasta with chicken and broccoli. This was also good, nothing special. The sauce was a bit thin but still tasty.
-Fresh strawberry crepe: This was great! It was a perfect way to end our meal. It was cool cause I was able to order it but they just waited to make it, and served it when I was finished with my meal. 

Restrooms: Separate restrooms for men and women. The women's restroom only has one toilet. It was clean for the most part and stocked.
author: Aimee R.

description: Squat & Gobble is great - easy and casual. Quick food and plenty of seating. The food is great - veggie burger, omelette (nice and cheesy!), fresh OJ. Pleasant staff, indoors and outdoor seating, catch the game on tv in the background. All good, an easy place to meet friends and have some good food.
author: R M.

description:
Love this place!

Great back garden patio! Always get a table even though it is always busy for brunch.  

Haven't gotten something that I don't like.  Would recommend the crepes, omelettes, and croissant sandwich!
author: Roya B.

description:
I really wanted to like this place because I am a sucker for chalkboard menus (yes, I am THAT lame), but after a sub-par experience paired with sub-par food, I can't exactly say that I have any reason to like it.

A friend and I came in during late lunch time around 1:15, and the place was only a quarter full. This place has really large capacity, so that should have been a tell-tale sign to us that we should have gone to one of 329390 restaurants on Chestnut, but we thought Squat & Gobble was cute so we came in.

I ordered the salmon salad and my friend got some sort of burger, and I'm pretty sure it took us 35 minutes to get our food. Which would have been tolerable had the restaurant been filled to near full capacity, but like I said, it really wasn't anywhere close to being full. And I've never waited that long for my food anywhere else on Chestnut. The food was tolerable, but my salad tasted more of lemon than anything else.

Meh.
author: Jenn L.

description:
I rarely want to write a negative review, but the food was really awful.

I had the chicken pappardelle, which was drenched in onion, garlic and butter. I honestly had 2 bites and couldn't go on. My husband's rigatoni was also way too heavy on the garlic and had a 'weird' taste.

In addition, my son who lives for fries, ate 4.

Beware.
author: jen m.

description:
Five Stars for sure!

My Squat & Gobble experience this past weekend was nothing short of amazing.  The staff (but most especially-- Cas!) were wonderful to my family and me.  My cousins were in town from Chicago and we decided to have a little mini-reunion.  Gathering 12 people and getting them to agree on a brunch spot is hard, but with Squat & Gobble it became super easy.  

I loved their streamlined process.  Take a peek at the menu, order at the register, and Cas (to the rescue!) set us up with a great table in the patio area.  After perusing yelp and their online menu, I was pretty sure I knew what I wanted.  I ordered the Crab Cake Florentine (basically a crab cake benedict with spinach) and a mimosa.. Yum!  

The patio was gorgeous--so homey and with beautiful sunshine and a little SF chill.  Its heated and has a roof (if necessary) so need to worry about rain or what not.  The wonderful staff brought out all of our food, drinks, and utensils and we just dug in.  My crab cake florentine was WONDERFUL.  I loved the Hollandaise sauce and the crab cakes just melted in your mouth.  They were served with a side of house potatoes (which I requested to be extra crispy!) which were super yum.  My mimosa was the perfect treat for brunch.   Our water was consistently refilled and Cas himself came out to check on us repeatedly.  Again--wonderful service!

My only real qualm was with the food size.  Once I saw the crepes on the menu (and my cousin-in-law ordered the berry nutella crepe), I was craving one badly.  My crab cake florentine was too filling though--I couldn't even finish my potatoes, so I had to miss out on my crepe :(  Next time though, I'm bringing hubs and he'll help me :)
author: Leanne P.

description: Good food but nothing made this an incredible restaurant. I think I could have gotten equally good breakfast elsewhere and possibly with better service. I ordered champagne and ended up with a glass of Chardonnay... which was a bit odd for 10am. I didn't feel like disputing it so I drank it (but I'm not penalizing them for that - it was my choice obviously.) Crab cakes Benedict were pretty good. It was fine overall. May or may not return. It's not a standout good or bad.
author: Kristy C.

description: Glad I looked at yelp before coming here because there was a 10% off deal for checking in :) Came for Sunday Brunch and ordered one of their savory crepes; the Mamma Mia. It was so good and reminded me of Lasagna. The crepe came with a side of their garlic potatoes and I know I will go back again just for that. yum
author: Michelle C.

description: Cool environment, great food, friendly staff, really enjoyed this experience! Walk to the GG bridge afterwards!
author: Jeremy W.

description: Straight up, best Fruity nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream I've ever had.
author: Colleen T.

description:
The best breakfast burrito!!

Pros: awesome, really good breakfast spot! The coffee and fresh juices were delicious. Very relaxed and laid back atmosphere. Great and friendly staff!

Cons: none!
author: Kyle L.

description:
I didn't have the crepes. Maybe that was a mistake.

We were in a bit of a rush (wanted to finish dinner in about an hour), and most other places have huge lines, so we decided to just stop by this place because of the cute name.

Everything was pretty mediocre, starting from ordering at the counter, to the food. There's no usual SF-esque warmth from the person at the counter (maybe it's been an exhausting night?). When we get our food, we find it just so-so, not very usual of a small modern eatery in SF.

I got a cocktail that just tasted sweet. The tempura fish and chips? Meh. I've had much better. The mister didn't seem too much into the mac and cheese either.

To the server's credit, the guy who brought out our food was pretty nice, but that didn't save our meal.

Like I said, maybe I should've ordered a crepe instead. It seemed to be what everybody had and the only thing people cared for from this place.
author: Alice C.

description: The food was decent, pancakes were a little too thick and doughy though.  The place was crowded and very loud.  Its seat yourself, so it was tough to find a table for six.   It took them a long time to deliver all of our parties orders, and we had to remind them about our orders.  Overall, I would say don't expect the best service don't expect the best service during peak brunch hours on a Saturday
author: Chris S.

description:
Absolutely delicious food as well as presentation, but they really need to work on their service. Maybe it was just my experience I'm not sure, but my cousin and I finally got our food when my sister and her boyfriend were already half way eating there. Usually in this situation, my cousin and I felt as if we had to rush eating our food since my sister and her boyfriend would soon be done eating there's. Another note, we didn't get our food until we had to ask them about it twice. Hence, the drop in 1 star.

Squat & Gobble has a variety of great food -- wonderful place for brunch (crepes, omelettes, eggs, breakfast specials, salads, sandwiches, pasta, and others). You just go up to the cashier and order, they give you a number, and you find seating for yourself and your party (extra seating available in the back patio).

My cousin and I both ordered the same dish - CHICKEN PESTO CREPE (sliced chicken breast, mozzarella, onions, pesto and sun-dried tomatoes). The crepes are served with choice of rosemary garlic potatoes or mixed baby green salad. We both chose the ROSEMARY GARLIC POTATOES.

The CHICKEN PESTO CREPE was absolutely amazing. It was gush full of strong flavors (especially from the sun-dried tomatoes, which were a good size and not small). The cheese was fully melted which is a must for me whenever there's cheese and it's a hot dish. The ROSEMARY GARLIC POTATOES were cubed and still had their skin on. They were very crunchy at the edges and soft when bitten into. The spicing was perfect and really helped bring out the potatoes. If you ever were given the choice of having these potatoes or mixed baby green salad, choose the rosemary garlic potatoes. They're more carbs, but you can get mixed baby green salads anywhere. 

My sister and her boyfriend got CRAB CAKE FLORENTINE (Two crab cakes, two poached eggs & sautéed spinach on an English muffin topped with hollandaise sauce. Served with potatoes or fresh fruit) and a BREAKFAST BURRITO. I didn't have a taste of them, but I did get pictures (in the Photo section) and the dishes were gorgeously done with a variety of pretty colors and what not. 

Wouldn't mind coming back and trying something new. Hopefully, this time, our food comes out in a reasonable manner.
author: Diana N.

description: Service is pretty good. The cashier was very pleasant. Food is presented very nicely. Actually would love to come back to try more of their menu.
author: Xbbygirl X.

description:
I like this place! Super close to ours, which made deciding where to eat brunch hassle-free. Food choices are always an ordeal, so maybe the convenience makes me biased, haha.

There was a long line, which confused me until I realized you order at the counter and then choose wherever you'd like to sit. Fine by me, as it gave me enough time to figure out what to order. Their (strangely diverse, yet good for families) menu is conveniently showcased across their wall. 

We ventured to the patio outside where they have a beautiful seating area and our food came quickly. The servers were super kind and our waters were always full.

My tumtum was hurting from the night before, so I opted for a pot of tea and the crunchy granola with yogurt, strawberries, and bananas. The yogurt was a bit too bitter for me, so I'd choose the milk option next time as long as they have soy milk or another lactose-free option.

BF got the breakfast burrito, which, to my advantage, was HUGE and loaded so I got to fill up on the last few yummy bites of it. :)

I think I'd only come here to eat brunch or try one of their dessert crepes because the combination of breakfast + pastas + chinese food + burgers + crepes + seafood weirds me out...
author: Michele P.

description: This place has great service, but the tranniness is terrible. I will never come here for a day of tranning again
author: Gary G.

description: It was pleasant to eat there, besides they made no fuss when I customized my order. Sadly their poached egg came out a bit overdone but the bacon and muffin were as ordered.  I don't know why water here had a strange taste, but after a sip I skipped it. Certainly a nice spot for a quick bite to eat in the middle of the Marina.
author: Lynn S.

description:
I am reviewing this place based on a single visit but given the plethora of various cafes and restaurants, most of them only get one chance if they don't impress me.

I have tried Mama Mia and did not see anything special with it. Housemade lemonade is also standard but decent.

There is a patio at the back which is pretty easy to miss. If you visit this place, definite sit at the patio.
author: Gokhan T.

description: Not happy! Ordered poached eggs with bacon and paid extra for French toast. Dish came with no toast so when I asked for it waiter told me to go up to counter and order it. Firstly, who eats poached eggs with sugar covered French toast and secondly do you think I'm going to wait 10 minutes whilst my meal goes cold for a slice of bread. #customerservicefail
author: Maria S.

description:
I went to Squat and Gobble and got the Belgian waffle, which was really good. It had powdered sugar, strawberries, whipped cream, and peppermint- all of which was good(even the peppermint). 
It was not really loud like the others I had been to- you could actually hear the people around you. The restaurant was decorated nicely and was clean. 
It was a very nice restaurant.
author: Olivia S.

description: Food was awesome, bloody Mary's were a little too spicy. Server swapped them out for mimosas. Awesome customer service and great food.
author: Robert C.

description:
One of the best meals we had while visiting SF last weekend. The crepes were amazing, of course. I had the roasted tomatillo crepe and my daughter had the berry crepe...so YUM!  

But I am giving this place 5 stars b/c of the service. It was painfully obvious that my daughter and I were tourists (could have been the Texas Longhorn hat I was wearing?) but the guy at the counter greeted us as we walked in and explained how things worked. He was beyond helpful. Plus, they let us go back to our hotel and come back to use their wi-fi since the wi-fi at our hotel was so slow. I wish we had gone back one more time. I want another crepe!
author: Miranda W.

description: Every single dish tasted great, we ordered a bunch of main dishes and shared them, good Job guys!
author: Eddie N.

description:
My colleague and I have been eating lunch here 3-5 times per week. The main attraction has been and continues to be the salads which are large and mostly very good. Understandably prices have risen over the years. However, the last time I was there they raised the prices approximately 15-20 percent and refused to honor the Yelp discount.
In effect, I was charged four dollars more for the same salad I had last week.
I can only assume they got greedy or they made a mistake. $16.50 inclusive of tax is too much.
author: Jeff N.

description:
This was my first time here at this restaurant and I attended a co-ed baby shower. The patio in the back was reserved for this event so this review is with this in mind. The patio area was great. It was felt elegant with the tent covering. 

They served several dishes buffet style listed below:

- Caesar salad: romaine hearts, herb croutons, shredded parmesan cheese & homemade caesar dressing (the dressing was great, nice garlic kick with anchovy hints, very flavorful)

- Angus Beef Rigatoni: sautéed beef tenderloin, onions, mushrooms & garlic, served in a traditional stroganoff sauce (good dish, pasta was cooked al dente)

- Grilled Fresh Salmon (cooked perfectly and moist, almost rare in the center of some pieces, there were herbs and fresh lemon on each piece, my favorite dish)

- Sides of roasted new potatoes and grilled asparagus: (both done well with good seasoning)

- Dessert strawberry and Nutella crepes: (good dessert and crepes were cooked well)

- Water pitchers had citrus fruits and some herbs or something leafy green which was a nice touch and tasted good
   
Last but not least, the service was exceptional. Many servers were available, friendly, and very courteous. This was surprising to me because it was a group event so I didn't expect such excellent service. Keep it up! I will be back to try more items on the menu.
author: Lawrence L.

description:
Solid, if not spectacular lunch/brunch spot on the Marina. It is comparable to a spot like the Crepe House in Nob Hill, though I would prefer the latter if given the choice. You have your standard brunch fare here, as well as some sandwiches and crepes. I haven't tried any of the crepes, but nothing I have ordered elsewhere on the menu has really wowed me. Both the sandwich and omelette were standard in my book. Certainly not something to frown at but nothing to get me excited about the prospect of returning either. 

They have some typical SF/Marina charm, and a large patio out back to sit in. The prices are average for its location and the portions are, again, standard. They do fill you up for a decent price, but you can do better in the City.
author: Taylor C.

description:
Food is decent but surprisingly expensive. Breakfast croissant was good. Service was great. 

My problem is with the managment or ownership - whoever thought it was a great idea to complain about the Affordable Care Act. Nevermind the 10 million people who are now insured, pay a 3.5% surcharge to cover our own rising costs! This sign pissed me off and I'm never eating here again. The food was already expensive, there's no way an extra 3.5% is necessary. 

However, I wouldn't even had known if they had just upped the menu price. Either way, I don't go to breakfast to hear the restaurant's political commentary.
author: Dillon M.

description:
i've been lazy on these yelp reviews but this one definitely needs commenting for.. undoubtedly without all the setbacks I would have given a higher rating but it is what it is.

UGH. I usually try to give stores, restaurants and service the benefit of the doubt because things do happen and sometimes it's really beyond their control but in this case.. absolutely not.

Maybe I just have high expectations.. but when it comes to food, is that really a bad thing?

After what seemed like an eternity to find parking on a busy Sunday morning, we decided to get brunch before strolling around. The menu is huge and easy to read, detailing exactly what you were going to get and sounded delicious. I immediately noticed that this place is open seating and you have to get your own table. They give you a number and you can sit wherever is free. 

After about 10 minutes of waiting in line to place our food orders, we were finally next and the line stopped moving. They were apparently too backed up or having some sort of computer issue where the orders couldnt be processed properly. Given there were 2 registers, it made no sense that it was not in use since the line had increased to almost out the door. instead, one of the servers was standing there counting the same stack of cash... starting over and over every so often..Use a calculator if you can't add. -___-

We ordered the Fillmore Omelette, Prime Rib Melt and Mimosas. Up to this point, everything I just brushed off but now is when it gets ridiculous. The couple who had sat down next to us, was actually behind me in line. Not only did they get their food first, which looked more complicated to make. They were finished before we even got our food. It DOES NOT take 30 minutes to make an omelette and a sandwich. Especially since the tables around us also had ordered sandwiches. I had to request that a server check on our order multiple times before our food was finally brought out.

To add to my disappointment, the food was subpar. Given the wait time, I would've expected something tasty. My boyfriend makes better food than they do and I wouldn't have to pay him $30 for the meal. The fruit wasn't ripe and my omelette was mediocre. His Prime Rib Melt tasted more like a Grilled Cheese Sandwich with onions. I was surprised the food wasn't cold. As you sit and wait, you see all the servers wandering aimlessly all over the restaurant looking for the order numbers with no luck. We saw them walked around the restaurant and to the patio three times with the same set of food. On a misty rainy day.. that's just gross. 

The only perk was that the mimosa was made with fresh squeezed orange juice. And the servers are nice.. slow but nice. Can't completely blame them on how inefficient the restaurant set up is. Potentially it would be less of a disaster on a different day but I definitely will not be coming back.

slow. over priced for something i could make at home. and extremely unorganized. i would rather wait in line at mama's or dotties anyday.

- jenn
author: Jenn Y.

description:
This is a super cute restaurant! But, be prepared to wait for a table. 

You order at the front and not directly to your server and then sit down. They bring the food to your table. There are a couple of tables outside too, if you want to soak up some sunshine.

Pros: So many delicious items no the menu (pancakes, omelets etc)
Mimosas  for $5
Fresh squeezed OJ

Cons: Slightly more expensive for my taste--- for 3 people it was around $45
Narrow seating area

I think the servers share the tip since the tip jar is at the front.

The blueberry pancake was so fluffy and delicious. I was full after eating that with my glass of OJ.
author: Mary Y.

description: The pesto chicken crepe was very dry and the crepe too thick. The onion soup had an off flavor and very little onion. No joy for the money.
author: Jane J.

description: The idea of brunch here is nice but the food does not stack up to the price asked. My husband and I dropped in for a south of the border omelette and an order of pahd thai which had me a little concerned as most restaurants that offer completely different cuisines can really fail at providing both. Squat and Gobble is no exception.  The pahd thai was a complete disappointment, it was watery and lacked the proper balance of hot, sour and sweet that is normally the jewel of this dish plus the noodles were more in the line for pahd prik king being very wide and overdone. They also dump an inordinate amount of tofu to pad out the plate with only a slight smattering of peanuts. The sauce that makes this dish was so soupy most of it failed to stick to the noodles.    The south of the border omelette was terrible. Basically a thick black bean stew spiced with cumin, oregano, chili powder, bay leaf, powered garlic and other assorted spices that was also exceedingly unbalanced. There was no chorizo and the beans clashed with an avocado crema like sauce that gave the overall dish a decidedly bitter taste. The accompanying potatoes were almost burned and over salted. It wasn't even as if the kitchen was pressured. I would not recommend this place.
author: Hector A.

description: I had a busy day at work and was looking for a simple heathy dinner, what was to come next was not what you want when you have lots more work to do. I ordered the salmon Pasta dish, and it ruined my night, food poisoning from this place. I had enjoyed their food in the past for breakfast. Now I will never go back to this neighborhood spot. Made me feel sick with food poisoning all night.
author: Michael C.

description: Came with friends to this spot.  It's easy to miss because of it's location below a club and sandwiched away between retail shops on the side of a little side street BUT this is one place I'm glad I didn't miss!  As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by the guy behind the counter. He was very friendly and we asked for his recommendations and he spouted off a few. All my friends ordered something different but decided on the Gobble Club: Roasted Turkey Breast, Crispy Bacon, Fresh Arugula, Tomatoes & Homemade Cranberry Aioli, Served on Grilled Herb Flat Bread ($12.50).  Within a few minutes, our food was on the table.  Everything was very good.  The server kept coming up refilling our drinks, making conversation and being very friendly and welcoming not only to us, but everyone in there as well.  As far as my sandwich, it was pretty amazing. The cranberry aioli really stood out for me and made the entire sandwich, as did the flat bread instead of just regular toast bread.  If you are ever in the area, don't miss it.
author: Alex G.

description: Recommended by a friend who used to live in San Francisco. Great little neighborhood eatery in walking distance from our motel on Lombard. Clean and cozy environment with great food and fast service. My husband and I ordered two crepes to share for a late breakfast: Zorba the Greek and Fruit & Nutella. The accompanying breakfast potatoes and whipped cream for the sweet crepe were fresh and tasty. My husband ordered orange juice that was fresh squeezed from very good oranges. Definitely a place to return to!
author: Kirsten S.

description:
I recently crossed the threshold into savory crepes territory (word up, Creperie St. Germain) so I had high hopes for a recent weekday breakfast at S & G.  Their savory options are all packed with ingredients, but unfortunately, I am a less-is-more chick.  So I chose the Zorba the Greek and edited it down to feta, spinach, onion, mushrooms and eggplant.  It was satisfying and the cucumber yogurt dressing was a nice touch.  

My choice of side was the fruit salad, which was a huge amount of fruit - good news for this traveler who was missing her daily apples and bananas.  My husband's side however, was potatoes.
