I can't put my finger on why, but those potatoes were the best I've ever had.  Whatever they do - preparation, seasoning, fairy dusting - takes the humble tuber into A+ territory.  So I hereby apologize to my husband for eating half his breakfast (I shared my fruit at least).     

The other notable aspect was the service.  We were greeted warmly and the main staff person at the counter was friendly.  He seemed to enjoy being there, which is always refreshing.   

If we were locals or happily found ourselves in the 'hood again, we'd be back.
author: Beth R.

description:
first time reviewing (:D yay!). ok the food was pretty bomb, i got the chicken pesto crepe, and shared the belgium waffles with my friend Linda, so good. :) the salad with the crepe was good too. She ordered the eggs benedict, she just told me they were the best eggs benedict shes ever had (im not a big fan of eggs but they must have been pretty good, she cleaned out the plate) lol. one bad note, the croissant sandwich was a bit messy but still tasted good, totes coming back here again :) 

my friend said they should consider renaming themselves to sit & swallow LOL
author: Edgar C.

description: Awesome! We both had crepes. I had the apple,brown sugar filled ones, and the husband had his with strawberries, bananas and nutella. It was served with REAL thick whipped cream on the side.They were delicious. I also had a hot mocha. This too, had the delicious whipped cream. I will be back for breakfast the next time we visit San Fran.
author: Shannon J.

description:
Went here a few times, so here's a condensed review. 

Really really good French Toast! The Fresh Strawberry Crepe was nice, but the Whole Thing Crepe was better. Eggs Benedict weren't phenomenal, but good nonetheless. Orange juice was fresh and cold. Servers are very nice and the whole place as a warm, friendly vibe to it. A perfect place to go on a rainy day to warm up!
author: Camille K.

description:
Came here to get a quick lunch on my extremely short break from work.

I would like to commend the staff on getting my food out quickly for a to-go order.   They even served me a glass of water while i was waiting.  The water tasted like bleach, so i spat it out.  I appreciated the thought though.

Pesto Chicken Crepe with Potatoes
- the whole dish was very plain tasting considering it was pesto
- the chicken breast was juicy even though it is supposedly grilled - which surprised me - very impressive if they really grilled it. good portions too
- crepe was thicker skinned than crepevine
- cheese was melty
- sun dried tomatoes could have more of a kick to it, because they were not as tangy as i had hoped
- potoatoes were fried and crispy on the outside, would have gone perfect with some ketchup if remembered to ask.

Overall, a perfectly a-ok place to get some food.  it is not bad at all!  but it's not too amazing either.  I still prefer crepevine to squat and gobble and I probably will be exploring the area more and trying out different places before i come back here.
author: Tina A.

description:
Love all the S&G locations..food is consistently good and the price is right.  Tonight, here at the Marina location, the guy behind the counter announces, to each customer, as they peruse the menu that everything is available,in this radio announcer sort of voice.

It's really annoying to listen to in this small space...and besides....shouldn't everything on the menu be available?   It's as though he's pointing out that the sky is blue.

Chill out dude.  You look desperate to impress...someone.
author: Unemployed D.

description:
We were so disappointed with this morning's breakfast.  First off, it took us 25 minutes to get our food, even though the place was not packed.  Then the food was cold and just tossed on the plate. My husband got 1 1/2 sausages, not two as stated on the menu.  Prices have gone up as well.
This used to be one of our go to places, no more.
author: Donna R.

description:
Everything here is good! But if you have to get just one thing, go for a crepe -- sweet or savory. Whatever your preference is. Personally, I go for the nutella banana one.
Oh and their lattes are very good!
author: Jessica L.

description: I love coming here and especially when I'm craving awesome fries!!! I've never had a miss here and for a semi fast food sit down the service is good. Today is our first time eating breakfast here. We normally come for lunch and all their sandwiches are great but the fries are the great topper!!! The fresh squeeze OJ is super sweet and the blueberry pancakes and eggs florentine were equally as good as any sandwich I've had here!!! The blueberries on top of the pancakes were enough and I didn't even need the syrup or whipped cream! But i did need to order a side of bacon with my pancake.  The rosemary garlic potatoes that came with the eggs florentine were superb!!!!!!
author: Sayuri I.

description: I asked for a small addition to my meal. They forgot to include it at the register so when the meal came out I asked the server, Abel, for it and he gave me a lot of attitude and said that it wasn't on the ticket. I asked him to correct it, and he said, "Fine I will bring it out with the ticket." My thoughts are that for an additional $1 charge you cannot just correct it? Are you really going to bring a new bill for a $1. Furthermore the food was heavily salty and generally very average. Much better places in the neighborhood, look elsewhere.
author: Thor B.

description:
Though the name sounds like it would be a place where truckers would gather, it is anything but. I got the Castro omelette, and it was filling and delicious. It also came with a great selection of fresh fruit. I opted for some fresh squeezed orange juice as well. Good choice on my part.

Small complaint (literally): The water glasses are too small. I came thirsty and I sipped up my water quickly and then a busser did not come around with a pitcher for a bit. Sure, the pitcher had lemons in it and it was super hip, but I still don't appreciate having to wait that long.

It should also be noted that lots of attractive people dined here while my friend and I were here. It can be seen as a detriment if you find yourself intimidated around pretty people (especially when gobbling) but I felt like it was cool and it made me feel cool for being here, like I was in some hot people who like good food club.

It's a really cute ambiance, but it's very loud on Sunday mornings. Hot people cannot keep their mouths shut, apparently.

I'd recommend squatting and gobbling here anytime.
author: Sam D.

description:
Good environment, I like the seating out back. Food did not cost too much and taste good.

Very fresh and clean. Awesome Breakfast. I like the patio seating
author: Botanicare A.

description:
Sunday morning a bit rough? Fri night out with a new girl? Just need to feed the Fam in the evening. Squat and Gobble is the choice. The menu is diverse enough to please vegetarians and Burger aficionados. 

Price point is good. Beer and wine selection is serviceable and the staff is always pleasant. When my wife and I can't decide what we want we typically end up here!
author: Jason H.

description:
A good place to chill on a weekday afternoon. The food is decent, but the side condiments are served in heavy proportions. I ordered bagel with lox and the cream cheese on the bagel was overwhelming. My friend ordered pancakes and the amount of cream on the side was a bit excessive. The food was prepared well, though, and the Italian soda that I ordered was amazing. The service was nothing memorable though. I also don't like how you have to stand in line to order your food at the cash register (it's a bit awkwardly located to be honest). The atmosphere is also pretty noisy unless you choose to sit in the garden patio, which is a really pretty area imo.
In total, eating here was pretty decent and I may consider returning.
author: Idk A.

description: Enjoyed our meal and experience here. First time here and was excited to see it specializes in crepes. I ordered the "Italian" my husband ordered the Benedict Florentine w/ crab - both were delicious and hearty portions. Good eats w/ a patio atmosphere, quick service, fresh, hot food...who could complain?
author: Corey R.

description: The menu is more appealing than the actual taste of the food. Safe place to take family but not a place you want to take someone with high "foodie" standards. I'm full but not fully satisfied as the pancakes were pretty dry, the quality of the coffee drink was "eh", yet the breakfast potatoes were above average. The menu is memorable, the food was not.
author: Rhys T.

description: First, there is no Yelp discount. I think they should remove that info. Now, the food! Nor Cal omelet was delicious and huge! The garlic rosemary potatoes were really tasty. It's a funky place which we'll visit again when we get back to San Francisco!
author: Michelle M.

description:
So you're telling me that for $30, me and my dinner date can have 1 glass of wine each, a shared appetizer, and our own entree?  Get outta here!  

I don't know about you, but deals like this in the Marina are like a dime a dozen.  I am baffled why this place isn't more crowded during the dinner hour.  The food isn't to die for, but it's pretty good.   (Though I wouldn't recommend getting one of their seafood dishes because they tend to overcook the fish)  However, they DO pour a generous glass of vino.  The shared appetizer is also a very nice touch. (I'd get the in-house dumplings, which are basically yummy potstickers)
author: Kristen D.

description: This place is terrible. Don't go here. Food is bland, ingredients not fresh, potions small. Just feels cheap.
author: Andrew J.

description:
Super friendly and attentive staff! I was greeted when I walked in, occasionally checking in with me while i was seated enjoying my meal, and thanked me before I left. 

I ordered the chicken pesto crepe with mixed green salad for lunch and it was delicious!! The crepe was packed with chicken and pesto sauce with onions and sun-dried tomatoes. Mixed green salad was flavored with vinaigrette.

They have an outdoor patio and outdoor seating at the store front as well, which is nice on a warmer day in the Marina neighborhood.
author: Nancy N.

description:
Waited long time for glass if water on a hot day. Played were insolent.
Knife dirty, food mediocre. Bad experience
author: Ned L.

description:
Food is great. I love the salmon & scrambled eggs dish.

Only 4 stars because they need to improve their coffee game.
author: David K.

description:
Try the "Whole Thing" crepe! Sweet and satisfying. Definitely get it to share with someone since they are huge.

Huge menu with food options for all meals.

Service was fast and attentive on a Thursday night.
author: Kayla J.

description: Delicious. I got Juevos Rancheros---my partner and I enjoyed it thoroughly. I'll be coming back. Little did I know, it's actually my brother's go-to brunch spot!
author: Lauren J.

description:
I rarely find myself in the Marina but knew that trying to brunch up there around 11 am was going to be tricky, even if we were only a party of two.  I go to the Squat & Gobble in the Castro from time to time and figured it was pretty tasty, standard fare.

We walked right in. Waiting maybe five minutes in line, about ten for food. Got my eggs benny and some coffee to follow an early bloody mary in no time. I'd check it out if you just need to get some breakfast in you to jump start the day.

Thank God I didn't have to wait an hour for brunch. What an amazing concept.
author: Sarah B.

description: Visited my family here, I'm originally from PA. I tried the Spaghetti with Prawns it was the most delicious thing I've ever eaten! The light tomato basil sauce and little tomato chunks were to die for. Can't wait to be back and come here again!
author: Caitlin T.

description: There is ZERO service because you pay at the counter and you have to chase down a staff member to get things.  I don't mind self service but it's set up that you need to ask for help.  Lunch was about $20/person for a salmon salad and pasta dish with 1 soda each-no refills.  Well, they refill but they don't offer it.  You have to beg.  Fool me only once.
author: Linda W.

description:
Like most people who enjoy sleeping in 'til whenever, I like having breakfast at about the three-hours-after-being-awake mark. This fine establishment just happens to offer breakfast whenever that may happen to be for me. Fabulous!

Though I love the crepes and cannot say enough nice things about the breakfast burrito, I was feeling particularly breakfasty and opted for the eye-opener with salad, rye toast, eggs over medium, bacon and some of that fine fresh squeezed orange juice. It was all quite lovely and I surprised myself when I managed to eat it all- even the toast!

My book club partner's french onion soup, which I keep saying that I'm gonna order, tempted me greatly. It will be mine one day. Oh yes. It will be mine.

The bathroom soap smelled lovely.
author: Loli L.

description: What a perfect brunch place during our week long trip to San Francisco. The name sounded a little hokey but we went with it. The wait was a little long but so worth it. We sat in the outdoor area in the back in the sun with the water fountain nearby and birds chirping. Such a lovely atmosphere... and the bottle of champagne didn't hurt either. Love that they let you go overboard with the mimosas. I got eggs Benedict and my partner got huevos rancheros. Both were amazing! Left us is a perfect brunch coma that we walked off at Muir Woods.
author: Ashley K.

description: I needed a place within walking distance of my hotel on my last day in SF and between having chuckled at the name of this place while walking past it the previous night and the Croissant Sandwich sounding particularly tasty, I decided to try it out. This is one of those places where you order at the counter, take a number and then get served at a table, so it's sort of waiter service, but not. My croissant sandwich was definitely good (croissants make most things better), decently sized, and fluffy. The rosemary garlic potatoes that came as a side were the big winner though. I make these at home every now and then, so I'm a fan and in my opinion they did them right.
author: Brian A.

description:
It was 10:00am on a Friday.  Me and my friend supposed to go to Mama in North Beach but the line was way too long..............so we just went here.  

I have been to other locations of this restaurant and this is so far the best one in town. 

The service was quick and friendly.  One thing I like here is their menu.  The menu is extensive.  

We ordered:

Chicken Pesto Crepe - It had Chicken Breast, Mozzarella, Onions, Pesto & Sun-Dried Tomatoes.  The crepe was very good with a lot of ingredients.  Very flavorful.  All crepes come with potatoes, salad or fruit.  The portion was pretty big and filling.    

Eggs Benedict - I liked it too but my friend said the eggs were undercooked.  It also served with potatoes. The rosemary garlic potato was pretty good here, not oily.  

It you want a low-key and fast brunch, this is a good option.
author: Liza T.

description:
Fooooodddd Poooorrrrn!!!  Oh my goodness...how I even stumbled on this place is a true mystery. But when I say I almost fell out when I saw this little place I am not even kidding.  First off the name in and of itself its too cool not to even give it a go!  The inside of this crepery is so bright and cheery...I've actually never been to a place like this in the Bay Area.  The whole set up is pretty tight. So they have the menu up on the wall, but if you don't want to strain your neck looking up just ask for a menu, then place your order at the register.

They have both savory and sweet (dessert) crepes, breakfast, omeletes/egg dishes, soups and salads, burgers, pasta, etc... .  I ordered the BBQ crepe and probably one of the BEST DISHES I HAVE HAD IN A LOOOOONNNGG TIME!!! Hot like fiya!! Lol...and then I paired it with this vanilla tea that was just delicious on a cold San Francisco day.

You gotta go!! :-) Great for breakfast, lunch, dinner...want to impress someone special....good food without breaking the bank.
author: Anisha W.

description:
The sandwiches are TERRIBLE! I am only commenting on what we ordered; cannot say for the rest of the food. First, they need to take cheesesteak OFF the menu being as they have no clue what this is. This was served to us with a slice of unmelted cheese on the top. Really? Then my husband's Ruben was falling apart and he pretty much had to eat it with a fork. Somewhat misses the point of a sandwich.

I do have to say the fries were pretty decent and the guy walking around keeping things tidy and being ever so helpful is the only reason this place gets a star. I'd rather get something over at Denny's before I come to this place ever again!
author: Jennifer B.

description: Recommend. If you are in the marina district and need a solid meal this is your best bet. It is consistently great. Breakfast is impressive. Recommend either the burrito or French toast. The salads for lunch/dinner are huge. You will not leave hungry. Squat and Gobble is very casual. Order at the counter and find a seat. They have quick service and a nice outside seating area in the back. Can't beet the prices for what you get. Figure around $8-$15 per meal depending.
author: Kevin J.

description: There are 2 things wrong with this place. It will ruin all other breakfast places for you and they don't exist on the east coast.  The potatoes are amazing. How do they make potatoes like that?  The coffees are big and the Oj fresh squeezed.  The service is WOW, fast, friendly and on the ball. In the area for breakfast? This is your place. I  would certainly try it for all the other meals too.
author: Brett T.

description:
ONE STAR ON CUSTOMER SERVICE ALONE...

I will start by saying the food is really good! 

If you can get past the rude hipsters that work here... And by hipster I'm mean you Josh... When someone calls and asks if you have waffles.... It probably means they want to order some.... But you couldn't be bothered to take a phone order. Instead you answered yes laughed and hung up!

I walked the two blocks from my place to squat and gobble and to my amazement there were empty tables... There were no empty tables at Judy's, no empty tables at the grove, I'm willing to bet if people didn't have to deal with rude employees there would be no empty tables at squat and gobble as well.  Perhaps management should take this into account at review time.
author: Jeff L.

description: You can always count on Squat and Gobble for a quick meal. Great selection of breakfast, lunch, and dinner items. Not the fanciest place, but super comfortable.
author: Kathy B.

description: Amazing breakfast, love the fresh squeezed orange juice and the fresh whipped cream on the cafe mocha.  The rosemary, garlic potatoes were yummy. Portions are big, making it easy to share.  I wish I had this by me.  I would visit often.  Love the name...that alone is what made I our group check it out.
author: Kim V.

description: Was in the area and stopped for lunch. We ordered the blazing beef with eggplant. At the first bite my wife could tell that the eggplant was rancid. I sent it back and the waitress took it without apologizing. 5 minutes later she comes back and tells us that the cook said the eggplant was overlooked, not rancid. I think we know the difference between overcooked mushy eggplant and foul tasting rotten eggplant! It's insulting and wrong for them to come back with that attitude. To be fair they did bring is another dish without eggplant but by the time it got to us the rest of the table had finished their food. Truthfully it was unacceptable. We will never be back.
author: jon t.

description: I stayed in San Francisco for two days from LA, idk why but customer service in SF is not good (specially in Down town area).This restaurant was the best, they were so nice, friendly and their patio was great and cozy, I had the angus beef rigatoni,  it was a blast. Thank you guys.
author: Ed M.

description:
Pretty good.   Came here for Sunday lunch yesterday.  Would probably want to try some of the other cute places in the area before coming back here though.  

I had the new Tomatillo crepe with onion, mushroom, avocado, ranchero sauce, olive (and couple other ingredients I don't recall).  It was tasty...couldn't finish it though, quite big.

My bf had the prime rib melt and said it was pretty good.  

Bill was like $25.  We decided against drinks as they were a little pricey (6 for mimosa?, and 7 for bloody mary).
author: Anna S.

description:
Nothing like eating the Marina w/Salmon crepe  for breakfast in the Marina District on a sunny Labor Day weekend in The City.  The service is attentive, food is good and not too expensive.  The place was pretty packed but there is a semi-outdoor patio in the back also that almost doubles the amount of seating in the main indoor dining area.

Parking is tough in the area, so I tend to stick to the West Portal location.
author: Tony L.

description:
Lots of tasty options on their menu. Good breakfast, and that's what they're known for. They also have really good pasta and wok dishes. Lately I've been ordering their spicy beef wok, very tasty! Service is pretty good too.

Also, it's a great place to take children. They can always accommodate strollers. I would recommend sitting in the back patio area.
author: David S.

description:
Perfect end to a too-short girls' weekend.

Great prices, friendly staff, giant lattes and fresh squeezed OJ in the mimosas? Not bad on a rainy San Francisco day!

The eggs benedict were some of the best I've nommed and at around $9 with a huge side of home fries? Heaven. 

The area is adorable with endless boutiques just down the street, so girls bring your credit cards to work off the hollandaise sauce like I did!
author: Christa Y.

description: Walked up from our hotel to have breakfast on a Saturday morning. Business was steady but not swamped - we had assumed there would be a wait since we slept in. The Belgian Waffle was very, very good! Clean restaurant and friendly service. The prices were on the better side of what you'd expect in the area.
author: Robin B.

description: my burger was dry and overcooked and NOT medium. the fries were good tho. why was i even in the marina in the first place? not going back.
author: Wendy X.

description: The food was spectacular and the garden provided one of the best atmospheres I've ever dined in. The coffee was pretty good as well. The portions were very generous.The one complaint I would lodge is that our coffee cups weren't clean.
author: James G.

description:
Sure.. you could enjoys drinks at Circa, Monaghans, and Tipsy Pig...

But you could also enjoy a drinks at the outdoor seating at this joint while watching the debauchery that crosses  Chestnut.  If people watching is not for you, they have a gorgeous back patio to enjoy.

We checked this place out during Union Street Festival.  Seeing that every bar was filled to capacity, all we wanted was a glass of wine and beer.  Their manager, Castaneda, was out front bringing the people in and he brought us in!

For $4 drafts and $6 glasses of wine! Hello! Perfection. They bring drinks to you, and why sit and wait in a crowded bar, if all you want to do is share a drink with the people you enjoy. 

They have an extensive menu, with all day breakfast and a new Asian-fusion selections.

A great place to spend a Saturday with friends, and I will definitely be back to try the food.
author: Natalie G.

description: First time in San Fran so we decided to walk around to find a bite to eat. Loved the name of this place, so we checked out the menu and had a very hard time deciding on what to eat. Everything sounded so delicious. I tried the yellow curry, it was delicious. Fresh squeezed orange juice is just that, fresh squeezed. Also delicious. I would love to come back and try some crepes next time.
author: Heather H.

description:
What a joke!
I ordered:
Charbroiled Angus Chuck Burger 1/2lb $9.95, medium.
But it was SO WELL DONE LIKE A CARDBOARD.
So Dry, No Flavor at all. 
What the hell is goin'on in the kitchen? Fxxxin' Soprano like BBQ Party?
It's a Angus Chuck for crying out loud!
Charbroiled? You gotto be kidding. I was expecting Drippin' Juicy Angus burger for Christ sake. 

I could go to Super Duper to have a juicy burger there. Super Duper is only a block away, Goddamnit!
Super Duper is better and cheaper, Goddamnit!

Asian Chicken Salad was so crappy piece of shit. $9.95 for the shitty salad.
It says on the menu: Fresh grilled chicken breast, was so dry and:
shredded romaine hearts, bean sprouts, cucumber, red onion, watermelon radish, red peppers, Asian noodles, peanuts, cilantro, basil, mint, sweet sesame soy dressing, sounds good but it was nothing but bunch of not really fresh salad.

We were here for weekend. Weekend daytime is pretty busy on Chestnut St.
But the place was wide open. 
We came in here because other restaurants were very full.
Now I know why.
Lesson learned.
Hard way.
I'll do squat and gobble some where else.
author: Nobu K.

description: OJ was excellent, waffles tasted good but were a little cold.  My friend got the strawberry nutella crepe, but said the strawberries were soggy and not fresh.   Enjoyed the big open windows and general ambience of the place though.   Line wasnt too long when we got there but got longer as we were there.   Our meals were a little slow to come out though.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
The girlfriend is a seasoned S&G-er, but this was my first time.  We went here for a late breakfast/brunch after spending the night in the city.

Make sure to get a seat in the outdoor patio section!  A very nice place to sit and enjoy the weather while eating some good food.

I ordered the breakfast sandwich, which was ENORMOUS.  She ordered the Huevos Rancheros and was not disappointed.  Neither of us could finish our meals because of the proportions, and the pricing was good, especially for a well known downtown spot.

Would definitely recommend and will be back.  Great place to recover from the night before.
author: Joe D.

description:
Excellent place to grab breakfast or brunch. The wait staff was very friendly and cheerful and gave me good suggestions about the food. The seating area in the back was picturesque, complete with a pleasant looking fountain.

The food was very well executed. I ordered the breakfast burrito, and it was quite a ample portion size for one person. The flavors inside were balanced seamlessly between bean, chorizo, and salsa verse. I liked the presentation as well, which included neat strips of tortilla on top and salsa verde and beans smothered along the  side. Although my side order of sausage was unusually paltry (two miniscule links), I overlooked this given the quality of my main dish. Their fresh squeezed orange juice was also an excellent addition to my meal.

I would recommend this spot for a hearty, satisfying breakfast.
author: Zachary K.

description:
Great brunch place with a huge variety of crepes, eggs, sandwiches, and salads. There is a limited wine and beer bar as well as standard drinks and italian soda.

I had the mexican salad which was a HUGE portion for one- very tasty, well seasoned, and not over dressed. It was super flavorful- the food tasted fresh and came out quickly.

I really enjoyed this place for a quick, casual brunch.
author: Vinitha R.

description:
Nice food and good friendly service :)
Loved rosemary potatoes ....
author: Kharazm S.

description:
Go-to place for savory crepes !! 

There has been a recent change in the menu with my all too fav 'Mediterranean Crepe' been yanked out (bummer !!). However, there is a silver lining here, as is it got replaced with something more spectacular, the 'Vegetarian Fajita' crepe. Topped with homemade Ranchero & Tomatillo Sauce & Crispy Tortilla Strips this one is an absolute delight.

Make sure to order the side of garlic rosemary potatoes.
author: Kartik K.

description:
Granola with yogurt, fresh strawberries and bananas -- AMAZING.

Granola was crunchy, and not too sweet. Yogurt was a perfect consistency -- not too thick, not too runny. Fresh strawberries and bananas were indeed FRESH and very plentiful. 

Fresh squeezed OJ -- AMAZING.

Plenty of pulp, no seeds. $4 price tag was a bit extreme.

In general, there's a price to pay to squat and gooble here...as expected. It's the Marina.

Oh, and FREE wi-fi. I'd come back!
author: Mansi A.

description:
good menu options, lots of seating, but the food is just marginal. the portions are huge. i just wish there was more flavor.  there aren't a lot of nearby options open early on the weekends so this becomes an option. it is always packed though. 

feels like slightly upscale diner food, minus the grease.

All of the staff and wait service are very friendly and helpful though.  good place to go with kids as it is loud and chaotic. 

great back patio.
author: K C.

description: This place is delicious. It was my first time in San Francisco and I HAD to come back again before I left. So many options and it was all delicious! The people are so kind!
author: Melissa A.

description:
S&G is a pay for your food at the register and get a number get your own table type deal.  Surprisingly, my friends and I found this place quite charming.  There are large blackboards on the left side of the restaurant that holds the menu..  The tables are festive with those Thanksgiving like centerpieces.  There were only 2 larger tables for bigger groups (8) like mine and the rest were 4 or smaller.

As for the food, Everything was fine by my book.  I ordered eggs benedict, but with sausage.  I thought it would be porky and delicious, but it was healthy (the opposite of what I wanted).  That was my fault. i should have asked what kind of sausage they would use.  It came with roasted potatoes with fragrant rosemary.  Good meal overall.  

The rest of my group had crepes.  We could agree to call them really thin pancakes.  They all enjoyed their "pancakes," whether it was the savory or sweet.  I was lucky to try a sweet one with chocolate, whip cream, and strawberries.  Delicious.  I found S&G through yelp.  I was far from disappointed, but I would give them a 3 stars. Breakfast was good, but not top notch.  

On a side note, my friends and I had a wager that if the waiter didn't come back within 30 seconds to refill my water, I would give S&G a 3.  Surprisingly , the guy filled my cup in 10 seconds, so automatic 4 stars.
author: Jonathan Z.

description: If it was possible, I would Squat & Gobble give 0 stars. I have never had such a bad experience at a restaurant. Long story short, I sat down 20 minutes before a party of 2 and party of 8. Those two parties were ones that sat next to us and who I noticed most. They received their food before us. I waited roughly about 40 minutes and there was no sign of my food coming out. We were only a party of 2, there was no way our food took that long to make. I asked for a refund and they said they couldn't find my order. Every time I asked about my food, they said it was coming. Not once did I get an apology about having to wait 40 minutes for my food. Food that I did not get, I may add. This was my first time at Squat & Gobble and it will definitely be my last. I have NEVER had such a bad experience dining out.
author: Vicky H.

description:
Squat and Gobble is kind of like an upscale Sizzler--as oxymoronic as that sounds--in that you order and pay at the front cashier, seat yourself, and where upon they then bring the food out to you. 

I've only ordered the breakfast and they were tasty enough. Their eggs benedict varieties are nice, and the patio out back is pretty on a warmer day. Service is spotty, the wait to order and find a table can be atrocious on weekends, but all in all, it ain't bad.
author: Jenny K.

description: Smoke salmon scramble and the eggs benedict are really good! Be sure to sit in the back patio on a nice day.
author: Peter K.

description: Solid place for breakfast or lunch, a little pricey, but consistent food each time. I think the breakfast dishes are the best deal, although I had a hamburger that was pretty good, salads are humongous, and a great patio in the back is a chill spot to hang. Large space fits lots of people, order at the counter and then they serve. Attentive staff always check in for additional needs.
author: Matt A.

description:
There is a San Francisco restaurant chain called "Squat and Gobble". I try to figure out how the owners thought that would be a good name for a place to eat. 

The website advertises the Squat and Gobble as a "café and crepery". When I read it at first I read it as "creepery" and taht seems just about right. But no. It's a place that sells crepes. I know this for sure because the "About Us" button on the website has a little narrative history under a lead that begins "A Bit About the Squat..." 

I have a mental picture of a blocky person of indeterminate sex with prodigious thighs and black kneepads squatting under the groaning weight of a barbell with massive black plates on either end. 

Just where I want to have my morning creep, I mean crepe.
author: Jay D.

description: My daughter and I had lunch there a couple of days ago.  The service was quick and the food delicious.  I had the Greek Salad, a banana, strawberry and nutella crepe and a capuccino. Everything was delicious.  It was also fresh and looked great.  I've gone out of my way to eat breakfast and lunch at Squat & Gobble.  I also  love the patio setting in the back of this restaurant.
author: Deisy B.

description: It was one of those days when I was hungry but nothing sounded particularly appetizing (I hate those days). After wandering around for a while the hubbs and I decided to give this place a try. The person at the register suggested a few crepes, one being the Greek and I decided that sounded fine, I wasn't in the mood to make many decisions.  I was pleased with the meal. The crepe was delicious, full of oozing cheese and veggies. The side potatoes were seasoned well. The dish stayed warm through the entire meal and there were left overs for a nice snack later. Service was friendly and our glasses were always kept full. Enjoyable!
author: Nicole Z.

description:
We went late on Halloween night and almost had the place to ourselves.  Service was fast and friendly.  We had the veggie fajita crepe and the prawns and giant shanghae noodles.  Portions are VERY large.  Taste, spice, etc. was just right.  We devoured the crepe and had leftovers of the noodles to take home.  

I think w/ a beer and glass of wine it came to about $30.00.  We were both satisfied  and would try other items another time.
author: Teri X.

description: Been here several times now, and their food is consistently good.  One scramble is enough to feed 2 people, with enough stomach room left to share a crepe (which is huge, by the way).  Over the holiday weekend, even though there was a long line, it was manageable--I definitely suggest having someone in your party grab a table first to make sure you have somewhere to sit down (if there are no tables open for your party, they pretty much won't take your order right then and there).  Fortunately for us, tables for 2 were plentiful (and they have more seating in the back of the place, too).
author: Jess H.

description:
Such an adorable cheery place to eat breakfast/brunch!!

I was so overwhelmed by the menu because there's such variety. I probably stood staring at the menu for a good 15 minutes, trying to decide what I wanted. Dessert crepe? A sandwich? Blueberry pancakes??

I ended up getting a Belgian waffle with fresh blueberries and strawberries! YUM! :) It included a side of butter and syrup! My friends got a savory crepe and a crab cake(?) sandwich. The portions are really generous, so they couldn't finish theirs. 

Sure, I only got one thing, but it was very enjoyable and the atmosphere was nice, hence the 4 stars. I'll definitely be back because I have to try everything else on the menu!
author: Kei H.

description: YUM! Love this place! I'm from the San Diego area, and Iv'e only been to San Fran area twice, discovered this place the first time I was in San Fran. It was just a few blocks from our hotel so we walked by and the next day my sister and I went for breakfast while the rest of the fam was at the hotel. So yummy! Sit out back! It's gorgeous and so relaxing! We can't go to San Fran without coming here now! Love it!
author: Sasia M.

description:
Open relatively late.  Extremely friendly service.  Amazing cucumber water (seriously).    The menu has a lot of variety: pasta, crepes, sandwiches, salads, asian cuisine, and desserts.  I'm a huge fand of the salmon cobb salad.  It comes with all the cobb fixins and a huge piece or perfectly cooked salmon.   The chinese chicken salad is also pretty good.  And if you're extra hungry, the vegan chili is delicious.

Don't forget about the beautiful outdoor patio in the back!
author: Derek L.

description: Despite calling itself a Crepery, SQUAT & GOBBLE have a large menu of eclectic choices like Breakfast Burritos, Pastas, Burgers and Wok Dishes. I opted for the KUNG PAO CHICKEN this time (I've had a Crepe, and the Burrito before - both good) and was pleasantly surprised at the level of spice in it. Big chunks of chicken, lots of peppers and green onions as well as a deep flavorful sauce, I really enjoyed it. Their homemade lemonade is great too. Squat & Gobble is turning into a solid lunch option for me!
author: G C.

description:
I've eaten here twice and both times were great.
First was for breakfast and had the blueberry pancakes.  They were awesome.  It was just the right amount of food for breakfast.  The whipped cream (homemade?) was great.
Second time was for dinner.  I had the cheesesteak.  It was fine (I'm from Philly so nothing really compares).  But for dessert, a friend and I actually shared the Belgian waffle.  Like the pancakes, the waffle was great.
The outside seating area in the back was hidden and didn't know it was there on the first visit.  It's a nice covered area.
author: Dan K.

description: Squat and Gobble is your place for a tasty, not terribly expensive breakfast. The omelettes they've created look amazing, but if your tastes are more simple, you can also order off menu. Keeping in mind, the portions are massive and (the omelettes anyway) come with potatoes and toast...its a huge amount of food. They do have gluten free crepes (which I'll try next time), in both sweet and savory. It's very busy in the mornings and very loud....but outside seating is available.
author: Monet R.

description: We loved Squat and Gobble! My husband had an amazing Greek salad and Turkey burger and I had the strawberry crepe! Everything was delicious and served quickly. Clean little restaurant with very nice staff!
author: Margot S.

description: Fun back patio, large menu with plenty to chose from. Their dishes / servings are large and easily personalized. Their Orange juice is amazing (random notes), and I've heard their Crepes are delicious, service can be a bit slow so go with a leisurely mindset. Great neighborhood spot
author: Michelle Q.

description: Amazing! Strawberry crepes and my favorite is the seafood linguine. It's so good I have'nt convinced myself to try anything else on the menu yet
author: Nina U.

description: This place is great because it's fresh, quick, has lots of space and has a menu offering lots of things for lots of different folks.  You can get breakfast any time of the day, which is awesome. If you are looking for a good, fresh meal down in the Marina and your group can't decide, this place is a good, comfy destination.
author: randal w.

description: Great place for breakfast, lunch or dinner! I have had so many items on this menu and never been disappointed. Living down the street has been picking up dinner on the way home super easy!
author: Kari D.

description: Love this place. I grew up going to the S&G on West Portal and the Chestnut branch is just as tasty, plus the back patio is lovely. The South of the Border is my favorite. I would also recommend the Turkey Burger, the Mexican Grilled Chicken Salad, and the standard Eye Opener breakfast with bacon.  Yum!
author: Noelle F.

description: Awful French onion soup. Tasted like sweet vinegar. Cheese was burnt. Had the cheesesteak, the bread was old, definitely not fresh. Skip the lemonade unless you likeconcentrated lemonjuice for cooking and sugar water, definitely not fresh squeezed. Had to get up and go to cunter to ask for refills. Just awful. Super bummer.
author: K K.

description: Ordered the prawns noodles in broth and it had an insect on it. At least they gave me my money back and apologized for it.
author: G G.

description:
I came here today after 10 mile run that was an out and back Crissy Fields--so I was hungry. And normally after a long run, Im not picky.  It was a long run, but we did get here at a prime time, 12PM on a Saturday. I have heard a lot about this place and was really excited. 

I ordered the Crabcake Egg Florentine and a fresh squeezed orange juice. I got to say, the orange juice was the highlight of my meal. The food took a long time to get (almost 25 minutes). I know it was a busy Saturday but I'm glad I was with good company. My poached egg was pretty much a hard boiled egg with part of the shell. The crabcake was decent but nothing to drool over. The potatoes were half cold like half of it was sitting under a heating lamp and the other half not. My friend who ordered the Belgium Waffle said it was hard. My friend never got his Caesar salad for his meal--at least they made up for it by giving him a cupcake and brownie. WHen the waiter came to our table to ask if we wanted any water and it only took him 3x to our table for him to bring it and that is with us having to remind him each time. 

On a good note, my other friend said his Ceaser salad and black bean chili was pretty good. Maybe Ill give it another try another day and hope for a better experience--but it definitely wont ever be one of my first choices. There are so many other great places in Chestnut.
author: alfred c.

description: Decent food, inept service. I called before driving across town to verify they had a dish I was craving. My passenger commented, "he sounded stoned... I give it 30% chance they actually serve that."  Upon getting there, I watched the line grow as 2 men mismanaged their time. When I finally ordered, they didn't serve the dish & proceeded to charge me $5 extra for the only part of the dish they did serve- sauerkraut- which was grossly cooked instead of the norma fermented cabbage deliciousness. No thanks.
author: Sara P.

description: This is a true FIVE star breakfast joint! Everything tastes amazing, it's affordable and the portions are so large that I can never finish the food! We highly recommend trying this place out, it will keep you coming back!
author: Gary K.

description: Perfect location in the marina, great outdoor patio, and gluten free options for crepes and pasta= best brunch spot! There tends to be a long line, but they do a great job of making it move quickly and getting you a seat quick.
author: M M.

description:
The menu offers literally everything. Salads, crepes, bagels, sandwiches, pasta, you name it. It was pretty difficult for me to pick out what I wanted to order, but I finally decided on the salmon salad. 

The food was probably 3/5 stars... nothing special really, but definitely satisfying. What made this place stand out was the service. You order at the counter, but servers are walking around making sure your waters are always full, and that you have everything you need. Nice touch!

There's plenty of seating, but this place can get pretty packed during peak hours. They have some outdoor seating as well which is nice, but good luck getting a seat outside on a nice day.

I'll come back and try some other stuff on their menu for sure.
author: Ashley D.

description: I ordered the triple gobble (two eggs, two buttermilk pancakes and chicken apple sausage) and my boyfriend ordered the eggs benedict. We both got mimosas as well. My food wasn't anything special but it was still delicious. My boyfriend loved his eggs benedict. The mimosas were also good. There was more champagne than OJ, which is always a win in my book. However, what makes this place great is that the service is really quick (we sat down for less than 5 minutes and our food came out) and they have an amazing back patio. If you get the chance, always try to sit in the back patio. It's a great atmosphere! The waiters here are also very accommodating and nice.
author: Hana K.

description: This place needs to Quality Control because it's inconsistent and not in a good way. So we ordered 1x omelette, 1x eggs florentine, 1x order of eggs sunny sided w/ 1x order of French toast and apple sausage. How on earth does that take 30 minutes ??? The food when arrived was for some reason not as hot of the stove but almost warm - so when me and my family wondered, could it be they cooked the food but let it sit there for awhile??? A restaurant should always cook food table by table unless there are certain dishes that are extremely hard to cook. It was a problem of system this time around and that then is a quality control management issue. So the florentine eggs,  and omelette came first , then we waited for the sausage and french toast for a bit. There wasn't much follow up. I hope they improve as they're on a landmark location and the community eats here.
author: Alex C.

description: My boyfriend and I came here because we are obsessed with crepes. We have tried many different creperies and this one is in my top 3 now. We got there around 9:30 (they close at 10) but the workers didn't seem to mind serving us since we got our order to-go. I ordered the BBQ chicken crepe and it was delicious. My boyfriend got the pesto crepe and he loved it. We also got lemonades and I kid you not their lemonade was the best I have ever had. I'm pretty sure I remember it saying it was homemade on the menu. However the best part of our meal was by far the FRUITY NUTELLA crepe. So so good. It had blueberries, strawberries, nutella and cinnamon. Maybe a few other things but I can't quite remember. The food is reasonably priced. The workers were very accommodating with making sure we had everything we needed for our to-go order. We were pleasantly surprised with how much we enjoyed our meal. Will definitely return here the next time I'm in the Bay Area.
author: Shannon Z.

description:
Upon entering it seems like a normal brunch spot however... THE BACK PATIO is sooo cute and I love it.

Me and my boyfriend sat out side, it's cute with greenery everywhere. The food was great as well. I got Eggs Benedict Florentine and he got the Crab Cake Benedict. Both tasty. This has/will become a Sunday brunch staple.
author: Jess O.

description: Had 30 minutes on the meter and not a lot of options as every restaurant in the neighborhood was packed, so this was my coin flip.  Had the cheesesteak sandwich with fries. Greasy and flavorless while the fries were terribly over salted. Ambience is cafeteria like without the buffet. Just average. So odd in a city filled with great restaurants both humble and haute. Didn't try the crepes which are what this place is more known for so perhaps it's not all bad. But with Ristobar , A16 and Cafe Aix within walking distance I probably would't give it another try unless I was having a very unlikely crepe craving.
author: InTheBurg B.

description:
Squat & Gobble has the worst food I am aware of in San Francisco.  

This is an unusual review for me because I am not in my typical 1 or 2 star form - namely, furious at the establishment for mistreating me in some way.  I'm not even remotely mad at Squat & Gobble.  I'm just amazed that they stay in business.

I've been here twice and both times I've been confounded by the quality of the food, being that they're on a busy, popular street and people seem to come in here and eat all the time.  The kind of thing I mean is: egg shell in the flavorless eggs; all kinds of fat and grossness in the chicken pieces; either too much or too little salt in their dishes.  Just stuff that would make you be like "What the heck?  Don't you realize PEOPLE eat here?"

I only give 2 stars because the restaurant is clean and the service is pretty good.  Skip this one.
author: Evan B.

description:
I like this place  Nice and comfortable, relaxed feel.  I usually get seated in the back patio.  At squat its about the outdoor patio in the Marina.  Quaint, with a canopy of lights.  Nice.

They have salads, sanwiches, pasta,  crepes, and breakfast.  A nice menu on a large blackboard..  The food is all good.  You stand in line and order first at the counter.  Then, I get seated quickly in back. 

They have specials, but I stick with the usuals.  We order the burger half pound, prime rib sandwich with onions, and the club.  Oooh yeah.   The burger is standard good,  They call it an Angus burger.  I can't really tell from Angus and ground chuck.  But it is tasty.  Fries around the table.   The club is standard, but nice and crispy bacon, cripy bread, and crispy fries.  The rib sandwich with swiss I see is good and makes me want to get it next time.  My friend says its good.  They have switched their home made ranch dressing recently but its still good.   

This is my goto place in the Marina, freindly place, and prices are fair.   Parking is a little tricky around here.  I park it in the multilevel lot around the corner.

*****decor
****food
service*****
parking**
author: Richard G.

description:
Sooooooooooooooo average and SLOW. The last time we went we were in a bit of a rush (we had like 35 minutes to eat before watching a  Giants game). It wasn't terribly busy - the dining room was probably about 60% full- but it took forever for our foods and drinks to come out. We were sitting near the server station and it was pretty clear that the runners were very disorganized and overwhelmed. Drink orders were stacking up and when they hurriedly brought over water and utensils to our table, my water cup was half full and wet on the outside. It took almost the entire 35 minutes for the order to get to the table, and even then, it was warm, not hot. 

The food was average. I had a tomatillo crepe which was decent, but my potatoes were very unevenly cooked. That's usually the one thing you can count on at breakfast! :/ Some of the potatoes were burnt while others were almost raw and totally gross. Ultimately, I wouldn't die if I had to go back, but with so many other great options in that area (Judy's, The Repubic, etc) why waste your time with something mediocre?
author: Jess B.

description: This place serves good crepes. We tried the Marina crepe and it was great. A good place to visit for people watching in Chesnut Street. They also make good coffee. This place never gets crowded and you will easily find a place to sit.
author: Raman S.

description:
It was a little tough to steak out a seat at this restaurant but I'm glad we did because there was a large variety of filling breakfast foods.
Although I wish the toast didn't come pre-buttered, I enjoyed the potatoes, crepe, and eggs that I tried.  The crepe dough wasn't very interesting but the fillings were tasty and made up for the flavor.  The omelet was pretty standard and the portions were very large.  I would definitely come here again.
author: Angie I.

description:
The food was amazing... one of the most delicious crêpes I have ever tasted!!  I love the menu, the atmosphere, the friendly service, the multiple patio areas for outdoor seating.  Everything about this place is wonderful!

Does anyone know the origin behind the name "Squat & Gobble"?  My friend and I were talking about it and suddenly realized that we each had a completely different interpretation of the name... which was rather hilarious when we each tried to explain our totally different interpretation of the name to each other...

She thinks it has to do with a person squatting down to gobble down some food real quick.  While I had a completely different idea of what it meant based on the picture on the sign.  There is a picture of a turkey on the restaurant's sign, so it made sense to me that the name was referring to a turkey squatting (possibly to lay an egg) and making a "gobble, gobble" sound while doing so.  Maybe we're both right, maybe neither of us is right... but if anyone knows the true origin of the name, please let me know.  I'm very curious now.  :)
author: C R.

description: Mehhhhh. Nothing to write home about. It's a quick place to "squat and gobble" if you aren't looking to have an awesome breakfast but rather, a quick bite. I ordered the huevos rancheros... Prob won't go again.
author: Nasrin M.

description:
Squat & Gobble.......... YumYumYum.
First off, I'd give them 5 stars on the name alone, but then I went there and it was much nicer, cleaner and cheerier than I expected.
Great place for breakfast, especially if your hotel is in walking distance!
My omelet was very good. I had mixed feelings on the rosemary potatoes, but the more I ate them the more I liked them and since they were all gone... I guess that means I really liked them!
Their pancakes were delicious too!

Nice to sit out front or near the front windows and match all the people going by.
Also a nice patio in the back.
author: Tim W.

description:
Don't let the name fool you! I thought this was some hodunky hill billy place. However, this was my second time here. First I had breakfast, this time lunch. Both experiences were pleasant. They have an outdoor patio in front as well as additional outdoor garden seating in the back, past the kitchen. 

You do need to go to the counter and order prior to finding a seat. You'll receive a number and your drinks and water will be brought to you. 

The menu is very cute and colorful. The staff is pleasant and friendly, and the neighborhood is mellow and fun to walk around. There is limited street parking with meters. 

My friend and I both ordered the cheese raviolis with the prawns. These prawns were huge! Seriously the size of my palm. The meal was delicious and as usual, I needed a to-go box! Very eco friendly recyclable boxes... oh San Fran how I love you! Heated up nicely for lunch today! Came with a little side of garlic bread which was great for dipping in the extra sauce from my meal.
author: Jesse J.

description:
Despite the chaos of people and mediocre service, the food was actually quite descent.

Before heading to Crissy Fields to go for a walk, we decided to grab a bite to eat.

Spotted this place and thought it looked good, being I hadn't had a crepe forever, I was looking forward to see how they were.

It was busy which is always a good sign. The interior decor was very bright and cheerful, little messy due to the amount of people but not too bad. They had an extensive list of yummy looking dishes from savory Italian crepes, sweet crepes, salads, sandwhiches as well as brownies and cookies up at the front by the register.

I ordered the Italian Crepe with Italian sausage, onions, black olives mushrooms, eggs mozzarella with pesto sauce and fruit on the side. My B.F. ordered there Mexican grilled chicken salad.

Service was not spectacular. They give you a little number to put on our table when you order. It took a while to get our dish, my b.f. food came first which looked fantastic, presentation was great. My food finally arrived  which seemed to be about 10 minute s later. Though despite the aggravating wait and mediocre service, my crepe was fantastic!!!Crepe was cooked perfect- light, soft and fluffy, sausage, mozzerella cheese, olives,and  spin age all came together wonderfully (could have used a little more flavor) though it was overall very satisfying and filling. The Fruit which was a mix of Honeydew, Cantalope, Green Apples and big plump juicy grapes Fruit absolutely popped with flavor and complemented my meaty tasty crepe perfectly.

Service not so good, Food tasteful and satisfying. And the prices are not too bad.
author: Shannon H.

description: Very poor service today. Came in with a party of 6 and waited for my meal more than 15 minutes after the rest of the table had gotten their food. I had to ask two staff members to check on my food but they never came back to my table to let me know what happened. I had to go back to the cashier and ask about my food and waited another 10 minutes for them to bring my food. Order was wrong and was not given an apology. Thanks a lot.
author: D F.

description:
This place is great ! I went with my family on New Years Day. The place was packed but the line to order though was long was quick.  WE waited around 15 minutes for our food. The place was loud and busy but our food came warn and tasty. We ordered the Mee Gorang - carbs overload noodle tofu dish,  Belgium Waffles - name speaks for itself and seafood italian dish that came with sea shell - that was a little too tangy but still good.
SO~! If you have screaming kids that do not need to run around, loud friends or feel like speaking loudly that day, this is a place for you.
Am i going back to this place? YES! i love the carb overload, my child loves the loud environment and a short walk to Palace a fine arts.  Not a nice date place.
author: Amy E.

description: The only thing I don't like about this place is the name. The coffee is really good and the staff is super friendly. I recommend the breakfast burrito.
author: Travis M.

description:
I got some kind of a salad - Taco or Fajita salad...something like that. 

It was AWESOME. Super Fresh. Get that. 

They also have beer / wine and will give you change for the meter if needed.  Super nice staff. Bonus!
author: Monica T.

description:
I always thought this place was pretty similar to Crepes A-Go-Go and pretty much only served crepes. A few months ago I stopped in after the gym because a crepe with nutella sounded good and I discovered they actually have a pretty extensive menu with several salads, pastas, sandwiches, and of course several varieties of crepes. 

I got my nutella crepe to go (which was okay, but I don't think crepes to go is a good option...they should be eaten fresh), but I was curious to come back. 

Well, I came back this this past weekend with friends and really liked it! I will say though, I didn't really try anything all that new this time. I had a strawberry nutella crepe, which was yummy! The strawberries tasted fresh, and the crepe was hot. There crepes are a little thick, which I actually like (I'm no crepe expert, but apparently if you are, I guess thinner is better?). The reason I got a dessert style crepe is I'm generally not a fan of savory crepes (don't know why but I never have). However, one of my friends had whatever the Mexican style crepe was, and I had a few bites. It was really good, and something I'd get when I come back! 

I also like that this place has some really interesting drink options. I went with a standard mimosa this last time that was really good, but I also noticed that had a pomegranate mimosa as well as a mango martini (or maybe that was a mimosa as well...I forget)! 

As far as service goes this is one of those places where you order at the counter, they give you a number, and then bring you your food. We didn't have to wait long for our food and drinks and the place was pretty crowded. Both times I've been here all the employees have been super nice (the first time I came here for the to-go order, one of the workers practically insisted I sit down and brought me water while I waited!). I'll be back for sure :)
author: George A.

description:
Maybe it's just me, but I remember Squat & Gobble being so much more, um, gritty? I used to work across the street from the S&G on Haight and would get breakfast there frequently. I most certainly don't remember it being anything as nice-looking as the one on Chestnut is.

Of course, this was 12 years ago when I lived in SF, and this is the Marina location and not the Haight one. So yeah, maybe it's just perception, but I sure feel like S&G has fancied up a bit over the years -- and their prices have gone up accordingly.

All that aside, it's a great place for breakfast/brunch. A menagerie of savory & sweet crepes, and all the usual breakfast staples. I appreciate that after all these years, my basic crepe, easy onions, with bacon & a side of rosemary potatoes is just as tasty as the first time I had it.

As noted, it is a tad on the spendier side -- around $10 or so a person -- but hardly out of character for the Marina. And as you'd expect in the Marina, lots of folks in their running gear (who don't look like they've been running), lots of folks and their kids, and not so many of the hipsters you'd expect at the Haight or Castro locations. Service is always on point, and as others have noted, it's usually a pleasant experience here. You most certainly could do worse for brunch, considering IHOP and Mel's are just a couple of blocks in the other direction.
author: Cee A.

description: Loved the eggs Benedict, prob one of the best I've had in a while. I don't like potatoes but those were also good, cleaned out my whole plate. I also split my Belgium waffles with a friend, the mint whip cream (they give you a big scoop, maybe too much I barely used half) was a nice touch, waffles were awesome.
author: Linda L.

description:
What a disappointing crepe. Who the hell puts cinnamon on a nutella/strawberry/banana crepe?! Right? Who's with me?!
::cricket::
Their orange juice was good...?
author: Samantha F.

description:
You can always count on S&G for a good solid, consistently prepred meal.

This particular afternoon, we were running errands in the area and needed to grab a quick healthy meal to-go before the 300 mile road trip ahead of us.

I called in our order and expected that it would be ready in the next 15-20 minutes, when I planned on getting there.  I ran 1 mote errand and dropped in expecting my order to be ready, only to find my self waiting another 15 minutes.  They must've put in my order when I arrived.  Fail!

But needless to say the mexican grilled chicken salads I grabbed were great as ever and was complemented with a side of fresh squeezed orange juice!
author: Rochelle D.

description: Squat & Gobble is consistent, timely and a go-to diner. It's like the sweater in your closet that you consider donating but then keep going back to it season after season. The service is quick and the hosts and bus boys are friendly. The food is a solid B which is why I am giving it 3 stars. I've never been totally blown away but it does satisfy. The OJ is amazing and probably the best thing on the menu- it's fresh squeezed for real. I keep going back here because there are no other classic breakfast spots in the marina that are easy like this with no wait (and bc the OJ is good as mentioned).
author: Ashley S.

description: Every single time we have come here they have screwed up our order. The food is decent but there are too many places in SF that have great service + great food so next time I'd prefer to go elsewhere.
author: Duncan H.

description: Sunday morning. It was busy. Waiters were worked and couldn't refill coffees.  No butter on toast. Omelets were good although mine was like warm. All in all - not my choice for breakfast.
author: Laura S.

description: Great food. Great menu. My husband is such a picky eater. It is always hard for him to find something that he likes at most restaurants. At Squat & Gobble his choices are endless :-) The crepes and fresh orange juice are amazing!
author: Nikki M.

description:
Yumyumyum! 

I love the Chestnut area cause there's so much to see and so much to eat.
I stumbled upon Squat and Gobble and decided to try it out since I had my Siberian husky with me and there was outdoor seating.

Oddly enough, I'm not a big fan of lots of ingredients they used, but I ended up staying and ordering the Mama Mia crepe anyway. It was sorta heavy from all the cheeses, so I left some of the cheese on the side. This is a pretty filling meal, but I was feeling eager to try the dessert crepes so I ordered the Fruity Nutella. SOOO good, but such a mistake to eat it all in one sitting.

I'll definitely be back to try their other dessert crepes! (:
author: Adorable T.

description:
I've had both breakfast and lunch a couple of times. It's good, nothing spectacular or particularly memorable. However... their potatoes taste exactly like mine. (the key is rosemary)

I'm not blown away, but I also don't have any problem with it, plus they have free WiFi that doesn't require a password. Score. 4 stars.
author: Kristin F.

description: Overall this place does good crepes, I haven't tried any of the other dishes available. It is a bit over the $10 mark for crepes and choices of sides, I try to spend less for lunch as I tend to just come here while on my lunch hour if I'm in the neighborhood. I have tried better and bigger portioned crepes in the City but wouldn't turn this one down, but wouldn't be my first choice in crepes either.
author: Jaime P.

description:
Crazy large menu!  They have sweet and savory crepes, pasta, sanwiches, omelettes, soups, salads and coffee.  So many choices...

These are the things I have enjoyed with squat and gobble cafe chains:
-Italian Crepe:Italian sausage, onions, black olives, mushrooms, spinach scrambled eggs and Mozzarella topped and pesto sauce - Just takes like a low carb pizza :)  Love it!

-Chicken Pesto:Sliced chicken breast, mozzarella, onions, pesto and sun-dried tomatoes - Love this crepe!!! Can't go wrong with Chicken Pesto!

-All dessert crepe is wonderful especially the ones with Nutella!!

-Crab Salad:Fresh crab meat, balsamic glazed onions, shaved fennel, iceberg lettuce, avocado, crumbled blue cheese, Roma tomatoes and lemon grass dressing - generous with the crab meat. The salad is really fresh and super bland.  I like it when I need a light meal.

-Asian Chicken Salad :Fresh grilled chicken breast, shredded romaine hearts, bean sprouts, cucumber, red onion, watermelon radish, red peppers, Asian noodles, peanuts, cilantro, basil, mint, sweet sesame soy dressing - really nice chicken salad, The dressing is sweet. The salad you can easily share cause it's HUGE!

-Seafood Linguini :Sautéed Mediterranean mussels, tiger prawns, baby clams, shallots, parsley in white wine lemon butter sauce - Pasta was wonderful.  Very generous portion!

-Grilled Crab Melt:Fresh lump crab meat, celery, onions, garlic, carrots, grain mustard, smoked Gouda served on grilled sourdough - This was pretty bland.... Not a fan of this sandwich 

-Grilled Turkey Burger : Seasoned with herbs and spices, fresh sliced tomatoes, green leaf lettuce, caramelized red onions, cranberry aioli served on a Grilled Kaiser roll - I've had better turkey burger.  This was super bland and really dry.  Do not order.

This restaurant is a pretty big and has outdoor seating.  The service here is really SLOW... I remember ordering a crab salad which requires no cooking and there was no one in the restaurant and it still took 20 minutes to prepare.  Not a fan of the speed of service.
author: Ying F.

description:
OK, so our Summer Road Trip 2009 took us to the Squat & Gobble. OK, well, our friend Sharon took us there during our road trip, if you're gonna be all technical about it, but in any case, it was a great recommendation!

The place was packed on a Saturday morning, but the line moved quickly. Their menu is all along the upper wall and real easy to read while waiting in line. They have a great selection of food for breakfast and lunch and choosing one thing to eat was tough.

I ended up choosing a salmon crepe with potatoes, my wife got the mediterranean crepe, Sharon got a build your own with chicken, cheese and veggies, and we got our toddler a kids breakfast plate.

All the meals featured generous portions, even the kids meal. They were also very tasty. They have seating along the sidewalk outside the front of the place, inside seating and a great outside patio area in the back.

We sat in the patio and had a wonderful time eating, chatting and enjoying a beautiful San Francisco day. I wish there was a Squat & Gobble in San Diego!
author: Rick D.

description: Yum! Great food, delish mimosas. What else could you want in a brunch spot?
author: Taylor B.

description:
Besides afternoon tea, brunch is probably one of my favorite meals of the day. I especially love Sunday brunch, when the sun is shining, free parking is plentiful, and you can relax without a care in the world.

We were hanging out in the Marina and came across Squat and Gobble. With such a cute name, we decided to come here instead of the Grove across the street.

S&G is a cute brunch place with a variety of options: crepes, omelettes, eggs, sandwiches and the like.  Mike had the salmon savory crepe (the exact name escapes my mind) with country potatoes and I had two eggs over easy with fruit and toast.  We also ordered a latte and chai tea as well. The place is one where you order first, they give you a number, you find a seat, and they give you the food.

The service was surprisingly quick! The salmon crepe was delicious! We ate every single bite. My eggs and toast also hit the spot. The drinks were decent although not as strong as I normally like.

Overall, a very charming and quaint little cafe/eatery for brunch!
author: Betty C.

description:
I've been here quite a few times, and I must say, the Belgian waffles are freaking delicious!! The crepes here are alright-- they're not to die for, but they'll satisfy a crepe-craving.
The savory crepes, I would say, are better than the dessert crepes. I feel like the dessert crepes are super-intensely sweet and overbearing, but others may like that. 
I like the environment of the place, but I guess the only thing that I kind of wish they did was seat us to a table instead of having us find it ourselves. I can't explain why, but it threw me off the first time I ate here when we had to seat ourselves. Other than that, the place is very spacey and lots of 
sunlight, which I love. 
This is going to be a regular for me :)
author: Sheila X.

description:
Our whole dining experience was fantastic. The two gentlemen who assisted us were very courteous throughout the night and helpful when we asked for their opinion on a few dishes. They also kept the refills coming (probably why I'm still hopped up on Diet Coke and writing reviews before 8am) and paced the meal nicely, we never felt rushed.  

I had the Chicken Peppardelle, which featured chicken breast, sautéed broccoli, garlic and onion, served in an Alfredo. The peppardelle pasta tasted fresh and was cooked perfectly. I ordered the dish with half the portion of sauce, which was just the right amount for me. The Alfredo had a unique and savory flavor--it wasn't too creamy, so the garlic and pepper really came though.  A most pleasant surprise. 

For dessert, I opted for an old classic: a crepe filled with Nutella, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The crepe was a little on the thick side, but still managed to be light and fluffy. And the rest is history.
author: Sam G.

description:
Great brunch menu and the service was great.  The grilled chicken sandwich was one of best. The service was great parking  a challenge over great restaurant.
Will be back for more.
author: George E.

description: Delicious! Great menu! Friendly staff! Enjoyed the outdoor patio & people watching. Blueberry pancakes were yummy! (my husband thinks the syrup is fantastic!)
author: Kay G.

description: Definitely a spot for breakfast. i was dragged here by a friend who was dying to go.. Meh.. There are SO many better places in the area, I dont understand why someone would go here.
author: Andrea B.

description:
I've been a fan of this place for about 12 years (this location hasn't been open that long, but the one on Haight Street has)! However, this location is just as good (it's also larger).

It's a very chill place to go eat at any time. It's a very relaxed ambiance if you go at an off time.  

I LOVE the Hawaiian crepe, it's so good. I think the that while the dessert crepes are VERY satisfying, the savory crepes here are much better. 
The potatoes are great too. 
Honestly I have yet to have something that isn't good - but I tend to stick to the savory crepes.

The staff is friendly and it's just a nice spot to get food from.
author: Sooze E.

description: Triple gobble was great. Though I'm slowly sliding into a food coma . Others ate breakfast burrito, which is ginormous, French toast which my son loves and finally the bourbon omelet. All meals are highly recommended- just not all at once....
author: Jon B.

description:
Great food. 

Seven of us had breakfast here and not one of us had even the slightest complaint about anything. Kids were happy, parents were happy, grandparents were happy, life was good. They had pancakes, waffles, fruit bowl, and veggie omelet. I had Eggs Benedict which was delicious. To please everyone in my family is a feat in itself. 

The staff were friendly and helpful. Coffee cups were kept full.  I will return.
author: Jeromy W.

description:
Squat & Gobble has the most unique menu that is served all day. From savory or sweet Crepes,  omlettes,sandiwches, salads, pasta dishes and desserts. They also serve beer, wine, champagne and limited cocktails. I lke that no matter who you go with, someone is going to find something that they want to eat here. There is so much variety in favlors as well. From italian, to french to  asian inspired dishes!

I have only been here twice. The first time I had spaghetti with prawns. The portion was HUGE! Easily could be shared. The only thing I had an issue with was that this was VERY salty. Otherwise, it had good flavor and the shrimp was very tender.

The second time I came here I had the crab melt. The sandiwch was crispy on the outside and cheesy on the inside. There wasn't very much crab in the sandwich and the crab that was there was mixed with a lot of finely diced vegetables to add bulk and flavor. I got the sandiwch with a side of fries. They were crispy and delicious!

They also have a dinner menu as well as a kids menu!

The service is good but can be slow since they are always busy. i have never been here and there isn't a line that is already out the door. 

My favorite thing about this place is that they have a heated outside patio out back which is very large that can fit a large group.

Prices range from about $5-$13 a plate depedning on what you order



Good place to go after a night of going out!
author: Whitney S.

description:
5 stars for their great service. The waiters and waitresses are not assigned to specific tables but they are all extremely nice and helpful. I was there for brunch on the sunday after st patty's day, it was busy and the food was taking a while to come but all the servers were helpful and making sure that each customer get what we needed while waiting and even the manager stopped by several times to check in with tables that were still waiting for the food. I was impressed by the high quality service they provided. 
 
Food was good. I love the bake potatoes that comes with omelets. And the fresh squeeze OJ is harder and harder to find in the marina now.
author: Jenn M.

description:
OK. If I was rating this place 18 months ago it would have gotten barely 2 stars. I'm glad I didn't. Back then the service was slow, ordering was slow, they messed up my order 2 times in a row, and so on. Food only so so, although I did like the coffee.  So I voted with my feet and decided not to come back. 

Well I've been there three out of the last four Sunday mornings and the food has been tremendous.  The service is still slow,  IMHO due to the fact that they have a complicated menu on a large blackboard, and everyone stands in line and places their order one at a time at the register.  And, the software used by the POS terminal is painfully slow since it appears to be a serial process and requires the order taker to put some things in a particular order.  I don't see this changing to much, but they should find a way to make this better.

Next, pet peeve time:  I hate getting coffee with (a) a spoon in the cup, or (b) the spoon outside of the cup but with nowhere to set it except the tabletop.  At least put napkin holders on the tables.

But, the food was tremendous.  End of story.  Five stars.  I've got a low tolerance for all of the faux NY Times food critics that post detailed "I got this, my partner got that, etc. etc. etc."  Sorry foodies.  So just let me say I'm picky, and the food is really good and it was easy to get a place to sit early on Sunday AM.

Two metrics:  It's almost impossible to really get well done bacon two times in a row without having one helping be either burned or undercooked.  They did it perfectly three out of three times, which to me is like watching a perfect game in baseball.  Not impossible, but pretty rare.  Second, the coffee is still good.  :)

If you haven't been there in a while, try it again.  Oh, and try to ignore possibly the dumbest restaurant name ever.  I defy you to put any adjective or noun after the word squat and make it sound appetizing.  But I'm sticking with 5 stars.
author: August I.

description:
I'll get this out of the way: the food is a 3. Nothing special. 

The HUGE outdoor patio sold me on this place though. Price-wise it's neither a deal nor expensive, but for the marina I would say this place is on the cheap side. 

Since you pay before you sit, you save some cash on tip. How cheap do I sound right now? haha

Decent selection of crepes and omelets. I would definitely recommend for standard fare breakfast for big groups.
author: Carlos A.

description: Except for having a waiter spill a glass of iced tea all over me like a Gatorade shower, grabbing brunch here is actually quite enjoyable. The outdoor patio seating is great on a nice  day and the order at the counter system ensures quick service and faster turnover so waits are always short which is a big advantage. The food selection is great with choices of brunch staples, crepes, and random Asian inspired dishes. I went with the crabcake florentine with homefried potatoes. Very well done for $10 with great crispy crabcake and a nice hollandaise. Probably would have even tasted better if I didn't have the smell of iced tea lingering the whole time.
author: Ed L.

description: Breakfast+brunch+mimosas are very good & great presentations. Clean, colorful decor, and good customer service from the staff.
author: Judy T.

description: Get the bourbon street omelette or crab cake florentine! Also the OJ is so fresh it tastes unreal!
author: Hayley M.

description: Excellent. Really enjoyed the food. Had a delicious crepe for lunch a few days ago and back for breakfast today. Fresh squeezed oj, granola with yogurt and fruit for me and Castro omelette for hubby. The omelette was "the best he's ever tasted". It has olives, feta, etc. Delicious! Granola was good - crunchy with seeds/nuts. Back patio great. Staff super friendly and helpful. We'll be beck :)
author: Lydia K.

description:
Happy New Year Yelpers!

Been awhile since my last post, and congrats to all those who earned the 2011 Elite Badge!

*****
