Ok, so I think I went back here sometime between my first review and now, but since I don't really remember that I'm just reviewing my experience earlier today.

First of all, they have opened an AWESOME back patio!  It has stone floors, nice tables and chairs, a retractable awning roof, as well as another water station and bathroom.  Seriously a fabulous improvement, as I am always looking for outdoor places when the weather is nice (like it was today at lunch).

I had a special salad, which was a Seared Tuna Nicoise Salad for $10.  Mine was delicious, but the fish on my Dad's salad was a bit overcooked and dried out.  Arnold Palmers to drink were delish, and the water/busboy in the back was terrific about the refills.

Now that I know about the back patio, I think I'll be coming here a lot more often!
author: Lindsay B.

description:
imagine if you had to squat down on the ground and gobble a sloppy crepe that has been overfilled with too many ingredients compromising the delicacy and texture of the delicious French treat....add a $10 tag to it and this is what your dining experience here will be like!!

now this place isnt ALL bad, they have somehow figured out how to fill the dessert crepes w just the right amount of nutella and berries, and their salads are pretty tasty, as well as their baked goods...but twice now i have been disappointed with my meal. soggy sloppy crepes, obnoxious patterns on their chairs, and once i had to wait like 45mins for a soggy eggplant sando that fell apart as i picked it up =(

all in all, you prob wont see me in the ridiculously loooong line that forms every wknd, but a dessie crepe miiiiight be worth it!!
author: Kaylan S.

description:
Last weekend I ran the US Half Marthon that took place in the Marina district...when I finished I wasn't all that hungry but knew that I had to get some carbs in me. The place was packed! I figured that any place in the Marina on a beautiful November morning was going to be packed so I patiently wait in the line to order, patiently waited again to find a free table , and then patiently waited some more for my food to arrive...by that time I was getting hungry and my patience was running out! It probably took a good 30 minutes for the food to come out and I had to got up to the counter to refill my coffee myself!

 I ordered the Tripple Gobble with a side of the Rosemary Potatoes! I give the potatoes 3 stars, the chicken apple sausage 3 stars, and the pancakes were nothin' special ...the food gave me the carbs I needed but was definitely not worth the wait....I was a little disappointed because I had been here once before and remember it being a better dining experience then.
author: Dove F.

description: Pretty good Marina establishment.  Everyone of Squat's salads are big and made with fresh ingredients.  I wouldn't mind to try their protobello mushroom sandwich in the future.  Lots of dining space and perfect outdoor seating for sunny days!
author: Shannon W.

description:
The food is great and priced well.
There seem to always be screaming children though. If you read this and feel like bringing your kids here, please don't, I beg you. Kids are great, but not when I'm trying to eat in peace and quiet.
author: Scott K.

description:
I love the squat and gobble on fillmore and haight and I was super excited they were opening one in my neighborhood, but alas...it's a little too pristine and the service is just so so.  We waited 20 minutes for our food, which was surprising, given there were few people in restaurant.  We asked for extra condiments (butter) and were refused by certain waitstaff who believed the toast was already buttered (it was not).  When asked for extra marinara sauce, we received salsa...strange.  

Like anyone else, I enjoy a clean restaurant experience, but I have to say I prefer the grittiness of the Haight location...maybe the grit makes the food that much better...
author: Mitzi C.

description:
Overly priced food will never gain more than 3 stars from me!

I've had lunch here a couple times.  Why more than once?  Well it's very conveniently located AND is always empty.  Plus it's new, so it's very clean and warm inside.  The staff isn't overly friendly.  That's really all to report.
author: Mary R.

description:
Squat and Gobble is a fun place to have lunch...casual, inexpensive, friendly staff and a bonus is eating out in the courtyard on a sunny day.  

the only reason for less than five stars is the restrooms... not so clean... and not enough for the size of the restaurant.
author: Danny W.

description: My first impression was that I would be giving this a four- or five-stars review.  What brought this down to a three (borderline two)?  The arguing between employees in the "kitchen" area, but was heard well into the dining area, the credit card machine was inoperable, and the amount of food for the price (on half the order placed).  I was (initially) the only customer, and although the food took a lil' while, it was warm some 15 min later. The reason they did not receive a two-star is because of the quality and taste of the chicken pesto crepe with rosemary garlic potatoes, and the 'eye opener' eggs with chicken-apple sausage.
author: A M.

description: came here with some friends and sat in the back patio.  The server was super friendly and they were really busy.  The food came out pretty quickly and it was a huge portion.  The food was good and I would go back here because it was good...but it was just good not amazing not bad. good for the price, quick, and nice atmosphere
author: Alexis R.

description:
A lot of friends have raved about this restaurant in the Haight, so I was excited when it came to the Marina.

A friend & I went here the other night after work for dinner.  It was quiet & empty (maybe it's only good for brunch?).  We walked right up to the counter & ordered.  Everyone was friendly & accommodating.  The space was clean & airy.  I ordered the eggplant crepe and asked for no onions. They even offered to let me add something in their in place, so in went the red peppers.  It's a quick-serve style restaurant, so we sat down & waited for our food.    

I got my crepe with side salad.  My friend got the chicken sandwich with fries.  My crepe looked healthy & fresh, however instead of no onions there were millions and no eggplant in site.  I was starving & didn't want to wait another 20 minutes (in the empty restaurant), so i picked them out.  It was okay, but definitely not great.  Very disappointing considering they had gone through all the trouble to make a substitution.

I might give this place another chance for brunch one day, but only b/c so many of my friends have raved about it.
author: kristen h.

description:
Like Crepevine on Irving had a long lost sister.

Even the chalkboard is the same.  I wouldn't be surprised if it WAS the same owner.  If you're gonna drive around for 45 minutes in the Marina to look for parking to eat here, you're crazy.

Worth mentioning is the nutella (hazenul chocolate creme) and strawberry crepe.   I mean, who doesn't like nutella.  You'd have to be nuts not to like nutella.

But as for me, the whole crepe idea is stale like grandma's breath on Sunday morning.
author: Isaac L.

description:
Sensational food, really. It's up there for me with La Boulange--whose tuna melt and salad I cannot escape whenever I'm in the area.

I like all the Squat & Gobble locations, and I particularly like this one. It's the perfect place for breakfast, brunch or lunch--to sit outside or inside and catch up with friends or alone and people watch (often what I do).
author: Sophie D.

description:
Came here Saturday morning to feed my hungover self. Ordered a Denver Crepe- it was huge and pretty damn good, though the potatoes were kind of burnt and quite salty. Only thing is the place is kind of cramped and the people next to me were with their dogs so I had this massive beast staring at my plate of food...kind of gross to look at a drooling dog while eating scrambled eggs. 

Also, these dogs had giant stuffed animals for toys (ok wtf) Being from the NYC where it's not very common to see dogs in eateries this kind of grosses me out...sorry SF dogs aren't kids! They belong in parks running around not as your "awww how cute tehehehehehe" accessory when you're eating brunch or shopping for groceries...
author: Marlene T.

description: The people, food, and seating are always great. Food is prepared and served quickly by genuinely friendly staff. Whoever does the hiring is doing a great job!
author: Catherine P.

description:
Visited the Chestnut street location on a recent Saturday morning. Maybe it was T-Day weekend and maybe we were a bit early but there was no line and a decent selection of tables.

We ordered the Upper Haight omelete and the Very Berry nutella dessert crepe.

Wow! I loved the crepe and the omelet. The crepe was one of the best I have ever had. The ingredients for the omelete were very tasty and very very fresh. The decor is nice, the place is clean, and the servers are polite. The price is also quite reasonable.

Also had a hot chocolate that was nicely made and arrived quickly.

What a great business! What a great place to eat!
author: Vic P.

description: Hmm, I used to like this place, but now they're getting a bit too smart for me. Had to wait to place my order even though I was the only one in line as two people were "busy" doing other stuff behind the counter. At least they could say "hello, we'll be with you in a minute". I ordered two items and couldn't understand why it didn't add up according to the prices on the menu. Oh, well, the "busy" guy explained that I had ordered a salmon dish, and since salmon is expensive, they automatically  add $1 per salmon dish. And then the SF healthcare tax. All in all, $3 extra. WTF? Your menu on the wall is a chalk board, how hard is to it to change the price with chalk and include everything, incl health care. There are a lot of taxes, fees, rent, and other things you need to pay. Just include it in the price like most other restaurants instead of trying to screw your customers. It may work with tourists, but many of us are locals.
author: Peter J.

description: A little pricey, but damned good crepes and waffles, and the rosemary potatoes are heavenly. 'Nuff said.
author: Mindy S.

description:
I think Squat and Gobble is a staple for breakfast in San Francisco. I feel like I always resort to coming here on Saturday morning when I am not quite sure what I am in the mood for. I like how your order and then sit. The service is a little bit slow though so I would this is not "fast" food. Be prepared for your meal to take at leats thirty minutes. The prices are fair. I would not say expensive or inexpensive. My mom was impressed with their wine selection that was pretty cheap for the quality of the wine. 
I reccomend the breakfast style food here. The burger is okay but not amazing. The eggs and hash browns are pretty good. The crepes are very filling- Not French style but more American.
Their coffee and expresso is great though. It is strong and brewed well. 
I also like how they have multiple locations in SF so no matter where you are in the city you have a relaible place to sit down and enjoy some yummy food.

ALSO they have heated outside seating on the location on Chestnut which is great for the sunny, yet windy and cold, days in Sf.
author: Nina Q.

description:
They just opened this morning and I have to say...the service was right on, credit card machine worked, food came out in a timely manner and was prepared as if this place had been up and running for some time.

The food is great cafe/crepery fare and definitely makes for a good breakfast and come lunchtime I know Ill be making another visit.  

One thing is for sure...theres a new kid on this block and both The Grove and Judy's better watch out...

I wonder if they have free wireless...
author: Ken S.

description:
I frequent this place often and don't have a bad word to say.  

1)  Local cafe feeling... feels friendly and very "local."
2)  Crepes are amazing (very fun place to take company--the options are always a hit.)
3)  Service has been impressive.  They're always helping pull tables together when our group is too big.
4)  The water has lemon and mint.
5)  Their back patio is hidden, charming and sunny.
6) The menu has great variety-- for breakfast all day, but also with pastas, burgers, etc.  Excellent vegetarian/vegan options.

This is a stand-by.  With charm and good food.
author: Shasta N.

description:
The jalapeno potatos are going on our thanksgiving menu, stat!  And srsly, this place is so underrated for dinner!!  

I had an amazing taco salad with a zippy dressing, delicious avocado, the juiciest and crisp grilled chicken and my husband had this very yummy hangar steak with jalapeno mashed potatos.  the Hef beers were refreshing, icy cold, service was fantastic and took just the right amount of time.  Plus we got seating on the sidewalk under the heat lamps to watch all the marina passerbys.  Love it. 

Minus one star for closing their outdoor patio early on a gloriously sunny, (shocking for august) evening in SF.
author: Crystal K.

description: Looking for a place to hangout after dinner?...something light?... dessert, salad, or drink. Good service, I felt like they were on top of their game. The emperor's return!
author: Dan P.

description:
See my review of The Grove if you want my comparison.  But this place is the better of the two, 9 times out of 10. 

The back patio is amazing.  Heated, free wifi, comfortable seating, great atmosphere.

The food is excellent.  Good crepes, great breakfast, good coffee.

The prices are a-ok.  Not too expensive.  Call 'em reasonable.  Oh, and onlike their across-the-street competition.  Free refills on coffee.

The staff is courteous, generous and pleasant.
author: Andy C.

description: I have these very happy memories of when my lovely Danish friend used to live in SF, and we would take out baby boys to swim class at La Petit Baleen, and then go here for crepes after.  We both always ordered the same thing: Mediterranean crepe and a soy chai... and I still always get the same thing because it's so darn yummy!  Since then I have tried the Nutella crepe, and holy deliciousness!  They have a really nice big patio out back and plenty of seating on the inside, so even if you go there at peak hours, there is always room for you somewhere.  They are also incredibly child friendly, and have a TON of highchairs available.  Oh, and the highchairs are always nice and clean which you would think should be the norm in restaurants but it is sadly the exception.  Definitely a great location for brunch any day of the week!
author: Jenny R.

description:
Let us address its first (and most glaring) ignominy: its name. 

Sigh.

yet...

They brewed (to order) single cups of their house coffee.
They serve excellent crepes; we got"As Sweet as Apple Pie" that featured a granola (with almonds and sunflower seeds) topping on the classic Apple Pie mix.
The place looked expensive but, in fact, was semi-reasonable. Coffee was 2 bucks and the crepe was 7.

...on the flip side...

The decor on the back patio screamed I AM OSTENTATIOUS with the lion head relief statue emblazoned with the "SG" crest of the restaurant-name-that-should-never-be-mentioned.
The cafe's also a chain.

In sum, this gets the To-Avoid vote cause the atmosphere is... weird.

Plus, advertised free wi-fi with no offer of the code from the server. 

Restaurant-style seating that seemed a little too optimistic. Us and one other lady were the only customers but the place looks like it could serve a hundred. Maybe it's known mostly for its overpriced dinners--I did notice a few 20 dollar plates on the dinner menu.

Unfortunately, I am a sucker for crepes. But will prob get them someplace else.
author: K.Robyn L.

description:
I have to agree with Genevieve below. The food here is seriously bland. 

I had high hopes when I first walked in. It is very clean, nicely decorated. Big menu. My son eats at the Haight Street location quite often and loves it, so when we were on Chestnut Street at lunchtime today we thought we'd get a good meal.

I ordered the Mexican Salad with Chicken. It took a very long time for the food to come, and the restaurant wasn't even half full. The chicken in my salad was a little dry, but not too bad, but the rest of the salad was a disappointment. The lettuce was a little brown around the edges, and in pieces so big it was hard to eat without a knife and fork. It was also wet and so the truly bland dressing didn't coat the lettuce. The whole thing was just kind of tasteless. There was some corn and tomatoes in it, but they didn't have any flavor. The avocado wasn't ripe. There was a small piece of focaccia on the side which was stale and tasteless.

My son had a cheeseburger which he said was ok.

All in all, not a great experience, and I'm not going to rush back.
author: Patsy K.

description:
Big fan of Squat & Gobble - I must say though, the name turned me off at first, but I've been back a handful of times and surely cannot complain. The menu is unique, offering anything from crepes, omelettes, salads, pasta and sandwiches - certainly almost anything to catch the eye. Oh, and the wait staff is very courteous - even on busy days they make their rounds to ensure the food is up to par and that your glass is full - much appreciated in my book!

Edit 7/2/2008: The back patio at this place is awesome! I've been coming here for a long time and had never checked it out until last week. Hit it up!
author: Jonathan D.

description:
I am in love with Crepes- breakfast, lunch, dessert, it doesn't matter.  

I ordered the Florentine crepe, which has cheddar cheese, onions, spinach, and cottage cheese.  It came out delicious and hot.  All for $7.95.  I also had a glass of champagne.  Yummmm.  The potatoes were hot, nothing out of the ordinary, but good.

This place was super crowded- I came here around noon on a Sunday.
author: Sarah F.

description:
I love their eggs, especially the across the border omelette. It actually inspired me to learn how to cook them. The portions are huge and you will be full. Very good use of $10.

I can't comment on the other food, but the eggs are seriously good.
author: Zain A.

description: It's kinda like Crepevine. I like it here but I don't love it. The food is good but it's a bit pricey.
author: Jenny T.

description: I have been coming to this place since 1996. I used to go to the one on Fillmore -and never had any issues with food or otherwise. the prices have skyrocketed however the menu is more diverse. the Western Burger was decent, however they sent my husband the wrong order -he asked for an Angus Cheesesteak sandwich and they sent the Angus burger. When I let the waitress know that was the wrong order, she gave us a look and I told her again it was a mistake. I also gave her my plate to keep warm while they cooked the correct thing for my husband. She brought the right order back pretty quick but then said she would get him his Ranch dressing-he hates ranch lol and had asked for a side of Mayo. We laughed about it and again she looked at us like we were nuts and actually tried to argue and insist he had asked for a side of ranch-I mean, seriously? The music was BLARING inside and maybe the girl who took out order couldn't hear us, so my husband suggested to the argumentative waitress that they might want to turn the music down as things were being misunderstood. Whatever happened to the customer is always right ? Anyways, the guy who seemed to be in charge was charming and nice and checked on us, so I give him three stars for great service. I may have to go check the one on Fillmore again....
author: Mia C.

description:
This place is in my neighborhood and is always crowded on weekends. The food is your standard breakfast fare with a decent selection of crepes thrown in. Nothing really stands out...except the fresh squeezed OJ. The portions are absolutely gargantuan and the home style potatoes have their moments. 

If you're looking for a reliable brunch scene with your younger marina crowd, this is it. But if I didn't live in the marina, I wouldn't go out of my way to come eat here.
author: Alexander S.

description: Get the Italian! Their coffee is surprisingly fantastic. They brew each cup. And the service is remarkable for a casual place such as this. I usually avoid the casual commercial, and I detest chains, but if this is a chain, it's all right in my book. On my way out I wanted a quick refill on my coffee. I was told that it would be just 2 min as they brew each cup fresh. I politely declined as I didn't want another cup that bad and was ready to leave. The guy helping me then responded, "would you like it to go?". Wow service.
author: Darin A.

description: This is a place I've frequented a few times. They make a great omelet here, but everything else is a bit bland. I've so far tried the omelet and benedict and crepe. I like the fact that the have outdoor seating, but because of the location, snobs and douche bags frequent this place as well. But overall I still come back for a quick and good breakfast. I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could.
author: W W.

description:
i didnt think this place was anything spectacular. i think i might have preferred to eat at IHOP.

the roasted rosemary potatoes were a little TOO roasted, leaving the majority of potatoes inedible.

crepe was nothing special. 

will not come here again. nothing special or memorable about this place.
author: Melanie F.

description: Had a sidewalk brunch here today (beautiful day in SF!).  The manager personally greeted us.   My friend had a salmon crepe and I had the eggs florentine.  Both were delish!  The rosemary potatoes were yummy and the fruit was fresh.  Will be going back.
author: Tina H.

description: Their portions are HUGE!  I shared a classic burger with my mom and it was hearty and flavorful.  Their fries are decent too.  For dessert, we had the apple pie crepe that came hot and paired with vanilla ice cream.  I like the crunchy topping they also sprinkle on top for a little extra texture.  They have some outdoor tables on the sidewalk for a nice sunny day in the Marina.
author: Nina L.

description:
It gets 4 stars because it has a very large and tasty menu. It's good for kids. I know yelpers don't generally comment on whether kids like a place or not, but this is a favorite. Their coffee is pretty good too.
I was going to give it three stars because I don't like to wait in line to order. If I am going out for breakfast, I am tired and I want to sit down.
author: Jennifer T.

description: This place was simple but good...It seemed like the crepes were delicious but I opted for an egg white omelette which was quite good.  I had the Castro option for my omelette and the portions were greatly sized and the coffee was pretty tasty.  This place wasn't overly unique but I was pretty satisfied with everything that I tasted.
author: sara s.

description:
came for brunch on 4th of july.  it wasn't very crowded as the marina neighborhood was generally pretty quiet that weekend...

we sat outside since the dog was with us.
i had a crepe with cheese and mushrooms and spinach... i think it was the florentine... yea... and soy latte
the crepe was pretty thick which i don't mind, but i can see how some crazy peeps might object to thicker crepes... the more carbs the better for me... i had a choice of salad or potatoes so i chose the potatoes... 
the food was good but not great.  felt a bit bland and as if it was missing something in the flavor department.... i thought the portion was a bit too big, but that's probably another thing that peeps might disagree with me as the large portions prevail in this nation...
author: charlotte s.

description: I've been to Squat & Gobble a few times and have never been disappointed. Theres usually a line out the door, -a good sign!-  but don't let that deter you! It moves fast. The food is great quality and comes surprisingly fast after you order. I recommend the Ruben!
author: James R.

description: I loved their savory and the sweet (strawberry and nutella) crepes - the sweet crepe rocked with the vanilla icecream and the OJ is really fresh ... Cannot go wrong with this place
author: Dhwipa P.

description: I dined with two friends and had a horrible experience. We ordered our food and sat down.  As we waited for our food, we observed over ten customers that came After us being served their food.  Thirty minutes passes and we finally asked a passing waiter who didn't have a clue and went to the back to check.  Ten minutes later a waiter came out with ONE of the meals. We proceeded to ask for the manager (about the two missing meals) since no one had a clue.  The manager came over and told us he'd return after checking in the back.  Then he came back and rudely proceeded to tell us that we must have done something wrong when ordered and thus caused much of the confusion.  We were amazed at his brazen and unprofessional behavior.  Needless to say, we returned the One untouched plate, obtained our refund and left after giving the manager a little tip on customer service.
author: E A.

description:
This is one of the first establishments i frequently attended for breakfast before I felt comfortable enough to explore the Marina.  The food is always a treat.  I often order the croissant breakfast sandwich and the strawberry waffle.  Both items are made with fresh ingredients that you are able to taste.  I was surprised to find the secret garden area in the back when I felt it necessary to explore a bit.  It is a very nice place to relax and enjoy a wonderful morning in San Francisco.  
I intend to try the crepes the next time I go there because they seem to be delicious.  I would recommend Squat & Gobble to anyone it is always a great pick.
author: Alex M.

description:
Why isn't this place rated higher??!!!

True story- the first time I ate here (Chicken Pesto Crepe) I came back that very same night for a dessert crepe!  I've come back many times since and have yet to be disappointed.  You can't go wrong with their dessert crepes also... especially if you ask for BOTH ice cream and whipped cream! MMmmmmmm

Their salads aren't too shabby as well.  I ordered the Mexican chicken salad and omg.... they put like half an avocado on the top!  It was like a ticket straight to my heart.

Another great thing about this place is their $4 20oz beers!  I think they have Fat Tire, Widmer Hef, Stella, and Serra Nevada Pale Ale.  Don't get too excited though...  a coworker of mine was told, "This is not a bar!" when he ordered his third drink.  Nevertheless, this place is worth a shot.
author: Cersei T.

description: This was my kind of restaurant! You walk up and order and pay right there. Then you sit down and get served like a reg restaurant, but only faster! Its in a cute/really nice neighborhood of the Marina in SF. The food was amazing, I had the gobble breakfast and it was a good size portion and everything was pretty cheap. They had awesome fresh squeezed OJ.
author: Samira H.

description: Even though the service was lacking (I had to go into the restaurant twice eventually finding the manager and asked the server once to get my cup of coffee), the french toast was among the best I've had. Crunchy on the outside, sweet and smooth on the inside. I'd definitely return for this treat.
author: Ryan M.

description: Awesome service.  They were just coming off a big lunch rush and they never slowed down.  Some the best attention to detail I have had in a restaurant.  Food was awesome as well.
author: David C.

description: Enjoyable but nothing super memorable or innovative.  Holding onto it's chain-like feel, it boasts standard fare - salads, sandwiches, & a variety of breakfast items and crepes.  The Mexican Salad was good and large enough for 2 to share.  I would definitely return... and am anxious to check out this back patio people are raving about!!  Sounds like a fabulous destination on a warm sunny Sunday morning :)
author: Whitney H.

description:
The employees over at the counter are pretty rude looking, and impatient, when there are no customers in line...they are nowhere to be found. Probably they are hiding in the back chatting away with those "illegals".Lol.
I had to stand around for at least 10 mins or more a couple of times just to order something. NOT GOOD! 

- Nutella with chocolate crepe was too sweet...mouth explosion of chocolate. I had to scrape off plenty of goobs of chocolate off the crepe and just eat it cause it was money spent. But thank god I ordered it with vanilla ice cream cause it washed off the chocolate.
- Apricot almond crepe was more refreshing and clean. Try it!

Entrees?
- Spaghetti Bolognese was mediocre but not awesome! But it is better than most cafes that serve "spaghetti with meat sauce"...which probably means it is "Prego" thrown in with some ground pork.
- Salmon Fettucini(sp???) was alright...the salmon bites were a tad fishy, the sauce was too creamy and sweet, could have lighten up about the sauce.
author: Club G.

description:
First time I was here I had chocolate chip banana pancakes. I know, I know, completely over the top! They were sooo good, but I had a sugar buzz for the first half the afternoon. The second half? You can probably guess.

The downside of the place is having to guess whether or not there will be a table free by the time you get through the line to order. What happens, anyway, if by the time they deliver your food you haven't found a place to sit yet?
author: Kevin T.

description:
This is supposedly a family friendly place.  Do families eat there? Yes.  Is it a place? Yes.  Is it friendly to your family?  Most definitely not if you care about the welfare of your children.

Why do I say this?  Well, we went with our two kids and ordered chicken fingers.   We weren't expecting Chez Panisse mind you, but we were expecting them to be cooked.  Yes, cooked.  What we got was breaded chicken a light golden brown and 100% raw on the inside.  Our son ate one before we could stop him and the whole afternoon we were waiting to see if he would get food poisoning.  (He managed to survive.)

When I called over a manager, he sheepishly refunded me our money and asked if we wanted another plate of chicken.  Uhm, no thanks.

The outdoor space is nice and the staff is very friendly, but as our daughter now calls it "the Raw Chicken Restaurant" it's probably no longer a destination for us.
author: Grace W.

description: amazing brunch place. crepes are fantastic and the outdoor patio in the back is really cozy and intimate.
author: Smita M.

description: Nomm nommm. I came here with a friend once. We had no clue what we were craving so we walked in here. I ordered their portobello sandwhich, it had me at HELLO. that sandwhich was so good I didn't know how to react. Seriously omg.
author: Peeta B.

description: Mmm crepes. I ordered the Zorba the Greek with the potatoes.  It was packed with food and the crepe was still light.  The potatoes were soooo good I want to go back and get some right now.  The workers were friendly and it was very nice and clean inside.  I really want to come back for a dessert crepe and also try some of the breakfast.
author: Nicole C.

description: Went here during the Memorial day weekend and the Golden Gate Bridge celebration. Tons of people in this place and line out the door.  Figure with this much people it cant be bad. Saw a few people leave the line probably cause it took a long time to order. We finally ordered and found a seat.  This place is setup so you order your food at the counter, find your own seat and they bring the food to you. I think it's setup this way so they can get tips.  More than a few time I seen the waiters walk back and forth with your food looking for your number.  No reason to bring the food to your table since they don't know where you're sitting.  Just call your number and get your food. Wait... there's more to this story.... as we're sitting there for the longest time waiting for our food. The waitress accidentally drop a glass of beer on my daughter!  Luckily it didn't hit her but spills all over her sweater and chair.  Enough that she has to take off the sweater and the need to mop her chair up and the floor. They apologize and ask if they can bring anything.  My girlfriend ask if they can give both my daughters a muffin.  I don't think that's asking much.  They reply back with I can give you one and they can split it!!  WTH!!  I'm not asking for a free meal.  Just something to show good customer service and a sorry gesture.  Anyways the food was OK but I won't be back.
author: Tony Y.

description: Food was great and well priced, but the service was a bit sub-par. The table next to us had to wait for their food for too long -- in fact they got their food after my party of 6 despite the fact they ordered first! I also had to ask for more coffee 4 times over the course of 20 minutes before I got it - pretty frustrating. But the atmosphere was enjoyable and everyone was very pleased with their food. I'll definitely be returning here quite often.
author: Mike M.

description: This place was so bad! I have gone here before years ago and it used to be so good.  My food was so cold and it was not cooked fully.  I felt like for the price at least I would have expected to get something a lot better quality.
author: Melissa M.

description: Whenever I'm in Marina this is my little go-to breakie place. I've really never had anything that wasn't really delicious. Its a roomy place, comfy seating and the patio is lovely and relaxing. I usually go for one of their Italian crepes or something with nutella. I love their rosemary potatoes. I've not seen the managerial abuse that some yelpers have witnessed, but i'm going to keep an eye out. Service is pretty standard when I've gone. Nothing amazing but not really bad either. Coffee is okay, it works. The food is what i go for. When its busy head to the patio, its not as noisy. Overall a cheery little place for breakfast.
author: Amie N.

description: Good food and good services. The OJ is great and fresh. Try to sit out in the back courtyard when its nice.  Also, the option of fries or salad is nice.
author: Alex S.

description: My husband and I live right on Chestnut and Squat $ Gobble is by far our favorite breakfast/crepery and lunch spot!  Very nice atmosphere, clean and the outside patio is perfect for having a weekend brunch. The portions are huge and delicious.  Keep up the great work!
author: Ruru S.

description: Come early and snag a table and avoid the lines. I sat before noon and had no problems waiting for a table.  I ordered the lower haight omelet, the marina crepe and verry berry dessert crepe.  All were delicious. The dessert crepe was covered with chocolate and nutella (delicious) including the ice cream.  I also ordered a fresh squeezed orange juice, which was freshly squeezed just right there. It really makes a huge difference with the freshly squeezed juices.  With the omelet and crepes, they came with salad (yummy and fresh) and fruit salad (great selection of melons, mangoes, grapes, apples and pineapples). All in all, I was stuffed and satisfied with a very delicious brunch.
author: Natalie S.

description: Amazingly good crepes and they are huge! I would definitely come here again. I had the Zorba the Greek with a side of fruit salad.
author: Kenan F.

description:
Kudos to Scott, the manager. I am awed by how hard he works and how genuiunely friendly he is. I witnessed him on 3 separate occasions within a week, and each time he was going out of his way to please everyone. He definitely succeeded when it came to me. 

From steering me right on my order (tofu scramble--mmmm) to timing everything right for my late friends, to safe guarding my forgotten file until I could return to pick it up. I am impressed by the food, the atmosphere, the efficient, friendly staff, and most of all, by my new reason to go-- manager, Scott.
author: faith f.

description: So good!  My husband and I both got the turkey burger, which was delicious.  It did come with some "untraditional" toppings, like a cranberry-type sauce.  I prefer more classic burgers but my husband said it was the best turkey burger he'd ever eaten!  Everything on the menu and all the food people had around us looked delicious.  Everything tasted so fresh.  We nabbed a couple cookies as well, which were also delicious.  Definitely stop in here for a casual breakfast or lunch, or even a snack, if you're in the area!
author: Samantha B.

description: I like the restaurants in the Marina.  I usually have to drag my girlfriends with me because they're such homebodies and like to order in.  But for good crepes, they'll come if I ask nicely.  Squat and Gobble is one of my favorite places to eat crepes.  I also like their other locations, but the Marina is cool because I can shop before and after I eat.  There's always something to do over there, and it's beautiful when it's a sunny day.
author: Honey L.

description: This is our very first Yelp review, but could not pass-up on the wonderful and personalised service we received from Cas (manager) at Squat and Gobble Chestnut.  This is one of our neighborghood restaurant and we have been there MANY times.  Cas always remembers us, when we bring friends he is social and friendly and we introduce him.  When he is there, most every time we have been, he goes up and beyond and makes sure every guest has what they need, and is enjoying their food and experience.  We have noticed him even give advice and directions to tourists when needed.  Cas is professional and cares and the restaurant benefits very much from this.  Thank you.
author: Myriam M.

description: Nicoise salad was soooo good!  It was on their "specials" board, so not sure if they always have it.  It was huge with tons of olives & anchovies, which I love.  Next time I think I might ask for less dressing.
author: HY L.

description: I went here purely for the crepes only to discover its also a restaurant. I went about 1:30 on a monday, busy busy! the line was long and was borderline too slow but I blame the people ordering because the cashier was quick efficient and friendly. I ordered the strawberries and nutella crepe. sat down at the table and wait about 10-15 mins. Crepe was absolutely fantastic. borderline on too rich but it was still very edible and perfectly warm. staff is busy but friendly and always doing their jobs. Bathrooms are clean. I didn't know they had a back patio but I imagine it's lovely. Inside is very lively, but for all the people you don't have to shout to be heard so kudos on that. I'll go back to try other things on the menu definitely
author: Kaitie D.

description: I always seem to end up at Squat & Gobble. It's roomy enough to withstand the brunch rush that takes over the Marina area on weekends when most places require a lengthy wait and an anxiety attack. The staff is SO friendly and helpful and the food is not bad. Yummy crepes with nutella are my favorite. They also have a GREAT patio area which I never knew about until recently. Will be great in the summer and works in the winter too when the heat lamps are on. Minus one star cause I sort of wish it was a sit down and place your order rather than an order at the counter kind of place.
author: Esther A.

description: Squat & Gobble is the quintessential Marina establishment. The restaurant swarms with girls in ponytails in baseball caps with puffy vests and LuLu Lemon yoga pants. The only thing that's missing is the Jamba Juice and yoga mat. Despite the predictable Marina wildlife, Squat & Gobble is still a stand up place to get Sunday brunch.
author: Khrissy V.

description: We had dinner here and the food and service was great. The beef tenderloin was tasty and tender and the staff was very friendly. Certainly on my list of places to go back to.
author: Bob D.

description:
This is the perfect place to come to after the dinner crowds have left. On a Wednesday evening, with only a dozen people in the restaurant, it took forever for our crepes to be prepared. It was worth the wait. The fruity dessert crepes were superb both in their presentation and taste.

Later in the evening the crowd changes a bit too. It didn't seem to be filled with as many preppy Marina types. I'm coming here just before closing again.
author: Junius G.

description:
i came. i squat. i gobbled.

thank you, thank you for opening up the patio in the back. this makes it easier to not walk out on a sunday morning while people are ravaging the place for seats. their cappuccinos are and absolute delight. some of the best i've ever had, and i'm such an espresso snob. the south of the border omelette and eggs benedict are usually the two contestants i'm contemplating between. if i could get half of each it'd really make my life a lot easier.

don't even get me started on sweet crépes. delish. delight. deluxe. go easy on the nutella, tho.
author: Nancy P.

description:
i've  been here a few times now and will continue to update as i try more things on the menu:

chicken salad sandwich:  love it because they toast the bread so that it doesn't get soggy underneath everything!  who does that anymore??

crepes are okay:  a bit soggy.

triple eye opener breakfast:  bacon was extra crispy and perfect.  scrambled eggs were not oily which was great, but a bit overcooked and dry.  pancakes were fluffy, but bland.

great place for consistently decent cafe food that is moderately priced for the neighborhood.
author: Josie M.

description: A go-to for breakfast or brunch on the weekend. There may be a line but I've never had to wait to sit. They have a ton on the menu, although some of the simpler meals (pancakes and eggs) aren't exactly worth the price. Try some of the more interesting choice!
author: Stephanie C.

description: I really really loved the vegetarian black bean chili, it was spicy and delicious! It also came with a piece of bread, which was good. I wish I could have tried more things but the menu is a little on the expensive side, I didn't expect cheaper though. It was worth it... EXCEPT ONE THING- the bathroom is scary gross.. but what do you expect, I guess. Either way- I'm definitely coming back here when I visit. The service was good too, nice guy.
author: angela c.

description: Went there on a hungry/lazy sat. afternoon by chance, and ended up really enjoying it! Great beer prices and food was very good and large portions.  I had the Prime Rib Melt and a 20 oz. beer.
author: Scotty B.

description: They always have a great selection for me to choose from especially the breakfast menu (because I LOVE breakfast!). This one in particular is fairly busy with business people to parents and their kids...never dull. The staff are friendly and always making sure that the tables are nice and clean and cleared...I always get my orders fast which is good because I am always hungry...will be back for more!
author: Mel P.

description: Loved this place! Went for lunch on Sunday after a long weekend of camping and all I could think about was a healthy lunch. I ordered the nicoise seared tuna salad and boy did I get a meal! Two huge seared steaks over a great salad. The back patio is so cute with it's private little tables, green vines. Wifi access is a plus as well. Definitely plan on going back.
author: Kristin M.

description: The employees were friendly, but I have nothing else good to say.  We walked out without finishing our terrible breakfast, and went to another restaurant.  The coffee was bad, the toast was limp, the jam was awful (how can you mess up jam?), the fruit in the fruit cup was unripe, and the music at breakfast time was a driving funk soundtrack that did not make for a peaceful morning experience.  (We went to The Grove across the street and had a very nice breakfast.)
author: V S.

description:
Must try their savory and Sweet Crepes.  So good! Place is clean. Great service & friendly.  Coffee is also great!

Good for breakfast, lunch, brunch etc
author: T O.

description: I can only speak for the dessert crepes - I had the nutella & strawberry one.  But this was such a "fake" crepe!  It used strawberry syrup and not enough fresh strawberries, the crepe lacked a good buttery flavor, and the vanilla ice cream was just blah.  Save your taste buds for Ti-Couz!
author: Sunny C.

description: Well, I've eaten here twice...once in the Haight for breakfast and once today in the Marina.  The sandwich I had today was fabulous. I didn't want tuna and I asked the guy what to get that was vegetarian or "pescatarian" and he said he really liked the eggplant sandwich on Foccacia. I was hesitant but it was absolutely delicious!  The fruit on the side was not ripe, with the exception of the strawberries. I will go back to get it again. Good recommendation on his behalf!
author: Courtney M.

description: Amazing service! Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. They even came to our table several times to check on us. The menu and atmosphere is very similar to Crepevine, and this new location is extremely clean and homey feeling. I ordered the Penne Guilliamo, which was delicious. For $8.95, it was fantastic. Next time, I'm going to share an entree (I had a lot left over) and get a fruity nutella crepe for dessert.
author: Connie C.

description: Yet another failed attempt at Mama's for brunch (still a long lineup at 2:30pm on Sunday!!!), we made our way to Squat and Gobble on Chestnut. The line moved fast but we did wait quite awhile for our orders to arrive. I ordered the Hawaiian crepe with pineapple, ham and sweet sour sauce and gobbled away....Bf ordered the Mama Mia which was filled with eggplant, tomatoes, mozarella and cottage cheese, a lil too cheesy for my liking but anyhow, both crepes were tasty, gobble gobble.... We were thinking about ordering a dessert crepe but we were too stuffed with our savory ones. Next time....Extensive menu and it was really crowded even at 3pm on a Sunday.
author: Yan M.

description: This is a great place to go on a Sunday to enjoy a great brunch with friends... Everyone had a great tasting meal. The crepes have some wild flavor to them, but the triple gobbler worked just fine for myself. This is definitely going to be a place I revisit in the near future.
author: Miguel V.

description: I am not much of a Marina fan but I actually didn't mind eating at this place - cleaner, bigger portions - well, at least it seemed like it and I like to eat. The food did take a little longer than usual but I was in good company sipping mimosas on sunny Sunday morning - maybe I liked it cuz it was just a nice day :-) I give this place a 3.5 to 4 stars.
author: Jen R.

description: I always get some sort of omelet here. I can't say the food is spectacular but it's solidly good food. The thing is, I associate this particular cafe location with sunshine and lazy brunches. I've spent many a Sunday gorging on the fatty portions here while gazing contentedly at my brunch partner or passerbys. My brunch partners nor I have never had any complaints re service and we've always enjoyed our meals. But I have to admit we're fairly passive when we're hungover and it's difficult to be crabby when it's so beautiful outside.
author: Kelly K.

description:
five stars for:
1)  being clearly open and available on a friday night 
2)  the pleasant glass of merlot -- unwound me just the way i needed it to 
3)  making my burger perrrrrfect (medium)
4)  crispy, clean fries
5)  warm lighting
author: melissa n.

description: I've been here a couple times for brunch and it's pretty awesome. Since they have a pretty diverse menu, you'll be sure to find something to satisfy your taste or mood. The omelettes and crepes are pretty delish. I had "The Marina" which if I remember correctly had salmon, artichokes, and spinach in it. Like all the brunch places in the marina, this place can get pretty crowded, so be prepared to drop your stick and gloves and fight for a table ;)
author: Jamie T.

description:
Beware!!!!Found Two Different Hairs in my Crepe-White hair and Black Hair!!!!!!
I live in the Marina.  Today I went to squat and gobble on Chestnut Street to take my girlfriend out for her birthday lunch.  I ordered a Chicken Pesto Crepe and she ordered the Hawaiian Crepe.  In my crepe there were multiple hairs.  Two different colored hairs.  White hair and black hair.  This is unacceptable.   I know a great deal about food business and I would be upset if I had complaints of hair in food.  Especially two hairs from different people in one meal.  This manner should be addressed.  Maybe your chefs and prep cooks should be required to wear hair nets.  I was reimbursed $10 in cash, but believe I deserve more than that.  I order a Bloody Mary, capuccino, and a Mimosa for my girlfrend as well.  We left immediately after our full meal was not refunded and I did not receive an apology.  I have alot of friends in the Marina and will make sure they do not go to your establishment.  I also plan on typing some online reviews about my experience for others to read.
author: steven p.

description: A friend told me this place was good for dinner so when I needed a breakfast spot I figured I would try it out. Very fast and friendly service - my coffee was never empty which is a must! Prices were good and the menu has lots of options. Everyone was happy with their food and I would definitely visit again.
author: Ben G.

description: Too many bad experiences here to give it more than 2 stars.  Twice my brunch order has been inexplicably "lost".  I'm talking about waiting nearly an hour, asking about the status of the order repeatedly, being mindlessly placated into waiting longer, and then eventually having the order re-entered before being served.  TWICE.  And neither time was any sort of offer for a discount or free item or anything made.  The food is generally good, and the fresh OJ nice, but even outside of my 2 horrible experiences I've been frustrated by the slow line, slow food and slow coffee refills on every occasion.  Skip it.
author: Jennifer H.

description: My boyfriend I recently ate breakfast  here on a short trip to San Francisco. I ordered a waffle and he had french toast. The waffle was kinda dry and tough. I ordered a soy mocha hot, and there was way too much mocha powder in it. They served it to me in a big glass and it was like drinking chocolate milk. The french toast was not that bad. Overall, it was rather mediocre.
author: M. R.

description:
This place has got something for all times of the day.  

My favorite is the Eggs Benedict with fruit and a glass of carrot juice.  Try it!
author: Seth H.

description:
This place had delicious food! 

I ordered the spaghettini with prawns in a garlic butter sauce and my boyfriend had a pork chop special with candied butternut squash and Parmesan whipped potatoes. Both dishes were excellent. The prawns were huge! 

pros: the food
cons: quite a long wait (and not the restaurants fault, but we were sitting very close to two girls carrying on a loud, obnoxious conversation that we had no interest in listening to.)

Very good food!
author: C C.

description:
I am new to yelp and I felt so happy to find possibly the best grilled salmon sandwich I have ever tasted, that I joined Yelp just to let everyone know. 
It was mouth watering! The bread was lightly toasted and was so fresh and light that it melted in your mouth. You really need to check it out!! My two kids who are the pickiest eaters in the world took a bite and LOVED it too...They might actually eat fish now! Thank you Squat and Gobble!
author: fred b.

description: I went with 4 people last night and funny enough none of us got crepes. So sadly I cannot comment on their crepe-making abilities. Most of us got some form of their eggs benedict/florentine. The boyfriend and I got the crab cake florentine and another friend just got the regular florentine. The crab cakes were really really crunchy and tasty! I absolutely loved them and was quite surprised how good they were. The poached eggs sitting on top of them were decently made too. I also had some of the chicken sandwhich and I have to say that it wasn't anything special and frankly had little flavor. The side salad that comes with most things wasn't anything to scream about either but at least it was fresh. I would give this place 4 stars if not for the mistake they made, gave the boyfriend the salad when he wanted potatoes, and the bland sandwhich.
author: Jenny C.

description: Mmmm, crepes.  A delightful cafe with great outdoor seating - front sidewalk or back patio.  I can only speak for the crepes but everything was fresh and delicious and the service was friendly and efficient.
author: M R.

description: The back patio is key on a nice day.  The whole place gets a little noisy on weekends when families show up, but it's all well worth it for their croissant breakfast sandwich.  I ride there from SOMA just to eat it.  And the staff is always extremely nice and willing to accommodate my periodic strange substitution requests.
author: David B.

description: OK,  so when it comes to breakfast foods, I'm easy to please.  When it comes to dessert, I'm even easier.  I usually go to Crepevine in the sunset but when a friend wanted to get together on a Sunday afternoon to just chat and sit around, we chose Squat & Gobble.  It was really similar until my dessert crepe came out steaming hot, which it usually does not at Crepevine.  I tried my friend's Italian crepe.  It had some goooooood pesto sauce on top of it.  Melted cheeses and whatever else inside that made me eat all of my sweet crepe AND half of her savory one. ha ha.  People next to me got some huge salad thing that made me want to order that too but I resisted.  Looking forward to getting that next time though.
author: Tokki M.

description: I think a lot of the reviews here have it right on this place - it's not the most amazing food ever (though the fresh squeezed OJ is to die for), but it's spacious, clean and efficient. The back patio makes you feel like you're at Disneyland (in a good way). I've only had the dessert crepes (Berry Nutella - yum), and I think they're pretty good - bacon is also very satisfying. Squat, Gobble and be happy :)
author: Kiesha R.

description: Huge servings in a decent atmosphere. Nothing special, but it's a decent place for a casual meal. Especially when you want a LOT of food.
author: Monika M.

description: I love this place. The menu is HUGE, the line moves quickly, the lattes are good, the staff is very friendly and you can get beer with breakfast. Maybe that's why the GF and I find ourselves there 3 out of 4 weekends every month.
author: Ben R.

description: I have been a fan of this place since they opened in the Marina. It is so wonderful to see such good service in a partially self-service place. You order at the counter- register, and take a number. The food arrives in a timely manner, the servers are friendly and eager to please. The food is always fresh and delicious, no matter what you order. The place is clean and very nicely decorated. I have been there to eat by myself, with my husband, with a group of friends and with my children and grandchildren. It is always very comfortable!
author: Christina R.

description: I ate here once and the server was anxious to make recommendations. We took her advice and both meals we received were pretty marginal.  Atmosphere is weird - tacky seating - counter style ordering.  I prefer the Grove.
author: Lucy L.

description: Great "lower height" omelet. Quick service. Nice patio in the back.
author: Ivar S.

description: With a name like Squat (sit) and gobble (eat), I hope it's good! I had the Turkey Gobble with Rosemary Garlic potatoes. The sandwich was tasty but I liked the potatoes even more so. Will have to go back and try other things on their interesting menu.
author: Ed L.

description: The line moves fast, seats open up fast, the menu is vast, and the food is generous and delicious.  While the concept is totally unoriginal (it looks like every other breakfast/creperie in SF, right down to the colorful chalkboard menu)  its hard to find anything wrong with the place.  Crepes, salads, sandwiches, bagels, morning cocktails (and even some Soju concoctions as well).   I ordered an eggplant sandwich and greek salad to split with a friend, and everything was perfect.  Slices of eggplant thicker than you thought possible, cooked perfectly, seasoned perfectly...its the eggplant sandwich I dream of (despite being on Foccacia...my least favorite bread).  The greek salad dressing is perfectly tangy.  The portions are good for the price, and you'll end up with leftovers for sure.  A solid establishment!
author: Cathleya G.

description: Good place for a casual fast bite. Tastes good, nice selection, both crepes and sandwiches are worth having. Never encountered anything not worth having here so feel free to through a dart on their menu when you're not sure what to try. Even enjoyed their soup on a cold night.
author: Sabi M.

description: Had breakfast here the other day with a friend and really enjoyed it.  The patio seating out back was worth at least a full star.  The food was pretty good though nowhere near the caliber of some of the top breakfast/brunch places in SF.  But it's better priced and less crowded.
author: Matt S.

description: I needed a bull horn to place my order and hold a conversation in this place.  Food was good but not worth the 30 minute wait.  Does it really take that long to cook an omelet and a scramble?  They also lose points for the self service on the coffee.. I really don't want to fight through people to mix my coffee. Put creamer or milk on the tables. Grazie!
author: Tom C.

description: Above average eatery.  Nothing fantastic.  If you want fantastic lunch food, go to Rose's.  But, it's solid, and their food tastes better than the Grove across the street.
author: Tim G.

description: It was alright.  I much prefer Bean Bag Cafe (across from the Independent) or The Crepe house (on Polk & Washington) for tastier crepes and salads and a better value.
author: Jen X.

description: Sometimes you just feel like a pancake and I feel like they are good for just a pancake.   No more, no less.  Breakfast food is what I always get here even during lunch hours as there are better places on Chestnut to get a good lunch.
author: Jeff R.

description: I felt it was a little overpriced for what the food was. It was awesome that they had fresh juices and I understand it being a little more money but around 5 dollars for orange juice is crazy sounding! Haha anyways I got a really good crepe and some fresh lemonaide its was all fairly good, the service was a little slow. It was okayy.
author: Ali S.

description: I've came here two times and the first time I got the Gobble burger, which was good with some fries on the side. The second time I got a philly cheesesteak, and that wasn't that great... it was decent, but it didn't have the "damn that was good" to it. The workers are pretty nice, the place is also pretty nicely set. There is also an outdoor seating in the back.
author: Edgar G.

description: The staff deserves 5 stars. Very good service, everyone who works there is very very nice. I like the food. Just don't give it a 5 stars because the nutella from the crepe i tried didn't really taste like nutella, tasted more like regular chocolate. But was good anyways... A lot better than the West Portal location.
author: Fabiana H.

description:
Squat & Gobble has a great atmosphere for casual, fun-filled meals with friends.  That said, last night was a terrible experience.  I ordered the Greek Salad and spent the entire night up with food poisoning.  I think the salad dressing was rancid.  I called the restaurant to tell them about it today.  They said they were sorry and would look into it.

In general, I find the food overpriced for what it is, and the vegan options are slim.  No ill will against the establishment, but I personally will not be eating here again.
author: Anne Y.

description: First Time & LAST TIME!  With me, you lose a star with each infraction.  Father-in-law (Grandpa) took care of the bill.  Otherwise, I would reduce the tip from 20% to 10%.  Squat might have a 15% -20% minimum tip for 6+ groups.  I don't know but the food and service could be improved.  The name "Squat & Gobble" just rubs me wrong.  Next, I ordered the Chinese Chicken Salad.  Chicken was cooked to death and hard.  The veggies were good and crisp but the Chicken is edible and not GREAT edible.  Our group is 9 from 18 yrs. to 74 yrs.  My son didn't seem too crazy about his Chicken Alfredo.  My daughter loved her crepe and my wife loved her stuff too.  2 out of 9 should earn them a average of 3 but when the waitress stop to ask us for boxes.  I asked her for water.  SHE FORGOT.  I asked our regular server.  She FORGOT.  I signaled her over.  "I want water & a box for leftovers."  The cashier/reception/order taker was asked about the largest dish portion.  Yes, I can eat.  Average disk is $10. and I can make a HUGE salad for $10.  She cooly replied, "Every dish is a sizable portion but the salads are HUGE."  "Of course, wrong, the salad is average and could use some bread on the side and carrots would nice.  But overall, S&G is nothing great and JUST FOOD!  Verdict is First Time & LAST TIME.  Not recommended!  You can do better elsewhere for food & service.
author: Aprams C.

description: I came here on a Saturday late afternoon, The shop was not too busy and the guy was super nice. He gave us suggestions for the crepes and they turned out to be very good. I had the chicken pesto and the boyfriend had the greek one. The greek one was ok since I don't like feta cheese. The salad on the side was soooooo good! I would definately come back here again and try one of their desset crepes!
author: Jessica A.

description: One of my fav food stops when i'm in a hurry, crepes are well filled and don't make me feel stuffed afterward when i'm running around.  Maybe a tad pricey for the quantity of food but with the fact that the orange juice is freshly squeezed in a machine behind the counter, written down as "SF healthy" on the bill :), i tend to believe prices are justified by quality.
author: Damien J.

description:
this place is a.ok for breakfast.  they have a nice outdoor patio.  the croissant sandwich is HUGE.  i was uncomfortably full for pretty much the entire day - i'd recommend you eat only half of it. 

they have mimosas.  always a plus.  no hard alcohol (although they do have that non-vodka vodka for bloody's and stuff).
author: jessie h.

description: The hot chocolate here is really bad. Don't get it. It's not sweet at all. It tastes like watered down brown sugar water. Also, I ordered the soup of the day (clam chowder) and it took them a really long time to bring it out. What's the point of having a soup of the day if it's not ready to be served?
author: Jonathan L.

description: Yummy crepe (got the strawberry blitz)...only thing I may have taken away was the sour cream component and replaced it with something else.  Service was great.  I came here after a movie at the Presidio and have to say it was the perfect way to end the evening.
author: Jolsna J.

description: A decent place to have brunch with friends after a night out in the City.  The food is decent but overall unspectacular, but the prices are fairly reasonable for the City.  Even on sunny Sunday mornings, the wait hasn't been that long for a table.  A solid place to start the day.
author: Anthony D.

description:
I think this place is underrated here on Yelp.  I eat at both the Haight and Chestnut locations and find them to be generally very good.

The menu is very broad - lots of breakfast choices, soups, crepes, sandwiches, meat entrees, and big dinner salads.  Most of the time you'll get something "good"; once in a while you'll get something "excellent" (order the Crab Cake Benedict for super-tastiness).

The staff is fast, efficient, and friendly.  The place is clean.  In the Marina location, the outdoor tables are lovely (and there's a back patio too).  This place is a solid regular go-to place for a quick tasty bite.
author: Chris F.

description:
Went here last night for dinner and had a good experience - good value for my $12. I got a chicken sandwich on foccacia (sp?) w/ pesto & roasted red peppers, lettuce & tomato. 

You order at the counter, and then they bring the food to you. The place is set up nicely, is clean, and conveniently located 

= I will be going back!
author: Caitlin B.

description:
We had a crepe and a burger. Both were pretty good.

The service was fast but it was quiet.

Prices are a little high.
author: H R.

description: Not sure which was around first...Squat and Gobble or The Crepe House...but their offerings are strangely similar, including the chalkboard menus and the bagel by number...Had the chicken pesto crepe (one of my favorites at The Crepe House on Polk) I was a bit disappointed.  Will go back and try it again, but if disappointed again, I will be back on Polk Street.
author: Karin C.

description:
I would like to just give a one word review: Pass

But, I can't resist adding a few words....

There is nothing special about this place and with the plethora of cafe/diners, I can't see the appeal of S&G. 

Self serve coffee is also a hassle.  I don't mind self-serve in a small homey diner with good prices and great coffee, but that is not how i would describe this S&G.  

Ambiance is also too cafeteria-like...... I will probably just go across the street to the Grove next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Mya P.

description: The S&G in the Castro is great.  The Haight is pretty good.  The Marina?  A total miss.  Went there for lunch today.  The place was a mess.  It took over 30 minutes to get a sandwich and tiny cup of soup. The soup was cold.  Couldn't flag down a waiter to get a new bowl...did flag down a busboy who argued with me after touching the outside of the cup.  (Huh?! Don't argue with me - go get a new bowl.. I'm sure the soup pan is sitting there on the stove all ready to go!  As it was, it just got stuck in the microwave and came back too hot to touch.  Jerk.)  Got the wrong side, got a snarl from the waiter upon comment and it took another 20 minutes to get a salad instead.  The Grove has nothing to worry about.  This place - yuk!
author: Bobbi C.

description: Excellent chicken salad sandwich, great prices, as well as amazing decor!  This is my new favorite Squat and Gobble (sorry West Portal)!  Because of the individual ordering and cash exchange, this is a great spot for large groups to meet up at.
author: Anthony B.

description: I have eaten here enough to know what it feels like to be unimpressed. Kinda like me at badlands on a tuesday night. The food isn't even so-so, the service sub par, the experience was memorable. Perhaps I shouldn't have come here for sunday brunch but my friends wanted something that had outdoor seating. Next time I'll know better.
author: James J.

description:
Like a baller with a tutu, any restaurant named Squat and Gobble has something to prove.  It's either the best food in the City or it is not. 
In this case it is not...with a BIG but. But....

It IS the ideal location to have brunch once you have two kids and are embarrassed to eat around town due to the low roar you bring with you.  The food is adequate - it fills you up.  They have a great kids menu.  And the service is quick and easy when there are enough places to sit.

For a weekend brunch there are rarely enough places to sit unless you arrive immediately after your 2 year old jumps into bed with you and says "I'm hungry" at 8am.
author: Jennifer A.

description: I stopped here for a quick lunch. The food is nothing special. I enjoyed to sit outside watching all the foot traffic of Marina.
author: Tracy N.

description: A great neighborhood spot for brunch - good food with lots of choice on the menu, nice people, good people-watching.  Don't expect the Ritz or anything - cause it's not that - but overall I always really like coming here (and the food has been good each time!)
author: Christin A.

description:
This place has great breakfast food.  I've been twice with large groups and it wasnt a problem.  

The coffee is pretty solid as well.  Its a great place to breakfast on a warm day because you can sit outside....
author: Richard C.

description: Really good lower haight omlette. Nice potatoes. Fresh OJ. Pretty crowded on a Sunday morning. Last time I went I had the Salmon Hash, pretty solid. I still like this place for a nice Sunday morning after a long night.
author: Mike C.

description: As my friend says, Squat and Barf.  Hamburger was raw; grilled chicken on the salad was overcooked.  If you want a side of chicken (very small side) with the chinese chicken salad, order it.  It comes with a MOUND of lettuce and about 4 bites of chicken.
author: Sonia C.

description: Went here on vacation- husband and I shared the pesto chicken crepe. Overall it was pretty good. I wouldn't go here for anything other than brunch or lunch, but overall pretty good for casual quick food!
author: Amanda D.

description: This place has so much potential and it has not lived up to the potential in the three times I have been. I have appropriately nicknamed the place (mess around with the words a little and you'll get what I mean), as it has not left me with a good taste in my mouth despite three attempts. Even the dessert crepe I tried was disappointing, however, the fresh squeezed orange juice makes this review go from one star to two.
author: Julia S.

description: A a definite disappointment.  I ordered the Thai steak and udon salad. It sounded good, light, and worth the eleven dollars I was spending for it. I sat down and waited for probably over twenty minutes for one salad. When it finally came I searched and searched through what looked liked a salad a kindergartner put together for noodles. I asked the server why it lacked the main ingredient and so he told me he would bring me a plate of noodles. About a minute later he comes out with a plate of oily spaghetti noodles. He apologizes and I ask him why there are no udon noodles and he replys that he has no idea. Not coming there again.
author: Apple P.

description: My mainstay on Sunday mornings.  Perfect if you can grab a seat on the sidewalk but the patio in back is also great (and heated-- a necessity since I am always freezing).  I love the upper haight and blueberry pancakes.  It can be annoyingly crowded with dressed up brunch goers (really?  knee high boots and makeup on a sunday morning??) but get there early and you skip the line.  After 11 expect to wait.
author: Beth V.

description: I work nearby and every 2 months or do go for lunch when someone else suggests it.  Everytime I go, I am reminded why I never want to go back.  The service is so slow, it is painful.  Recently, on a Friday, I waited 40 minutes with 2 friends for our lunch, so long that we were the last people in the dining room.  Even the waiters stopped making eye contact and filling our water glasses, a sure sign that they knew we had been waiting too long.  When I went to the counter and told the woman we were running out of time to get back for a meeting and had been waiting 40 minutes, our food appeared 2 minutes later.  So was it just sitting back there, all the time, ready to go?!  Honestly, don't waste your time on this place.  The crepes are ok, but certainly not worth the horrible wait!!
author: Jessica T.

description: Sunday...on the Chestnut meatmarket stroll...hungover...the Gobble come through...always. It's like the Crepeville of SF for all the D-town peeps.
author: Jon D.

description:
the marina makes me feel like a scuzzy dirty stinky punk.  i walk down chestnut street with pride.  and so, with pride, i walk my chelsea skinhead looking self into grove cafe to eat some late breakfast, and, decide that i hate all these button down untucked shirt loafer wearing, shiny gel hair, sharing a laptop with graphs networking, fake tan having, bleach blond ugg boot and yoga pants sporting...
well, i guess my tattoos are my way of keeping my skin looking beautiful.
Hell, i bleach my hair!  it takes two seconds for me to slide on my 25 year old ugg boots, while it take 10 minutes to lace up my doc's.
i work just as hard on my beer belly as the pilates people.  
anywhoo, i digress.
Awesome servers!  huge portions!  
my litmus test is two eggs over easy.  this squat and gobble passed with flying colors!
the edges of the eggs were perfectly white, not brown and chewy.
I like to use the corners of my toast to break and soak up the yolk.
I also happen to be a potato epicure, and their homefries with rosemary were simple and nice.  
my old man had blueberry pancakes, and some big ole omlet and i approve.  whipped cream is good with blueberries. 
oh, my only gripe is that they offer bloody mary, greyhound and other cocktails, but since they do not have a liquor license they use soju.  
otherwise the beer and mimosas are nice for breakfast.
thanks for reading!
author: yayoi s.

description:
I was very excited to try this new addition to the Marina.  I went for a late lunch on Sunday.  The place was packed twith the usual suspects newcomers alike.  The busy and loud atmosphere gives you a bit of an anxious feeling, definitely not a place that makes you feel comfortable hanging out in for any length of time.

I'm not usually a big fan of the order & pay and then wait for your number but the service was fairly good and attentive. 

I had the salmon salad which was a very healthy portion but if you don't pay attention, you will miss that there is salmon on it at all but it did have very nice slices of avocado on it.  The salad is served with the dressing on the side, which again, I'm not a fan.  I'm a big believer that the chef should know the exact proportion of salad to dressing and those who are not a fan, can order on the side.  

My friend had Puttanesca angel hair pasta and said it was good but would probably not order it again because the pasta was a bit overcooked.  

Unfortunately that day, I lost my wallet and in retracing my steps asked someone there if they had found it.  They had not and proceeded to lecture me on the fact that it would be really rare if someone had turned it in.  I emphatically disagreed because I've had my wallet returned in several times even in cities such as Hong Kong and New York.  And once again karma came through and an angel called me to say she had found my wallet.
author: Maria R.

description:
i visited this marina squat & gobble for brunch. 
their food is not that great - there is a lack of distinct flavor. (bland?)
i wish the staff could separate the butter from my bread, so i can spread the butter on myself instead of having the butter on the bread already. 
AND 
not to mention 
that by the time i had finished a glass of water, my food had still not come 
(about 15 minutes after i ordered)
i think i had to wait about a half hour for my food to come. 
waiting a half hour is a long time.
author: Court L.

description: The crab cakes are super and they have a great back patio. I love having lunch here! The staff is great and they've never disappointed.
author: Kell E.

description: Awful crepe.  Worst neighbors.  I'm writing this review at 3:30 am in the morning because they are doing construction outside right next to a dozen apartments!!!  Despite many complaints they still operate on a 24 hour routine with janitors coming in the middle of the night and wee hours in the morning.  Why support an unethical and inconsiderate chain restaurant when any other restaurant has better food anyway.
author: Yvonne H.

description:
not sure why the hype.  basically we decided to have breakfast there because we saw a line waiting.  so not worth it!  for example, a small glass of momosa is over $6!  it was nasty too.  Eggs are eggs.  It tasted no different than any other places.  French toast was OK but not worth the price.  The worst part is the wait.  Took freakin for ever!  Lame.  Want a good breakfast? Go across the street to Judy's.  At least you can sit under the sun where outside seating here is constantly under the shade.

My 1.5 cents
author: Mike H.

description: please open a squat & gobble in san diego. i can't live without you.
author: genevieve a.

description: i used to love this place, but the last few times have been extremely mediocre...there are many great breakfast places in the marina...abagails blows this place out of the water both price and quality...
author: Michelle N.

description:
we really like S&G and go there almost every weekend.  it's easy and convenient, clean and pretty consistent.  the breakfast crepes are delicious, and if you get fruit instead of potatoes, it's reasonably healthy.
coffee's good, and they have good mighty leaf tea.
one word about the new manager:  he's a total stress case.  he makes the anxiety level in this place go up a notch.  if you go up to the counter to get a glass of water, he makes you go back to the table so the waiter can bring it to you.  oh brother, how inefficient and frustrating, I just want a glass of water, and I'm not the queen of england.
he seems to have mellowed some, and I hope he continues going to yoga or taking ativan or whatever he's doing.
the food is a little bit up or down, and you can tell when they have a new chef.  the crepes yesterday were REALLY good.  new chef, luckily, a good one!!  we'll be back.  for its issues, S&G is a great place to have breakfast.
author: char s.

description: i thought this place was great! i went there for the first time this weekend and have been raving about it to all my friends. i got a crape with ice cream and whipped cream all for 7 bucks, VERY AFFORDABLE. my boyfriend got great pasta with prawns and mushrooms that was delicious. i highly recommend this place and will come back many more times!
author: Katherine M.

description: My friend ordered a dessert crepe, and I ordered the avocado/tomato/Mexican style crepe.  It wasn't horrible, it was just really unimpressive.  Waste of money, in my opinion.
author: Sarah S.

description: Cheese ravioli with prawns was good, but I didn't like the soup and the waiter kinda forgot about my soup for a while.
author: Peter W.

description: They had a great deal a few weeks ago. Two people for $30, which included two entrees, and appetizer, dessert, and wine. The food is very rich in flavor - and I'm guessing rich in calories, too. But every once in a while, it doesn't hurt too bad to eat unhealthy, does it? :)
author: Steve M.

description: Great neighborhood spot for breakfast or lunch.  The breakfast crepes are very good, and I love that they serve them all day long.  The orange juice is freshly squeezed and delicious.
author: M. J.

description: there's just not much to write about this place. it's like the crepevine, but not as good. the inside feels like a done up denny's.  there is a reason why there are lines at the grove and judy's and all other places nearby but not here.  this place reminds me of stacks in hayes valley. bleah. the positive is if you are starving and need to injest calories asap and can't wait in line elsewhere, this place will do.
author: Caroline I.

description: the burger - good. the lower haight - good. the mama mia - good. the crossaint sandwich - good. the almost 30min wait to get our food - not good.
author: tessie n.

description:
i like the salads; although i had a back experience with the crab cake eggs florentine...
the oven potatoes are great , nice buttery flavor
author: Peter L.

description: Food is strictly average-- I would rather go to Crepevine on Fillmore. But my biggest  gripe about this place is waiting for a table! The restaurant is small, space is tight and you would literally have to hover over someone to guilt them into leaving their table. The service is non-existent and it takes forever to get your food. Not a relaxing, enjoyable experience at all.
author: Mama L.

description: well i've been here twice now.  both times i got the filmore.  can't go wrong with omlettes.  i'd recommend going at night if you don't like waiting.  it was literally night and day compared to the last time i went at brunch time.
author: Hammer Time H.

description: i'll chime in here.  i was excited to have a new salad venue besides plutos move into the hood. on about the first night they opened i ordered two salads to go, one salmon cobb, one asian chicken.  the salmon cobb was great quality, taste, etc.  the asian chicken was missing about 1/2 the ingredients the menu claimed it had.  luckily i had some of these things at home to doctor it up, but when i am paying $25 for two take-out salads, i kind of want them to be right.  haven't returned.
author: e w.

description: I notice I come to Squat and Gobble more and more now. The food is decent. I think their eggs and pasta is pretty good. Their salads are not too great. I often come here when I can't get a seat over at the Grove across the street. The greatest thing about Squat and Gobble is that they have FREE Internet with good coverage, which can sometimes be a little frustrating at the Grove. The one thing I wish they had at Squat and Gobble is more snack foods.
author: Chanli S.

description: Use to be good, then they changed the menu. All of their sandwitches are PRE MADE. What kind of restaurant doesnt make their food as ordered. They changed the entire menu as well-terrible now!
author: Lesley W.

description: Came here on Easter Sunday after walking around and finding most places were closed.  The food is delicious and the service was fast.  I first thought this place was one of a kind until I saw the menu and noticed they have other locations in San Francisco.  The potatoes are delicious and I love the chalk board menu.
author: P L.

description: I have to say that I have never been disapointed with my dining experiences here. I know that I can expect the my meal to taste the same and come out hot.  You can never go wrong with this place. The choices are endless no matter what you are hungry for.
author: Cortney H.

description: decent food, for decent prices, though allot a considerable amount of time to dine here.  i get a savory crepe every time, and it's just OK; nothing special.  seemingly low in flavor/salt, so that may be good for the sodium-conscious.  we sit outside every time, and there's great people watching, and the servers are nice to our dog.  if you're in a rush, however, i wouldn't recommend squatting & gobbling here.  average wait time for simple dishes (chicken salad & a crepe) is approx. 30 min.
author: Meno T.

description: I love this place. It's wonderful for lunch, dinner or a weekend brunch. My personal favorite is the salmon sandwich, but there are many other tasty options, including tons of big and satisfying salads.
author: Stephanie B.

description: the food is yummy and the outdoor patio is fabulous on sunny days!
author: michele m.
